name: Mediterranean burger with pepper relish
instructions: To make the relish, clean, wash, core the peppers and cut into quarters. Peel the garlic and put it with the quartered peppers in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 20 seconds/speed setting 4. Then remove the mixture and reserve. Peel and halve the 2 onions for the relish and the patties and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug using the turbo button/2 seconds. Remove half the quantity of chopped onion and put to one side. Use the spatula to scrape the rest of the onion down the inside of the blender jug, add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/3 minutes. Add the pepper and garlic mixture, add paprika powder and, the measuring beaker not inserted, continue to sauté for 5 seconds/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add 8 tablespoons of water, the vinegar, sugar and 1 pinch each of salt and pepper and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C until the mixture becomes creamy. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Remove the relish from the blender jug and cool before serving. Clean the blender jug.

To make the patties, dice the bread roll and soak in the milk for 10 minutes. Then squeeze out thoroughly. Clean and wash the courgette, cut into 4 pieces and put them in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces of courgette down the inside of the blender jug. Then add the previously chopped onion and all the other ingredients. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 2. Season again with salt and pepper, if necessary.
For the toppings, wash the lettuce leaves and shake them dry. Wash and dry the beef tomato, cut into eighths and remove the stalk. Carefully cut the feta in to thin slices.
With damp hands, shape four patties from the minced beef and, in a hot grill pan, grill or fry them on both sides for 3 minutes each. Cut the ciabatta roll in half and briefly toast the cut sides.

Spread the lower half of the rolls with the relish. Place the salad leaves, tomato slices and the patties on top. Arrange the feta on top of these and sprinkle a pinch of pepper over the burgers. Garnish with olives, place the upper half of the roll on top and serve the burger with the rest of the relish.

ingredients.name: 120 ml lukewarm milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Wash 4 large green lettuce leaves, shake them dry and set them to one side.
Trim and wash 2 red peppers (300 g), cut them into quarters and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Decant the pepper and garlic mixture into a medium-sized bowl.
Peel and halve 2 onions (130 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Take half of the onions out, transfer to a small bowl and set to one side.
Use the spatula to scrape the rest of the onion down the inside of the blender jug and add 2 tbsp oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add the pepper and garlic mixture and ½ tsp paprika.
Add 8 tbsp water, 4 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 pinch of salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Decant the relish from the blender jug and cool before serving.
Clean out the blender jug.
Place a container on top of the blender jug and weigh out 120 g lukewarm milk into it.
Cut 1 dry bread roll into dice and soak in the lukewarm milk for 10 minutes, then squeeze out thoroughly.
Trim and wash 1 courgette (200 g), cut into 4 pieces and put into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces of courgette down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the previously chopped onion and the squeezed-out bread.
Add 400 g minced beef.
Add 2 eggs (large), ½ tsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Season with more salt and pepper if desired.
Weigh out 1 beef tomato (200 g) and wash and dry it.
Cut the tomato into 8 slices, remove the stem end and set it to one side.
Carefully cut 200 g feta cheese into thin slices and set them to one side.
With damp hands, shape 4 patties from the minced beef and grill or fry them in a hot grill pan on both sides for 3 minutes each.
Cut 4 ciabatta rolls in half and briefly toast the cut sides.
Spread the lower halves of the rolls with the relish. Place the salad leaves, tomato slices and the patties on top.
Arrange the feta on top of these and sprinkle over a pinch of pepper. Garnish with olives.
Place the upper halves of the rolls on top and serve the burgers with the rest of the relish.

name: Thai curry soup
instructions: Peel the ginger and garlic, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.

Decant and rinse out the blender jug. Wash the lemon grass, cut into long pieces and flatten by hitting them with a saucepan. Trim the mushrooms and cut large ones in half. Peel the carrots and cut into thin slices. Wash and halve the tomatoes. Wash the chicken breast fillet, pat dry, cut in half horizontally and cut into slices ½ cm thick.

Gently warm up the coconut oil until it is liquid and mix half of it with the curry paste. Rub it into the chicken. Put the chicken in the remaining coconut oil in the blender jug, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button, then remove.

Put the ginger, garlic, lemon grass, carrots and mushrooms into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, stew with the roast button/5 minutes. Pour in the coconut milk and stock at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil with the reserve button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add the chicken and tomatoes and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook the soup with the reserve button/5 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper, stir in the sauce thickener and, with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil again with the reserve button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Remove the lemon grass stems and serve the soup.

ingredients.name: 600 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash 2 stems of lemongrass, cut them into long pieces, flatten them by hitting them with a saucepan, then set them to one side.
Trim 200 g shiitake mushrooms and cut large ones in half, then set them to one side.
Peel 350 g carrots, cut them into thin slices, then set them to one side.
Wash and halve 300 g cherry tomatoes, then set them to one side.
Weigh out 500 g chicken breast fillet.
Wash the chicken breast fillet, pat dry, cut in half horizontally and cut into slices ½ cm thick, then set them to one side.
Peel 1 piece of ginger (2 cm) and 3 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Transfer the ginger and garlic mixture to a small bowl.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Gently warm up 5 tbsp coconut oil until it is liquid and mix half of it with 4 tsp Thai curry paste. Rub it into the chicken.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put the chicken and the rest of the coconut oil into the blender jug.
Remove the meat from the blender jug and set it to one side.
Put the ginger and garlic mixture, lemongrass, mushrooms and sliced carrots into the blender jug
Add 600 g unsweetened coconut milk at room temperature.
Pour over 600 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add the meat and the halved tomatoes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add 20 g sauce thickener and stir in briefly with the spatula.
Remove the lemongrass stems and serve the soup.

name: Vanilla sugar
instructions: Cut the vanilla pod across in half. Slice both halves lengthwise with a sharp knife and pull apart slightly. Fill a jar with half the sugar, add the vanilla pod pieces and top up with the remaining sugar. Secure with a lid and shake the jar well. Leave to stand for at least 2 days.

Put the vanilla sugar mixture into the blender jug and crush with the measuring beaker in place for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Return the vanilla sugar to the jar, secure with a lid and store in a cool cupboard keep it dry until use.

TIP
1 teaspoon of homemade vanilla sugar corresponds to 3 teaspoons of commercially produced vanilla sugar.

steps.text: Place a screw-top jar on top of the blender jug and weigh in 125 g sugar.
Cut a vanilla pod in half, slit open both halves by scoring them with a sharp knife, pull them gently apart and add them to the sugar in the jar.

Place the screw-top jar on top of the blender jug and weigh in another 
125 g sugar.
Shake the jar well and leave it to stand for at least 2 days.
Put the vanilla sugar mixture into the blender jug.
Return the vanilla sugar to the jar and keep it dry until use.

name: Melting chocolate
instructions: With the measuring beaker in place, put the chocolate in pieces in the blender jug for 15 seconds/setting 8 to crush them.
Use the spatula to scrape the chocolate down the inside of the blender jug. Melt for 2 minutes 30 seconds/speed setting 1/50 °C with the measuring beaker in place.
If the chocolate is not entirely melted scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and melt for a further 1 minute and 30 seconds/speed setting 1/50 °C.

TIP
Dip biscuits or nut wedges into the melted chocolate as decoration.

steps.text: Put 200 g chocolate coating or chocolate in pieces in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the chocolate down the inside of the blender jug.
If the chocolate is not entirely melted scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug, then continue with the next step.

name: Beating egg whites
instructions: Insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug.

Pour the egg whites into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, beat until stiff for 4 minutes 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Half way through, add a pinch of salt via the filler opening.
TIP: To beat egg whites, the blender jug and the mixer attachment must be cool, clean and free of grease.

steps.text: Tip: To beat egg whites, the blender jug and the mixer attachment must be cool, clean and free of grease.
Insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug.
Pour 4 egg whites (medium) into the blender jug.
Halfway through the next step, add a pinch of salt via the filler opening.

name: Boiling eggs
instructions: Pour 500 ml water into the blender jug.
Place the eggs in to the cooking pot, place this in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, boil for the length of time according to hardness required/speed setting 1/120 °C.
9 minutes: soft boiled egg
11 minutes: egg yolk buttery
14 minutes: hard boiled

TIP
To make a larger quantity of hard-boiled eggs, for an egg salad, for example, place the eggs in the cooking pot and the shallow steamer basket and cook them with the steamer button/12 minutes.

steps.text:
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place 4 eggs (medium) into the cooking pot and place it in the blender jug.

In the next step, set the time according to hardness required. 
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg

name: Pancakes
instructions: Put all the ingredients except the butter in the blender jug and process with the measuring beaker in place for 35 seconds/speed setting 4 to make a smooth batter.
Allow it to rest for 10 minutes.
Heat the butter and fry the batter in portions measured by a ladle.
Fry the pancakes on each side for about 2 minutes until golden.
Keep the finished pancakes in a warm place and fry another 9 from the remaining batter.

TIP
Pancakes are delicious with sweet and savoury fillings, and also simply with fruit, jam, ice-cream or sprinkled with a mixture of sugar and cinnamon.

steps.text: Pour 800 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 4 eggs (large) and 1 pinch of salt.
Add 500 g flour.
Leave the batter to rest for 10 minutes.
Heat a little butter in a pan and add the batter in portions, measured out with a ladle. Fry the pancakes on each side for about 2 minutes until golden.
Keep the finished pancakes in a warm place and fry another 9 from the remaining batter.

name: Almond milk
instructions: Put the almonds in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 10 seconds/speed setting 10.
Add the water, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 10.
Sieve the resulting milk though a fine-mesh sieve into a suitable container whilst squeezing the solid mass firmly. Store in a cool place and consume within three days.

VARIATION: COCONUT MILK Replace the almonds with 100 g of coconut flakes. Follow the same method as for almond milk TIP It is a shame to throw away the remaining pulp (the squeezed almonds or coconut flakes). The pulp can be used in many ways. Add it spoon by spoon to muesli, cake batter, smoothies or even bread dough. Simply stir the pulp in and bake.

ingredients.name: 700 ml still mineral water or boiled and cooled tap water

steps.text: Put 150 g whole blanched almonds into the blender jug.
Add 700 g water.
Strain the resulting milk through a fine-mesh sieve whilst squeezing the solid mass firmly. Store in a cool place and consume within 3 days.

name: Yoghurt
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 50 °C.
Put the milk at room temperature in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 7 minutes/speed setting 1/45 °C.
Add the yoghurt, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 3 minutes/speed setting 2.
Sterilise screw-top jars in hot water and leave to dry upside down on a tea towel.
Pour the milk and yoghurt mixture into the jars, close and put in the dark oven, wrapped in tea-towels for 6 hours. Ensure the oven is turned off. Do not touch the jars and do not open the oven door.
Then store the yoghurt in the refrigerator until required.

TIP
The yoghurt keeps in the refrigerator for approximately 3 days.

steps.text: Sterilise 4 screw-top jars (290 ml each) in hot water and leave to dry upside down on a tea towel.
Pre-heat the oven to 50 °C (top and bottom heat).
Pour 1000 g UHT milk into the blender jug.
Add 150 g Greek yoghurt.
Turn off the oven.
Pour the milk and yoghurt mixture into the prepared jars, screw their lids on and put them in the dark oven, wrapped in tea towels, for 6 hours.
Do not touch the jars or open the oven door during this time.
Then store the yoghurt in the refrigerator until required. Consume within 3 days.

name: Cooking pasta
instructions: Pour 1.7 litres of cold water into the blender jug, add the salt and with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Add the pasta via the filler opening and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook the pasta with the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Drain pasta in a sieve and serve mixed with butter if desired.

TIP
Spaghetti can also be cooked according to this method. Simply add to the boiling water via the lid opening.

steps.text: Weigh out 300 g pasta and set it to one side.
Pour 1700 g water into the blender jug.
Add 1½ tsp salt.
Add the pasta via the filler opening.
In the next step, adjust the time setting to cook the pasta according to the packet instructions.
Drain the pasta in a sieve and serve mixed with 1 tbsp butter if desired.

name: Boiling rice
instructions: Put the rice in the cooking pot, insert the blender jug, sprinkle the salt on top and pour 1.5 litres of cold water into the blender jug above the rice. With the measuring beaker in place, boil for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Half way through, stir once with the spatula.
Season to taste with salt and butter.

TIP
Cooking time can vary depending on the type of rice.

steps.text: Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 200 g parboiled rice into the cooking pot.
Sprinkle 1 tsp salt on top and pour 1500 g cold water into the blender jug above the rice.
Stir the rice once with the spatula.
Add salt and 1 tsp butter to taste.

name: Boiling potatoes
instructions: Pour 500 ml water into the blender jug. Thoroughly wash and scrub the potatoes, place in the cooking pot and place this in the blender jug.

For boiled potatoes, peel and wash the potatoes, cut into quarters or eighths, depending on size and place in the cooking pot.
Sprinkle the salt and caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins) and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam using the steamer button/15 minutes.

steps.text: Weigh out 800 g small potatoes, wash and scrub them thoroughly and then set them to one side.
For boiled potatoes, peel and wash the potatoes, then cut them into quarters or eighths, depending on their size.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place the cooking pot in the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the cooking pot.
Sprinkle in 1 tsp caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins) and 1 tsp salt.

name: Mashed potatoes
instructions: Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes, put in the cooking pot, hang it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.

Remove the cooking pot, pour away the water from the blender jug, put the potatoes with the milk at room temperature and butter in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 6 seconds/speed setting 6.
Season with nutmeg, pepper and salt and stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2. Serve the mashed potatoes hot.

VARIATIONS Season with a little freshly grated horseradish. Cook 350 g diced Hokkaido pumpkin with the potatoes. Stir 100 g freshly grated Parmesan into the mashed potato. Mix in freshly chopped herbs.

ingredients.name: nutmeg, pepper and salt to taste

steps.text: Weigh out 800 g floury potatoes. Peel, wash and halve them, then put them in the cooking pot.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Put the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Remove the cooking pot and pour the water out of the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the blender jug.
Add 250 g milk.
Add 20 g butter.
Season with freshly grated nutmeg, salt and pepper, and serve hot.

name: Potato fritters
instructions:
Peel, wash and halve the potatoes and put them into the blender jug raw. Peel and halve the onions and add to the potatoes.
Add the cornflour, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 12 seconds/speed setting 5.
Add the eggs, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 3. Season again with salt and pepper.
Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan, put 1 large tablespoon of the mixture and fry little potato fritters one by one.
TIP Serve the potato fritters according to taste with apple sauce, cranberries or smoked salmon.

steps.text: Weigh out 1000 g floury potatoes. Peel, wash and halve them, then put them into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (100 g) and add them to the potatoes.
Add 20 g cornflour.
Add 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Add 2 eggs (large).
Season again with salt and pepper.
Heat 5 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan, add 1 large tbsp of the mixture at a time, and fry the little potato fritters one by one.
Serve the potato fritters.

name: Vegetable stock concentrate
instructions:
Clean, wash, dry and coarsely chop the vegetables and fresh herbs. Remove the leaves of the herbs from the stalks.
Finely chop together with the oregano, marjoram and pepper in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 20 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the salt, room-temperature water and olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, mix finely for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool.

TIPS Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock. 
If adults are eating without children, the stock can be replaced by white wine. If cooled well, the stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 4 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs to taste
30 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Prepare 3 sterile screw-top jars (150 ml each).
Wash and dry 4 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs of your choice, then tear the leaves from their stems and put them into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (100 g), peel 2 garlic cloves, then put both into the blender jug.
Put 100 g sundried tomatoes into the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 2 carrots (100 g), but them into chunks and add them to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 stick of celery (100 g), cut it into chunks and add them to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 piece of parsley root (100 g), cut it into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash ½ leek (100 g), cut it into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp dried oregano, 1 tsp dried marjoram and 1 tsp ground pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 25 g sea salt.
Add 30 ml water at room temperature and 2 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool.

name: Broccoli salad
instructions: Wash, trim and pat the broccoli dry and divide into florets. Put 300 g broccoli florets into the blender jug.

Wash, trim and quarter the pepper. Add the pepper, pine nuts and remaining ingredients to the broccoli in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 5. If necessary, repeat the procedure, with the measuring beaker in place, for 5 seconds/speed setting 5.
TIP: You can also use 150 g each of broccoli and cauliflower florets and replace the pine nuts with sunflower seeds, walnuts or cashew nuts.

steps.text: Wash, trim and pat dry 600 g broccoli and divide into florets.
Put 300 g broccoli florets into the blender jug.
Weigh out 1 red pepper (150 g), then trim, wash and quarter it and add it to the blender jug.
Add 50 g pine nuts.
Add 3 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp maple syrup, 1 tbsp mustard, 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Repeat the process if necessary.

name: Potato gratin
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C and grease an oven-proof dish (31 x 24 cm) with butter.

Cut the cheese into pieces and put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 8.  Then decant and reserve. Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into wafer-thin slices, or grate. Arrange in the greased oven-proof dish.

Peel the garlic and shallots, and cut the shallots into quarters. With the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug using the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the cream, vegetable stock at room temperature, pepper, salt, nutmeg and bay leaf and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.

Remove the bay leaf from the sauce, and pour the finished sauce over the potatoes. Sprinkle the chopped cheese evenly over the potatoes. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown. If necessary, extend the baking time if the potatoes are not cooked through. Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes.
TIPS: Serve the gratin as an accompaniment to fish or as the main dish with a fresh salad. Refine the gratin with diced bacon or strips of boiled ham.

ingredients.name: 100 ml hearty vegetable stock, at room temperature

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat) and grease an oven-proof dish with butter.
Add 200 g mountain cheese or Emmental in chunks, the rind removed, to the cold blender jug.
Add 200 g mountain cheese or Emmental in chunks, the rind removed, to the cold blender jug.
Transfer the cheese to a small bowl.
Peel and wash 1000 g waxy potatoes, and grate or cut them into wafer-thin slices.
Arrange the potato slices in the greased oven-proof dish.
Weigh out 2 shallots (40 g), peel and quarter them, and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 350 g cream.
Pour in 100 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Add a pinch of pepper, ¼ tsp salt, 2 pinches of nutmeg and 1 bay leaf.
Remove the bay leaf from the sauce, pour the finished sauce over the potatoes and sprinkle the chopped cheese over the top.
Bake in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown.
Extend the baking time if the potatoes are not yet cooked.
Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes.

name: Beef stock concentrate
instructions:
Dice the meat (3 cm squares), put in freezer for 20 minutes and then, in two portions, chop in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place, for 30 seconds/speed setting 8. Put in another container.
Clean, wash, dry and coarsely chop the vegetables and fresh herbs. Remove the leaves of the herbs from the stalks. Finely chop with thyme and pepper in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 20 seconds/speed setting 6. If necessary, use the spatula to help.
Add the salt, room-temperature meat stock and olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, mix finely for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool.

TIPS Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock. If adults are eating without children, the stock can be replaced with dry red wine. If cooled well, the stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 4 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs to taste
50 ml meat stock at room temperature

steps.text: Sterilise 4 screw-top jars (approx. 250 ml each).
Weigh out 300 g lean beef (no bones or fat).
Dice the meat (3 cm squares) and chill in the freezer for 20 minutes.
Put half of the beef into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to a bowl.
Put the remaining half of the beef into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to the bowl.
Peel 2 onions (100 g) and 2 garlic cloves, halve the onions and put both into the blender jug.
Add 100 g sundried tomatoes.
Clean, peel and wash 2 carrots (100 g), cut them into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 stick of celery (100 g), slice it roughly and add to the blender jug.
Weigh out a 100 g piece of parsley root, clean, peel, wash, roughly chop and add to the blender jug.
Clean, peel, wash and roughly chop ½ leek (100 g), then add it to the blender jug.
Wash and dry 4 sprigs of mixed fresh herbs of your choice, tear the leaves from the stalks, and add them to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp dried thyme and 1 tsp ground pepper.
Add 25 g sea salt.
Add 50 ml water at room temperature, 2 tbsp olive oil and the meat.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool. Store in a cool place.

name: Chicken stock concentrate
instructions: Dice the meat (3 cm squares), put in the freezer for 20 minutes and then, in two portions, chop in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 25 seconds/speed setting 8. Put in another container.

Clean, wash, dry and coarsely chop the vegetables and fresh herbs. Remove the leaves of the herbs from the stalks. Finely chop together with the marjoram and pepper in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 20 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add salt, 50 ml water, the oil and the meat and cook everything, the measuring beaker not inserted, for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool. Store in a cool place.
TIPS Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock. If cooled well, the chicken stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 4 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs to taste

steps.text: Sterilise 3 screw-top jars (200 ml each).
Weigh out 400 g skinless chicken.
Cut into cubes (3 cm squares) and chill in the freezer for 20 minutes.
Put half of the cubed chicken into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to a bowl.
Put the remaining half of the cubed chicken into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to the bowl.
Peel and halve 2 onions (100 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 2 carrots (100 g), cut them into chunks and add them to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 stick of celery (100 g), roughly chop it and add it to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 piece of parsley root (100 g), cut it into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash ½ leek (100 g), roughly chop it and add it to the blender jug.
Wash and dry 4 sprigs of mixed fresh herbs of your choice, tear the leaves from their stalks and add to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp dried marjoram and 1 tsp white pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 25 g sea salt.
Add 50 g water.
Add 2 tbsp sunflower oil and the chopped meat.
Put the lid on the blender jug.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool. Store in a cool place.

name: Basic white sauce
instructions: Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place , melt for 2 seconds/speed setting 2/ 90 °C.
Insert mixer attachment, add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Then remove the mixer attachment.
Add the warm stock, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/ speed setting 6.
Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

VARIATION
Season the sauce if desired with nutmeg or lemon juice. You can vary the sauce by adding grated cheese, freshly chopped herbs, tomato purée, mustard or grated horseradish.

steps.text: Put 60 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment.
Add 50 g flour.
Remove the mixer attachment.
Add 500 g warm vegetable stock.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

name: Hollandaise sauce
instructions:
First, ensure all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 6 seconds/speed setting 2/70 °C. Decant and let the blender jug cool down for 10 minutes.

Insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug. Add the egg yolk and warm stock to the blender jug and emulsify with the measuring beaker in place for 8 minutes/speed setting 3/70 °C. After stirring for 3 minutes, pour the melted butter slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips past the measuring beaker onto the moving blade. Add the butter over a period of 2 minutes.
Season the sauce to taste with salt, pepper and lemon juice and serve immediately.

TIP If the sauce is not creamy enough, allow the contents of the jug to cool to 50 °C (see display) and beat the sauce again with the mixer attachment inserted and the measuring beaker in place for 30 seconds/speed setting 5. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name: 2 tbsp chicken stock at room temperature or white wine
salt, pepper or cayenne pepper, and lemon juice to taste

steps.text: First, ensure that all of the ingredients are at room temperature.
Put 180 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Decant the melted butter into a bowl and leave the blender jug to cool for 10 minutes.
Insert the mixer attachment.
Add 2 tbsp chicken stock at room temperature and 3 very fresh egg yolks (medium) to the blender jug.
In the next step, after stirring for 3 minutes, pour the cooled butter very slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (with the measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in.
Season the sauce to taste with salt, pepper and 1 tsp lemon juice, and serve immediately.

name: Béarnaise sauce
instructions: Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 4 minutes/speed setting 2/70 °C. Transfer and let the blender jug cool down for 15 minutes.

Peel the shallot, put it in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop using the turbo button/3 seconds. Using the spatula, scrape down the inner sides of the blender jug, add the hot chicken stock, vinegar, tarragon and crushed peppercorns to the shallot and, the measuring beaker not inserted, slightly reduce for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C. Pour out through a sieve, reserving the liquid stock, and cool for 15 minutes. Do not rinse out the blender jug.

Put the egg yolk and the liquid stock into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 6 seconds/speed setting 5. Insert the mixer attachment, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat everything for 7 minutes/speed setting 3/70 °C. After 2 minutes, start to pour the cooled butter slowly onto the lid of the blender jug, so that it drips gradually onto the moving blade. Add the cayenne pepper, parsley and chervil, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 30 seconds/speed setting 3. Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
TIP: If adults are eating without children, the chicken stock can be replaced by white wine.

steps.text: Put 200 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Decant and leave the blender jug to cool down for 15 minutes.
Peel 1 shallot (30 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 3 seconds.
Using the spatula, scrape the chopped shallot down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 100 g hot chicken stock.
Add 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp freshly chopped tarragon and 3 crushed peppercorns.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour out through a sieve, reserving the liquid stock, and leave it to cool for 15 minutes.
Rinse out the blender jug with cold water.
Tip 4 egg yolks (medium) and the cooled liquid stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
In the next step, after 2 minutes, pour the cooled butter slowly onto the lid (with the measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in.
Add 1 pinch of Cayenne pepper, 1 tsp freshly chopped parsley and 1 tsp chopped chervil.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

name: Mustard sauce
instructions: Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker inserted, heat for 4 minutes/speed setting 2/ 100 °C.
Add the milk and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 6.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C. Add the mustard, and with the measuring beaker in place, simmer again for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Add ½ teaspoon of salt, 2 pinches of pepper, 1 pinch of nutmeg and the lemon juice, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for another 20 seconds/speed setting 5.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 2.

steps.text: Put 40 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 40 g flour.
Add 400 g milk.
Add 3 tbsp mustard through the filler opening in the lid, then put the measuring beaker back in place.
Add ½ tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper, 1 pinch of nutmeg and 1 tsp lemon juice.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

name: Parsley sauce
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Put them into the blender jug and chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Then remove, set aside and rinse out the blender jug.

Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug. Set the appliance, the measuring beaker not inserted, to 9 minutes/speed setting 2/105 °C and switch on. After 2 minutes, add the flour by the teaspoonful through the lid opening. After another minute, slowly pour the room-temperature stock through the lid opening. Then close the lid opening with the measuring beaker while the machine is still in operation.
If the sauce is not sufficiently thick, continue to cook, the measuring beaker not inserted, for another 2 minutes/speed setting 2/105 °C.
Add the crème fraîche, lemon juice and 3 tablespoons parsley, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 45 seconds/speed setting 4. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

TIP
Use the rest of the parsley as a garnish.

ingredients.name: ½ l vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of parsley, shake dry, tear the leaves from the stalks and put them into the blender jug.
Remove the parsley and rinse out the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put a container on the blender jug , measure out 500 g vegetable stock and set to one side.
Put a plate on top of the blender jug, weigh out 40 g flour and set to one side.
Put 40 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
In the next step, after 2 minutes add the flour by the teaspoonful via the lid opening.
Then, slowly pour in the stock and insert the measuring beaker.
If the sauce is not thick enough, carry out the following step. Otherwise, you can skip it.
Add 60 g crème fraîche.
Add 1 tsp lemon juice and 3 tbsp chopped parsley.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

name: Béchamel sauce
instructions: Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 3 minutes/speed setting 2/ 90 °C.
Add the flour, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 4 minutes/speed setting 2/ 100 °C.
Add the milk and, the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice.
Scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for another 5 seconds/speed setting 5.
TIP Refine the béchamel with saffron or replace some of the milk with stock, cream or dry white wine.

ingredients.name: ½ l milk (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)
salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice to taste

steps.text: Put 50 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 50 g flour.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 500 g milk.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice.
Use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.

name: Shortcrust pastry
instructions: Add the butter in chunks, sugar, salt, egg and flour to the blender jug and knead, with the measuring beaker in place, using the knead button/1 minute 30 seconds into a smooth dough. If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tablespoon of cold water and knead, with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 4. Roll the dough into a ball and wrap in cling film. Allow to rest for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.

Pre-heat the oven to the temperature specified in your recipe. Put a little butter in the tin and spread with a brush. If the pastry is pre-baked without pulses, the side of the tin should not be greased as the pastry will become soft on account of the high butter content and will slip down during baking.

Using a rolling pin, roll out the pastry into a thin layer between two layers of cling film. The size of the rolled out pastry depends on the size of the tin you are using. If the edge of the tin is also to be lined with pastry, it should be rolled out to the size of the springform tin plus about 4 cm. Place the rolled out pastry without cling film in the baking tin, and if necessary pull up an edge. Put the pastry into the oven immediately. If further steps need to be carried out according to the recipe, it is best to store the pastry in the tin in the refrigerator until needed.

If the shortcrust pastry base is baked with a rim and without a topping, it should be "baked blind" so that the edge of the pastry does not collapse during baking and so that no unsightly bubbles form on the base. To do this, cover the pastry with greaseproof paper and fill the tin to the top with pulses. For bases without edges or shortcrust pastry, which is only pre-baked, it is sufficient to prick the base several times with a fork.

Bake or pre-bake the pastry as indicated in the recipe. After baking, loosen the edge of the springform tin and allow the pastry to cool in the tin for 10 minutes. Only then remove entirely from the tin and allow to cool completely on a cake rack. Since shortcrust pastry crumbles easily, it should be handled very carefully.

VARIATION: To make a savoury shortcrust pastry (e.g. for a quiche), mix 200 g plain flour (type 405), 100 g cold butter, 1 egg (medium) and ½ teaspoon salt with the measuring beaker in place, using the knead button/2 minutes.

ingredients.name: soft butter and flour for the tin
if necessary 500 g pulses for baking blind

steps.text: Put 160 g refrigerated butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 80 g sugar.
Add 1 pinch of salt and 1 refrigerated egg (medium).
Put 300 g flour into the blender jug.
If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tbsp cold water and carry out the following step.
Roll the dough into a ball, wrap it in cling film and leave to rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to the temperature specified in your recipe and follow the rest of the steps given for the prepared dough.

name: Sponge mixture
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C.
Line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper or grease the base of a springform tin.

Insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug. Put the eggs, sugar and vanilla sugar in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 5 seconds/speed setting 3/37 °C. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, beat for 5 minutes/speed setting 4.
Mix together the flour and cornflour, add to the blender jug with the salt and fold in, with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Pour the mixture onto the baking tin, smooth out and bake for 7 minutes.

Spread out a damp tea-towel and sprinkle with sugar. Remove the sponge from the oven and turn out immediately onto the tea-towel so that that the greaseproof paper is facing upwards. Sprinkle the paper with cold water and carefully peel it away. Roll up the sponge immediately using the tea-towel and allow to cool. Continue to follow the recipe.

Alternatively, pour the mixture into a springform tin, smooth and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the tin from the oven and carefully release the sponge from the edge of the tin using a knife. Then loosen the springform tin and drop the base onto a cake rack. Allow to cool, then continue according to the recipe.

VARIATION
To make a chocolate sponge, mix in 3 tablespoons of baking cocoa with the flour, cornflour and salt and add to the mixture.

ingredients.name: MAKES 12 PIECES OR 1 SWISS ROLL (TIN 26 cm Ø OR BAKING SHEET).

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (upper and lower heat).
Line a baking tin with greaseproof paper.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Add 150 g sugar.
Add 4 eggs and 1 sachet of vanilla sugar.
Put a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 75 g flour.
Weigh in 75 g cornflour and mix together with the flour.
Add the flour and cornflour mixture and 1 pinch of salt to the blender jug.
Pour the mixture onto the baking tin, spread it smooth and bake for 7 minutes.
Spread out a damp tea towel and sprinkle with sugar.
Remove the sponge from the oven and turn it out immediately onto the tea towel, so that the greaseproof paper is facing upwards.
Sprinkle the paper with cold water and carefully peel it away.
Roll up the sponge immediately using the tea towel and leave it to cool. Continue to follow the recipe.

name: Spicy yeast dough
instructions: Pour the milk, yeast and sugar into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 3 seconds/speed setting 1/37 °C.
Add the butter in chunks, egg, flour and salt, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead using the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough.
Put the yeast dough in a bowl, cover and allow to prove in a warm place for 30 minutes, until the volume has doubled.

TIPS The lower the yeast content and the longer the proving time, the better the taste and consistency of the baked goods will be. If there is enough time, you can use half the quantity of yeast with at least twice the proving time. Spicy yeast dough is suitable for pizza, bread, rolls, stick bread, lye pastry, 1 pull-apart bread in a loaf tin 12 x 30 cm or 20 yeast buns.

ingredients.name: 1 cube fresh yeast (42 g) or 2 sachets of dried yeast (7 g per sachet)

steps.text: Pour 220 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp sugar.
Add 1 cube of fresh yeast (40 g) or 2 sachets of dried yeast.
Put 80 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 500 g flour.
Add 1 egg (medium or large) and 1 tsp salt.
Put the yeast dough into a bowl, cover and leave to prove in a warm place for at least 30 minutes, until it has doubled in volume.

name: Courgette and carrot fritters with a yoghurt dip
instructions: Mix the yoghurt with the lemon juice and mixed herbs and season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill until ready to serve. Wash the coriander, shake it dry, remove the leaves from the stems and put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Then decant and reserve.

Wash, dry and trim the courgettes. Then cut in half, remove the cores with a teaspoon and cut them into pieces of 3 cm long. Put the courgette pieces in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, and chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 4. Decant into a large fine sieve, mix with 2 pinches of pepper and let them stand. The liquid will draw out of the courgettes.

In the meantime, peel the carrots, cut into pieces 3 cm long, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Squeeze out the courgette pieces in the sieve thoroughly, and add them (without the drained-off liquid) and also the eggs, flour and coriander to the now grated vegetable mixture. With the measuring beaker in place, fold in with the reverse button/25 seconds/speed setting 3. Season to taste with ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 1. Season to taste with ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 1.

Heat up 2 tablespoons of oil in a frying pan. Make vegetable fritters from the mixture and fry one after the other on both sides until crispy. Heat more oil in the pan if necessary. Serve the fritters with the yoghurt dip.

steps.text: Place a container on top of the blender jug and weigh in 200 g natural yoghurt.
Mix the natural yoghurt with 1 tbsp lemon juice and 5 tbsp chopped mixed herbs. Season to taste with 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper. Chill until ready to serve.
Wash ½ bunch of coriander, shake it dry, tear the leaves from their stems and put them into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped coriander to a bowl.
Wash, dry and trim 2 courgettes (400 g).
Cut the courgettes in half, remove the cores with a teaspoon and cut them into pieces 3 cm long. Put them into the blender jug.
Decant the courgette into a large fine sieve, mix with 2 pinches of salt and leave to release the water. Meanwhile, follow the next steps.
Wash and peel 4 carrots (300 g), cut them into 3 cm long pieces, and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Squeeze out the courgette pieces in the sieve thoroughly, and add them (without the drained-off liquid) to the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (medium) and the chopped coriander.
Add 60 g flour.
Season to taste with ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Heat up 2 tbsp oil in a frying pan.
Make vegetable fritters from the mixture and fry one after the other on both sides until crispy. Heat more oil in the pan if necessary.
Serve the fritters with the yoghurt dip.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese with Parmesan
instructions: Cut the Parmesan into rough pieces, put in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/10 seconds. Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the onions and garlic and halve the onions. Peel and halve the carrots. Clean and wash the celery and slice into pieces 4 cm long. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug using the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 7 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, add 1 tablespoon of oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown using the roast button/4 minutes. Add 400 g minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown using the roast button. Remove everything from the blender jug and put aside. Clean the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into rough pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 8 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, add 1 tablespoon of oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/5 minutes. Add the remaining minced meat, and the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button. Pour on 200 ml warm stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down using the roast button/10 minutes.

Put the sugar, tomato purée, the meat mixture, the chopped tomatoes and the remaining warm stock in the blender jug, season with paprika powder, cinnamon, ½ teaspoon of pepper, and mix everything with the measuring beaker in place using the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 2. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down using the reverse button/45 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.
TIP: If no children are eating with you, replace the first 200 ml stock with 200 ml red wine.

ingredients.name: 800 g mixed beef and pork mince
600 ml warm vegetable or beef stock

steps.text: Remove the rind from 100 g Parmesan, cut into 2-cm cubes and put it into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 10 seconds.
Decant into a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Weigh out 2 onions (100 g), peel and halve them, then put them into the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 carrots (150 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Wash and trim 3 sticks of celery (150 g), cut into 4-cm pieces and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 400 g minced meat.
Transfer everything from the blender jug into a bowl.
Clean out the blender jug.
Cut 150 g streaky bacon into rough pieces and put it into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add the rest of the minced meat (400 g).
Pour in 200 g warm vegetable or beef stock.
Add 2 tsp sugar, 6 tbsp tomato purée and the vegetable and minced meat mixture to the blender jug.
Add 800 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Pour in 400 g warm vegetable or beef stock.
Add 2 tsp sweet paprika, a pinch of cinnamon, ½ tsp pepper and 2 tbsp thyme leaves.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Season to taste with salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.

name: Chilli con carne
instructions: Peel the onions and garlic cloves, halve the onions, and put both ingredients in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/3 minutes/120 °C. Add 300 g minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button. Remove the meat and put to one side.
Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil and the remaining minced meat to the blender jug, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button.

Put the reserved meat mixture, chopped tomatoes and tomato purée in the blender jug and season with 1½ teaspoons of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and the paprika powder. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Rinse the sweetcorn and kidney beans, drain and put in the blender jug. Add the cumin and Tabasco and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
Serve with crispy baguette, nachos or pitta bread.

ingredients.name: 600 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Peel and halve 3 onions (210 g) and 3 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 3 tbsp vegetable oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 300 g mixed minced meat.
Decant the minced meat into a bowl.
Put the rest of the minced meat (300 g) and 3 tbsp vegetable oil into the blender jug.
Put the reserved onion and meat mixture, 3 tbsp tomato purée, 1½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and 3 tbsp sweet paprika into the blender jug.
Add 750 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Drain and rinse 150 g sweetcorn and add it to the blender jug.
Drain and rinse 300 g kidney beans and add them to the blender jug.
Add 1½ level tsp ground cumin and 3 dashes of Tabasco.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it.

name: Batter
instructions:
Add the butter in chunks, sugar, a pinch of salt and vanilla sugar to the blender jug and mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 1 minute/speed setting 5.
Continue stirring for 2 minutes/speed setting 5 and, the measuring beaker not inserted, adding the eggs one at a time through the filling opening. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

QUICK CHOCOLATE MUFFINS You can make quick chocolate muffins from this basic batter: add 50 ml cream to the eggs and 2–3 tablespoons of baking cocoa to the flour and baking powder. Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C, grease the muffin tin and dust with flour. Divide the mixture between the 12 holes in the tin and bake for 20 minutes. Using a wooden skewer, test to see if the muffins are baked and extend the baking time if necessary. Let the muffins cool down and coat with chocolate if desired.

ingredientsBases.name: FOR 1 LOAF CAKE, GUGLHUPF OR A SPRINGFORM TIN 26 CM Ø

ingredients.name: butter and flour for the tin

steps.text: Put 250 g soft butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 250 g sugar.
Add 1 pinch of salt and 1 sachet of vanilla sugar.
During the next step, add 5 eggs (medium) one at a time through the filling opening in the lid. Do not put the measuring beaker back in place.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Sieve 350 g flour and 1 sachet of baking powder into the blender jug.
Continue to follow the instructions for the cake mix as specified in your recipe.

name: Waffles
instructions:
Put the butter in chunks, sugar and 1 pinch of salt in the blender jug, and whisk until creamy with the measuring beaker in place, for 15 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the eggs and buttermilk and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 5.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again. Sieve the flour and baking powder over the top, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 4.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, and with the measuring beaker in place, create a viscous batter for 30 seconds/speed setting 4.

Preheat and grease a waffle iron.
Put 3 tablespoons of batter on each surface and bake golden waffles in 4 minutes.

ingredients.name: fat for greasing the waffle iron

steps.text: Put 85 g soft butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 85 g sugar and 1 pinch of salt.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (medium) to the blender jug.
Add 200 g buttermilk.
Use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again.

Sieve 200 g flour and 
½ tsp baking powder over the top.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again.
Pre-heat and grease a waffle iron. Put 3 tbsp batter on each surface and bake until golden according to the appliance settings.

name: Pasta dough
instructions:
Put the flour, semolina, salt, oil and 170 ml water in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead using the knead button/2 minutes.
Put the crumbly dough on a board and continue to knead using your hands until you have a smooth, firm dough. Cover with cling film and allow to rest for about 1 hour.
Roll out the dough very thinly with a rolling pin. If it begins to stick, add flour or semolina.

Roll the dough into the desired shape or pass through a pasta machine and cut the pasta to size. To make tagliatelle, cut the dough into strips approximately 1.5 cm wide.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until firm to the bite (al dente), drain and serve.
TIPS Pasta that is cooked within the next hour can be shaped into nests and left to dry on a cloth. If you prepare pasta in advance, it is best to hang it up to dry it completely.

ingredients.name: flour or semolina for the work surface

steps.text: Put 200 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 180 g fine hard wheat semolina.
Add 1 tsp salt and 3 tbsp olive oil.
Add 170 g water.
Put the crumbly dough onto a board and continue to knead using your hands until you have a smooth, firm dough.
Cover with cling film and leave to rest for 1 hour.
Roll out the dough very thinly with a rolling pin. If it begins to stick, add flour or semolina.
Roll the dough into the desired shape or pass it through a pasta machine and cut to size. To make tagliatelle, cut it into strips approx. 1.5 cm wide.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until firm to the bite (al dente), drain and serve.

name: Homemade gnocchi
instructions: Pour 500 ml water and add 1 pinch of the salt into the blender jug. Peel and wash the potatoes, and cut into quarters. Put the potatoes in the cooking pot, insert into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.
Remove the cooking pot, pour off the water and let the potatoes cool down completely (preferably overnight).
Put the potatoes, egg yolks, flour, the remaining salt, pepper and nutmeg in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 4.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and then continue to mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
On a floured surface, shape the potato dough into a roll 1.5 cm thick. Cut the roll into slices 1 cm thick. Press the dough pieces flat with the tines of a fork to create a grooved pattern.
Bring plenty of salted water to the boil, add the gnocchi, bring to the boil and leave to simmer over medium heat until they rise. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well.

TIPS
The gnocchi taste particularly good with tomato sauce, pesto or sage butter. 
To make sage butter, wash and dry 10 sage leaves and cut them into fine strips. Put 3 tablespoons of butter into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker attached, melt for 3 minutes/setting 2/90 °C. Add the sage and, with the measuring beaker attached, mix for 10 seconds/setting 1, then leave the mixture to stand for 5 minutes. Pour the sage butter over the drained gnocchi.

ingredients.name: plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Put 500 g water into the blender jug and add 1 pinch of salt.
Peel and wash 1 kg small floury potatoes, cutting them into halves or quarters if necessary.
Put the potatoes into the cooking pot.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Remove the cooking pot and pour the remaining water out of the blender jug. Leave the potatoes to cool off completely (preferably overnight).
Put the cooled potatoes and 3 eggs yolks (medium) into the blender jug.
Add 200 g flour.
Add the rest of the salt, 3 pinches of pepper and 1 big pinch of nutmeg.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
On a floured surface, shape the potato dough into a roll 1.5 cm thick.
Cut the roll into slices 1 cm thick. Press the dough pieces flat with the tines of a fork to create a grooved pattern.
Bring plenty of salted water to the boil in a pot.
Add the gnocchi, bring to a boil and leave to simmer over a medium heat until they rise to the surface. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well.

name: Mayonnaise
instructions:
First ensure all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Put the eggs, lemon juice, mustard, 2 pinches each of salt and pepper and 1 of sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3.

Then, with the measuring beaker in place, set the appliance to 4 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips downwards along the measuring beaker insert. Slowly increase the quantity of oil.
The mayonnaise should have a fine creamy consistency.

TIPS If stored in a cool, dark place, the mayonnaise will keep for approximately three days. You can quickly make a delicious Marie Rose sauce from homemade mayonnaise and homemade ketchup. Put 250 g mayonnaise, 6 tbsp ketchup, 3 tbsp milk (UHT semi-skimmed milk 1.5% fat), 2 pinches each of salt and pepper, 1 pinch of sugar and 3 tsp brandy in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 12 seconds/speed setting 3. Allow flavours to infuse for a few hours before eating. Goes very well with prawns, poultry and raclette.

steps.text: Ensure that all of the ingredients are at room temperature.
Sterilise 2 jars (300 ml each).
Place a container on the blender jug, weigh 600 ml sunflower oil into it and set to one side.
Put 2 eggs (medium), 2 tsp lemon juice, 2 tsp mustard, 2 pinches of salt, 2 pinches of pepper and 1 pinch of sugar into the blender jug.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (with measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.

name: Remoulade
instructions:
Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Peel and quarter the onion and put in the blender jug with the parsley.
Add the gherkin and capers and chop, with the measuring beaker in place, for 8 seconds/speed setting 7, then remove and put aside.

Put the fresh egg, lemon juice, mustard, salt and sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, set the appliance to 4 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips downwards along the measuring beaker insert. Slowly increase the quantity of oil.

Then add the gherkin and onion mixture to the mayonnaise in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 8 seconds/speed setting 2.
Chop the hard-boiled egg into fine pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 5 seconds/speed setting 4.
Refine the remoulade with a little of the liquid from the gherkin jar.
TIP Remoulade keeps in the refrigerator for approximately three days.

steps.text: Sterilise a jar (400 ml).
Wash ½ bunch of parsley, shake dry, tear the leaves from their stalks and put them into the blender jug.
Peel and quarter 1 onion (80 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Add 1 large pickled gherkin and 2 tbsp capers.
Decant the mixture and set it to one side.

Put 1 egg (medium) at room temperature, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp Dijon mustard, 
½ tsp salt, ½ tsp sugar and 1 pinch of pepper into the blender jug.

Place a container on the blender jug, weigh in 
300 g sunflower oil, then set to one side.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.
Add the gherkin and onion mixture to the mayonnaise.
Chop the hard-boiled egg (medium) finely and add it to the mixture.
Refine the remoulade with a little of the liquid from the gherkin jar.

name: Aioli
instructions:
Peel the garlic clove, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop using the turbo button/2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again and, with the measuring beaker in place, add the egg, lemon juice, mustard, salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3.

Then, with the measuring beaker in place, set the appliance to 4 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips inwards along the measuring beaker insert. Slowly increase the quantity of oil. The aioli is ready when it has a fine, creamy consistency.

TIPS You will get the best results if all the ingredients are at room temperature. If you like a bite to your aioli, add up to 3 garlic cloves. Aioli keeps in the refrigerator for approximately 3 days.

ingredients.name: 250 ml sunflower oil at room temperature or mild olive oil

steps.text: Peel 1 small garlic clove and put it into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add 1 egg (large) at room temperature, 
1 tsp lemon juice, 1 tsp mustard, ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.

Place a container on the blender jug, weigh in 
250 g sunflower oil, then set to one side.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.

name: Guacamole
instructions: Wash, quarter and deseed the tomato. Remove the stalk, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 8 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant the chopped tomato into a bowl.

Peel the onion and the garlic clove, halve the onion and chop both in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, using the turbo button/7 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Halve the avocado, remove the stone and scrape out the flesh. Juice the lime.
Add the avocado flesh, lime juice, harissa and 1 pinch each of salt and pepper and mix everything together, with the measuring beaker in place, for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add the chopped tomato and mix using the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Season again with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
If desired, add 1 tablespoon of freshly chopped coriander and 1 teaspoon of crème fraîche (30% fat) to the guacamole.

steps.text: Wash, quarter and deseed 1 tomato (100 g), remove the stem end and put it in the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped tomato to a bowl.
Peel and halve 1 small onion (50 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 7 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the juice of ½ lime, 1 tsp harissa, 
1 pinch of salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the chopped tomato.
Decant the guacamole into a dish, season again with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Tzatziki
instructions: Peel the garlic cloves, put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Peel and halve the cucumber, and using a teaspoon, remove the seeds.
Put the deseeded cucumber in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 3 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the cream cheese, quark, yoghurt, soured cream, 2 teaspoons of salt and 1 pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Season again with salt and pepper and serve well chilled.

TIP
Tzatziki keeps for about five days in a covered container in the refrigerator.

steps.text: Peel and halve 1 cucumber, then deseed it by running a teaspoon down the middle. Set it to one side.
Peel and halve 1 cucumber, then deseed it by running a teaspoon down the middle. Set it to one side.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Put the deseeded cucumber in pieces into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 250 g cream cheese.
Add 250 g quark.
Add 300 g Greek yoghurt.
Add 200 g soured cream.
Add 2 tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Season again with salt and pepper and serve well chilled.

name: Herb butter
instructions: Divide the butter into quarters. Wash the parsley and chives and shake them dry. Cut the chives into fine little rings, remove the parsley leaves from their stalks. Peel the garlic.
Put the butter, herbs, garlic, salt and 1 big pinch of pepper in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 3 seconds/speed setting 5, using the spatula to help.

TIPS The butter will keep for two weeks in the refrigerator and can also be frozen. If you like your herb butter finer, cut the chives into small rings and put them into the blender jug with the parsley. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Then continue following the recipe (i.e. from peeling the garlic).

steps.text: Wash 1 bunch of parsley and 1 bunch of chives, shake dry, cut the chives into fine rings, remove the parsley leaves, and put into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Cut 250 g butter into four pieces and add it to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip this step.

name: Red pesto with walnuts
instructions:
Put the Parmesan in pieces in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the pine nuts and walnuts and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 8. Then decant and set aside.

Peel the garlic and put it with the tomatoes in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 25 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the pine nuts, walnuts, Parmesan and 200 ml of olive oil and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 25 seconds/speed setting 8.
Use the spatula once again to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 15 seconds/speed setting 10.
Put the pesto in sterilised jars and cover with olive oil before closing.
TIPS If stored in a cool, dark place, the pesto will keep for approximately 6 months. After opening, always cover with olive oil before re-closing.

steps.text: Sterilise 2 jars (300 ml each).
Remove the rind from 100 g Parmesan, cut into 2 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Add 50 g pine nuts to the blender jug.
Add 50 g walnut kernels.
Decant the mixture into a bowl.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Add 200 g sundried tomatoes.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the Parmesan, pine nuts and walnut kernels.
Pour in 200 g olive oil at room temperature.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Put the pesto in sterilised jars and cover with olive oil before closing.

name: Rocket pesto
instructions: Peel the garlic clove, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Clean, wash and shake the rocket leaves dry. Remove the hard stalks.
Remove the rind from the Parmesan and cut into 2 cm pieces. Put into the blender jug with the pine nuts and rocket and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the room-temperature olive oil, ½ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 10 seconds/speed setting 7.
Scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug using the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 10 seconds/speed setting 8.
Put the pesto in sterilised jars and cover with olive oil before closing.

TIP
Pesto complements fresh pasta.
If stored in a cool, dark place, the pesto will keep for approximately six months. After opening, always cover with olive oil before re-closing.

steps.text: Peel 1 garlic clove and put it into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the chopped garlic down the inside of the blender jug.
Remove the rind from 60 g Parmesan, cut into 2 cm chunks and add to the blender jug.
Add 70 g pine nuts.
Wash 80 g rocket, shake dry, remove any hard stalks and add to the blender jug.
Pour in 130 g olive oil at room temperature.
Add ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Put the pesto into sterile jars and cover the mixture completely with olive oil before sealing.

name: Hummus
instructions: Rinse the orange in hot water and zest the peel. Wash the parsley, shake dry and chop roughly. Drain the chickpeas in a sieve until all the liquid has run off.

Put the chickpeas, tahini, cold vegetable stock, lemon juice, 40 ml olive oil, salt, pepper, cumin and orange peel into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 2 minutes/speed setting 6.

Drizzle the remaining olive oil on top, sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

TIP Hummus is delicious spread on lightly toasted pitta bread.

steps.text: Wash 2 sprigs of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, chop roughly and set to one side.
Drain 2 tins of chickpeas (265 g each) in a sieve until all the liquid has run off.
Put 530 g chickpeas into the blender jug.
Add 60 g tahini.
Add 50 g cold vegetable stock.
Add 2 tbsp lemon juice, ½ tsp salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and ½ tsp cumin.
Pour in 40 g olive oil.
Rinse 1 orange (100 g) with hot water and zest the peel. Put the orange zest into the blender jug.
Decant into a dish, drizzle 1 tsp olive oil over the top, sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

name: Chocolate and hazelnut cream
instructions:
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C.
Put the hazelnuts on a baking sheet and roast in the pre-heated oven for 12 minutes until they are fragrant.
Put the hazelnuts in a clean tea-towel while they are still warm and rub them to remove the skins. Allow to cool completely.

Put the cooled hazelnuts in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, blitz them for 15 seconds/speed setting 7. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug. Repeat the process 5–6 times, leaving little breaks in between each time, until you have a creamy nut paste. Neither the machine nor the paste should become too hot. Empty the blender jug of the paste.

Put the chocolate nougat in pieces with the cream, butter, vanilla sugar, cocoa powder and a pinch of salt in the blender jug. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/50 °C until you have a smooth cream. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the nut paste to the chocolate mixture and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 8 until smooth.
Decant the mixture into a clean jar and store in the fridge.

TIPS The cream will become firm during cooling and should be taken out of the refrigerator 15 minutes before serving to allow it to become spreadable. Consume the chocolate hazelnut cream within 1 week.

steps.text: Sterilise a jar (300 ml).
Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (upper and lower heat).
Weigh out 100 g hazelnuts.
Put the hazelnuts on a baking sheet and roast in the pre-heated oven for 12 minutes until they are fragrant.
Put the hazelnuts in a clean tea towel while they are still warm and rub them to remove the skins. Leave them to cool completely.
Put the cooled hazelnuts into the blender jug.
Repeat the following process 5 times, with breaks in between, until you have a creamy nut paste. Do not let the machine or the paste get too hot.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Transfer the nut paste to a bowl.
Put 150 g chocolate nougat in pieces into the blender jug.
Add 75 g chilled cream.
Add 50 g butter at room temperature.
Add 1 tsp vanilla sugar, 1 tsp unsweetened cocoa powder and 1 pinch of salt.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the nut paste.
Decant the mixture into the sterile jar and store in the fridge.

name: Tomato soup
