instructions: Peel the onions and garlic. Quarter the onions and put them with the garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug, add the olive oil and the onion and garlic and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/4 minutes/100° C.
Add the tomato purée and 1 teaspoon of sugar and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/1 minute 30 seconds/100° C.

Put the cherry tomatoes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again. Add the chopped tomatoes, vegetable stock powder and oregano and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 10 seconds/speed settings 5–9, increasing the speed gradually.

With the measuring beaker in place, bring the soup to the boil again for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Season with 1 teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper. If desired, add a little more sugar to taste. Wash the basil leaves, shake dry and cut into thin slices. Pour the soup into soup cups and serve with 1 teaspoon of crème fraîche and strips of basil on top of each one.

steps.text: Wash 10 fresh basil leaves, shake them dry, shred them finely and set them to one side.
Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 1 garlic clove, quarter the onion, and put both into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 2 tbsp tomato purée and 1 tsp sugar.
Wash and dry 250 g cherry tomatoes and put them into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 800 g chopped tomatoes (from a tin) to the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp vegetable stock powder and 2 tsp oregano.
Season with 1 tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper. If desired, add a little more sugar to taste.
Pour the soup into soup cups and serve with 1 tsp crème fraîche and strips of basil on top of each one.

name: Tomato soup with mozzarella
instructions: Finely dice the bacon, put into the blender jug, add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the bacon using the roast button.

Peel the onions and halve, peel the garlic. Put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/2 minutes/110 °C.

Wash and quarter the tomatoes, deseed, remove stems and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 15 seconds/speed setting 5.
Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/110 °C.

Add the tomato purée and the stock at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 15 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend the soup for 40 seconds/speed settings 6–8, increasing the speed gradually.
Add the cream and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 4. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.

Slice the mozzarella and sprinkle with ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper. Put the flour and breadcrumbs in separate shallow dishes. Beat the eggs in a shallow dish.
First coat the mozzarella slices in the flour, then dip in the beaten egg and finally coat in the breadcrumbs. Press the coating on a little and repeat the process.

Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the Mozzarella slices in it until golden on both sides.
Serve the soup garnished with the Mozzarella slices.
TIP If no children are eating with you, refine the soup with 3 tablespoons of sherry.

ingredients.name: 250 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Finely dice 100 g streaky bacon and put it into the blender jug.
Add 3 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Peel and halve 2 onions (160 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1000 g tomatoes into it.
Wash, quarter and deseed the tomatoes, remove the stem ends and put the tomato quarters into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 250 g vegetable stock at room temperature and 1 tbsp tomato purée.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 4 tbsp cream into the blender jug.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 125 g mozzarella into it.

Slice the mozzarella and sprinkle with 
½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 100 g flour into it.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 200 g breadcrumbs into it.
Put the flour and breadcrumbs in a shallow dish.
Beat 2 eggs (medium) in a shallow dish.
First coat the mozzarella slices in the flour, then dip in the beaten egg and finally coat in the breadcrumbs. Press the coating on a little.
Repeat the process.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry the mozzarella slices in it until golden on both sides.
Serve the soup garnished with the mozzarella slices.

name: Pumpkin soup
instructions: Peel and halve the onion and put into the blender jug with the peeled garlic cloves. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/6 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Wash the pumpkin, remove the core and fibres, and cut into pieces approximately 3 cm long. (It is not necessary to peel Hokkaido pumpkins.) Add the pumpkin flesh to the onion and garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 5. Repeat the process if necessary.
Add the butter cut into pieces and use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. The measuring beaker not inserted, stew with the roast button.
Add the sugar, 1 teaspoon of salt, ½ teaspoon of pepper and 2 big pinches each of cinnamon and nutmeg.
Pour over the warm vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 20 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Add the cream at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually. Season the soup to taste again with lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 1.
Pour the soup into bowls and garnish with the whipped cream and a few drops of pumpkin seed oil.

VARIATION
To give the soup a taste of the Orient, replace the cream with coconut milk and add 1 teaspoon of curry powder to the spices in the soup.

ingredients.name: a few drops of pumpkin seed oil

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (60 g) and 2 cloves of garlic, cut the onion in half and place both in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 6 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Wash 1200 g Hokkaido pumpkin, remove the seeds and fibres, cut into 3-cm chunks and add to the blender jug.
Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip this step.
Cut 75 g butter into pieces and add to the blender jug. Use the spatula to scrape everything down.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 1½ tsp brown sugar, 1 tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper, 2 big pinches of cinnamon and 2 big pinches of nutmeg.
Add 1000 g warm vegetable stock.
Replace the measuring beaker in the lid.
Add 300 g cream.
Season the soup with lemon juice.
Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with 6 tbsp whipped cream and a few drops of pumpkin seed oil.

name: Minestrone soup
instructions: Put the Parmesan in large pieces into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 9. Put in another container and set aside.

Peel the onions and garlic. Quarter the onions, then put them with the garlic into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 9 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the diced bacon and butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté everything using the roast button/4 minutes.

Peel and halve the potatoes and carrots. Wash and trim the tomatoes, courgette, beans and celery and cut into pieces. Put all the vegetables into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the vegetable stock at room temperature and the tomato purée and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Break the spaghetti into small pieces, add the salt and pepper, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook until al dente with the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Divide the minestrone between deep bowls, drizzle with a little olive oil and serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

ingredients.name: 1.2 l vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Put 50 g Parmesan in chunks into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped Parmesan to a bowl.
Peel 1½ Spanish onions (400 g), cut them into eighths and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 30 g diced streaky bacon to the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp butter.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Peel and halve 1 waxy potato (100 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 carrot (70 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Clean, wash and dice 2 tomatoes (200 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Trim, wash and chop ¼ courgette (50 g) and add it to the blender jug.

Trim, wash and slice 
50 g green beans and add them to the blender jug.
Trim, wash and chop 1 stick of celery (60 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 1200 g vegetable stock at room temperature and 1 tbsp tomato purée to the blender jug.
Weigh out 120 g spaghetti, break it into small pieces and add to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
In the following step, adjust the time setting to the packet instructions for cooking the spaghetti.
Divide the minestrone between deep bowls, drizzle with a little olive oil and serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

name: Meatloaf with red pepper sauce
instructions: Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets well. Cut 50 g of Parmesan into pieces, peel the shallots and halve. Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves. Put everything in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 9. Then use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the breadcrumbs, minced meat, the eggs, 1½ teaspoons of salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 1 teaspoon of paprika powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix using the knead button/1 minute. Spread out a sheet of greaseproof paper, put the meat mixture on it and, with damp hands, flatten into a rectangle measuring 25 x 20 cm.

Cut the remaining Parmesan into thin slices. Wash the rocket and remove the hard stalks. Then wash the leaves, shake dry and chop coarsely. The spread the Parmesan and rocket on the meat mixture. Using the greaseproof paper, carefully roll up the meat mixture, pressing down lightly. Place it in the deep steamer basket.

Peel the garlic, peel and quarter the red onions, clean and wash the peppers and cut into eighths. Put the garlic, onions and peppers in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 4 seconds/speed setting 6. Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, stew the peppers with the roast button/2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and warm vegetable stock and season with 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and ½ teaspoon of sugar.

Peel the carrots and cut into 3-mm diagonal slices. Put in the shallow steamer basket and season with ½ teaspoon of salt and 2 pinches of pepper. Put the deep steamer basket in place with the shallow basket closed, and cook everything for 50 minutes/speed setting 1/130 °C. Remove the deep steamer basket, close the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 45 seconds/speed setting 8. Season again with salt, pepper, paprika powder and sugar to taste. If the sauce is too thin, then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down again for 5 minutes/speed setting 1/130 °C.
Slice the meatloaf and serve with the carrots and red pepper sauce.

ingredients.name: 400 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets well.
Remove the rind from 50 g Parmesan, cut into 2 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Put the pieces of Parmesan into the blender jug.
Peel 2 shallots (60 g), halve and add to the blender jug.
Wash ½ bunch of parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 40 g breadcrumbs.
Add 400 g mixed beef and pork mince.
Add 2 eggs (medium), 1½ tsp salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 1 tsp sweet paprika powder.
Spread out a sheet of greaseproof paper, put the meat mixture on it and, with damp hands, flatten into a rectangle measuring 25 x 20 cm.
Remove the rind from 50 g Parmesan, cut into thin slices and spread on the meat mixture.
Weigh out 20 g rocket, clean and remove the hard stalks.
Wash the rocket, shake dry, chop coarsely and spread on the meat mixture.
Using the greaseproof paper, carefully roll up the meat mixture, pressing down lightly.
Place the roll in the deep steamer basket.
Peel 2 red onions (100 g), quarter and put into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add to the onions.
Clean and wash 3 red peppers (500 g), cut into eighths and add.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Put 400 g tinned chopped tomatoes into the blender jug.
Add 400 g warm vegetable stock.
Add 1 tsp salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and ½ tsp sugar.
Wash and peel 8 carrots  (600 g) and cut into 3 mm diagonal slices.
Put the carrots in the shallow steamer basket and season with ½ tsp salt and 2 pinches of pepper.
Insert the shallow steamer basket into the deep steamer basket, attach to the blender jug and close the lid.
Remove the steamer attachment.
Close the blender jug and insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season again with salt, pepper, paprika powder and sugar to taste.
Season again with salt, pepper, paprika powder and sugar to taste.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
If the sauce is too thin, then follow the next step; otherwise, skip this step.
Slice the meatloaf and serve with the carrots and red pepper sauce.

name: Low-carb pizza with Parma ham
instructions: To make the topping, peel the shallot and garlic. Put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop using the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the chopped tomatoes, oregano, 3 pinches of pepper and ½ teaspoon of salt and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Decant the tomato sauce and season to taste with pepper and salt. Wash and dry the blender jug.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C

To make the base, with the measuring beaker in place, chop the Parmesan for 10 seconds/speed setting 5.
Clean the cauliflower, divide into florets, add to the Parmesan and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 7 to make cauliflower rice.
Put all the remaining ingredients for the base in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 3.

Line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper, place four equal-sized portions of dough on top and shape into 7-mm thick circles using a tablespoon.
Bake the cauliflower bases in the pre-heated oven for 10 minutes.

In the meantime, clean and wash the rocket leaves and shake them dry.
Peel the onion and cut into thin rings.
After pre-baking the pizza, spread the tomato sauce over thinly (do not use it all – any remaining sauce can be served with the pizza or used up in other ways), place the onion rings and olives on top, and bake for a further 10 minutes.
Shred the rocket a little and thinly grate the Parmesan.
Place a slice of ham, some rocket and Parmesan on each baked pizza.
TIP Try preparing the pizza base using Romanesco broccoli. It has a stronger taste.

steps.text: Peel 1 shallot (30 g) and 1 garlic clove and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 400 g tinned chopped tomatoes to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp dried oregano, 3 pinches of pepper and ½ tsp salt.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the tomato sauce into a bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Decant the tomato sauce into a bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Clean and dry the blender jug.
Clean and dry the blender jug.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (upper and lower heat).
Remove the rind from 35 g Parmesan and put into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Wipe and wash 250 g cauliflower, divide into small florets and put them into the blender jug.
Add 50 g flour to the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (large) and ¼ tsp salt.
Place 4 equal-sized portions of dough on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper, and shape into 7 mm-thick circles using a tablespoon.
Bake the cauliflower for 10 minutes.
Peel 1 small red onion (40 g), cut it into thin rings, and set to one side.
Spread the tomato sauce over the pizza thinly. Do not use it all – any remaining sauce can be served with the pizza or used up in other ways.
Place the onion rings and 20 black olives on top, and bake for a further 10 minutes.
Thinly grate 25 g Parmesan and set it to one side.
Wash 20 g rocket, pat it dry, remove any hard stalks and shred.
Place a slice of uncooked ham, some rocket and Parmesan on each baked pizza.

name: Meatballs with tomato sauce
instructions: Cut the bread roll or white bread into rough pieces, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 12 seconds/speed setting 10. Add the milk, minced meat, egg, mustard, 1 teaspoon of salt, ½ teaspoon of pepper and the paprika powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix using the knead button.
Remove the meat mixture from the blender jug. With damp hands, make 12–16 equal-sized balls from the mixture and place in the deep steamer basket. Rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the shallot and garlic. Halve the shallot and put the shallot and garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat using the roast button/5 minutes/120 °C.
Add the chopped tomatoes, warm vegetable stock, herbs and sugar. Attach the deep steamer basket, with its lid, and cook using the steamer button. Once the cooking time has elapsed, season again with salt and pepper and serve with the meat balls.
TIP Serve with baguette.
TIP Serve with baguette.

ingredients.name: 60 g dry bread rolls or day-old white bread
300 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Cut 60 g dry bread rolls or white bread into coarse pieces and place in the blender jug.
Add 30 g milk.
Add 1 egg (medium), 1 tsp mustard, ½ tsp pepper and 1 tsp paprika.
Add 300 g mixed beef and pork mince.
With damp hands, form the mixture into 12-16 equal-sized balls and place them in the deep steamer basket.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 shallot (40 g) and one garlic clove; place them in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug; then add 2 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 400 g tinned peeled tomatoes to the blender jug.
Add 300 g warm vegetable stock.
Add ½ tsp dried oregano, ½ tsp dried marjoram, ½ tsp dried thyme and 1 tsp sugar.
Attach the deep steamer basket with the meatballs to the blender jug.
Season the sauce again with salt and pepper and serve with the meatballs.

name: Creamy chicken fricassée with rice
instructions:
Put the rice in the cooking pot, and the bay leaves in the blender jug. Place the cooking pot in the blender jug and pour the hot stock over it.
Wash the chicken breast fillets, pat dry and dice into cubes of 2.5 centimetres in length.

Season the meat all over with 4 pinches of pepper and ¼ teaspoon of salt, arrange in the deep steamer basket, attach the basket closed with its lid on, and steam using the steamer button/15 minutes. Put to one side closed with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot from the blender jug and put to one side. Pour the stock out of the blender jug and reserve 200 ml. Remove the bay leaves.
Peel and halve the onion, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes.
Add the flour and reserved stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 6.

Add the drained capers, cream and lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Season with pepper and salt to taste.
Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.
TIP If you like, you can add pre-cooked pieces of asparagus, peas and button mushrooms to the fricassée.

ingredients.name: 1 l hot chicken or vegetable stock

steps.text: Drain 1 tbsp capers of their brine and set to one side.
Wash 4 chicken breast fillets (each 170 g) under cold running water and pat them dry.
Dice the chicken breast fillets into 2.5 cm pieces.
Season the cubes of chicken all over with 4 pinches of pepper and ¼ tsp salt, then arrange them in the deep steamer basket.
Put 2 bay leaves into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 250 g long-grain rice into the cooking pot.
Pour 1000 g hot chicken or vegetable stock over the rice in the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close the lid.
Remove the deep steamer basket and put it to one side, with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot containing the rice from the blender jug, pour out the stock and reserve 200 ml. Remove the bay leaves.
Remove the cooking pot containing the rice from the blender jug, pour out the stock and reserve 200 ml. Remove the bay leaves.
Peel and halve 1 medium-sized onion (100 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put cubes of 40 g cold butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 40 g flour to the blender jug.
Pour in the reserved stock (200 g).
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 1 tbsp drained capers and 2 tsp lemon juice to the blender jug.
Add 230 g cream.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.

name: Stuffed chicken with potatoes
instructions: Wash and pat the chicken dry and rub all over with 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Wash, trim and peel the celery, carrot and spring onion and cut into pieces 2 cm long.

Wash the parsley, pat dry and remove the leaves. Put the parsley leaves in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Then add to the vegetables and rinse out the blender jug.

Stuff the chicken with the vegetables and close the cavity with a toothpick. Peel the garlic, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the oil, honey and paprika powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant the marinade and rinse out the blender jug.
Pour 1.3 litres of warm water into the blender jug and add 1 teaspoon of salt. Place the chicken in the deep steamer basket, brush with the marinade and insert the steamer attachment with its lid.
Cook with the steamer button/40 minutes. In the meantime, peel the potatoes, cut into pieces and put into the cooking pot.

Then remove the steamer attachment, insert the cooking pot, put the steamer attachment with its lid back in place, and cook everything again with the steamer button/15 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C.

Place the chicken on a baking rack and place a drip tray or a baking tray underneath to collect the drips. Roast the chicken for 15 minutes. In the meantime, keep the potatoes warm in the blender jug.
TIP If no children are eating with you, add two dashes of tabasco to the marinade. This will make the chicken even spicier.

steps.text: Wash 1 chicken (max. 1400 g) and pat it dry.
Rub the chicken all over with 1 tsp each of salt and pepper.
Wash and trim 1 stick of celery (30 g) and cut it into 2 cm-long pieces.
Transfer the celery pieces to a bowl and set them to one side.
Wash, trim and peel 1 carrot (70 g) and cut it into 2 cm-long pieces.
Add the carrot pieces to the celery in the bowl and set to one side.
Wash and trim a spring onion (20 g) and cut it into 2 cm-long pieces.
Add the pieces of spring onion to the carrot and celery in the bowl and set to one side.
Wash 5 sprigs of parsley, pat them dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Add the chopped parsley to the vegetables (celery, carrot, spring onion).
Rinse out the blender jug.
Stuff the chicken with the vegetables.
Close the cavity with a toothpick.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour 50 g honey into the blender jug.
Add 50 g olive oil.
Add 2 tsp paprika powder.
Decant the marinade into the bowl.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Pour 1300 g water into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt.
Place the chicken in the deep steamer basket, brush with the marinade and insert the deep steamer basket into the blender jug.
Remove the deep steamer basket and insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Weigh out 750 g waxy potatoes, peel and cut into pieces, and place them in the cooking pot.
Re-attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug.
Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (upper and lower heat).
Place the chicken on a baking rack and place a drip tray or a baking tray underneath to collect the drips.
Roast the chicken for 15 minutes. In the meantime, keep the potatoes warm in the blender jug.

name: Chicken nuggets with honey and mustard dip
instructions: Put the cornflakes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, blitz for 6 seconds/speed setting 6. Pour into a shallow dish and wipe out the blender jug with a dry cloth.

Put the crème fraîche, mustard, honey, cider vinegar and 1 teaspoon of salt in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 15 seconds/speed setting 4. Transfer into a bowl and season to taste with pepper. Clean the blender jug.

To make the nuggets, rinse the chicken breast fillets under cold running water, pat dry and remove any stringy bits. Cut into rough pieces and put in the blender jug with 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 15 seconds/speed setting 7.
Transfer from the blender jug into a bowl and, with damp hands, shape the meat into small nuggets.
Put the flour in a bowl, crack the eggs and beat in another bowl. First toss the nuggets in the flour, then dip into the egg and then roll in the cornflakes, while gently pressing on the coating.

Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the nuggets on both sides on a medium heat for about 4 minutes until crispy. Drain on kitchen paper and serve with the dip. The nuggets are also delicious served cold.

ingredients.name: 300 g chicken breast fillet, skin removed

steps.text: Whisk 2 eggs (medium) in a bowl.
Put 80 g unsweetened cornflakes into the blender jug.
Transfer to a shallow bowl and wipe out the blender jug with a dry cloth.
Put 200 g crème fraîche (30% fat) into the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp medium-hot mustard, 2 tbsp honey, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp salt and a pinch of pepper.
Decant into a bowl.
Clean out the blender jug.
Wash 300 g skinless chicken breast fillet under cold running water and pat dry.
Cut the chicken breast fillets into rough pieces and put in the blender jug with 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Transfer to a bowl and, with damp hands, shape the meat into small nuggets.
Put 70 g flour in a bowl.
Line up the cornflakes and the bowl containing the beaten eggs.
First toss the nuggets in the flour, then dip into the egg and then roll in the cornflakes, while gently pressing on the coating.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry the nuggets on both sides on a medium heat for about 4 minutes until crispy.
Drain on kitchen paper and serve with the dip. The nuggets are also delicious served cold.

name: Tuscan chicken with rice
instructions:
Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets well with 1 teaspoon of olive oil. Wash the chicken breast, pat dry and cut into slices.
Divide the strips of chicken between the deep and shallow steamer baskets and season well with the Italian herbs, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.

Wash the tomatoes and pat dry. Remove the stalks and slice.
Cut the mozzarella into slices.
Arrange the tomatoes on top of the meat, and put the mozzarella to one side.
Peel and quarter the shallots, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the remaining olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/2 minutes.
Add the tomato purée and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook using the roast button/2 minutes.

Put the rice in the cooking pot, place in the blender jug and pour the hot vegetable stock over it. Attach the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket and the lid on top, close and steam everything using the steamer button.
Five minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam. Remove the deep steamer basket, remove the rice and keep it warm.

Add the chopped tomatoes and cream to the liquid in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 4 seconds/speed setting 5, then, the measuring beaker not inserted, reduce for 7 minutes/speed setting1/100 °C.
Dissolve the cornflour in 2 tablespoons of cold water, add to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 1 minute/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.

Wash and shake the basil dry. Remove the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Arrange the meat with the rice and sauce and serve sprinkled with basil.

steps.text: Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets with 1 tsp olive oil.
Wash 700 g chicken breast under cold running water and pat dry.
Slice the chicken breast fillets and divide between the two steamer baskets
Season with 2 tsp Italian herbs, 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Wash 3 tomatoes (300 g), pat them dry, remove the stem ends and cut into slices.
Arrange the prepared tomatoes over the meat.
Peel 2 shallots (60 g), cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Put 20 g olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 40 g tomato purée into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 300 g rice into the cooking pot.
Pour over 1000 g hot vegetable stock.
Attach the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket to the blender jug and close the lid.
Slice 2 balls of mozzarella (each 125 g) and set them to one side.
During the next step, 5 minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam.
Take out the deep steamer basket, remove the cooking pot with the rice rice and keep it warm.
Add 400 g tinned chopped tomatoes to the liquid in the blender jug.
Add 100 g cream.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 5 g cornflour. Dissolve the cornflour in 2 tbsp cold water and add to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Wash ½ bunch of basil, shake it dry, tear off the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Assemble the chicken breasts, rice and sauce and serve sprinkled with the basil.

name: Salmon rissoles with remoulade and potatoes
instructions: Ensure that all the ingredients for the remoulade are at room temperature. Wash the parsley and shake it dry. Peel and quarter the onions and put them in the blender jug with the parsley. Add the gherkins and capers and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 7, then decant.

Put the egg, lemon juice, mustard and spices in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/setting 3. Loosely insert the measuring beaker – do not screw on tightly. Set the appliance to 4 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and then pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips inwards along the measuring beaker. Slowly increase the quantity of oil.
Then add the gherkin and onion mixture to the mayonnaise in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 8 seconds/speed setting 2. Peel the shell off the hard-boiled egg and chop finely. Add to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 5 seconds/speed setting 4. Decant and chill until you are ready to serve it. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.

To make the rissoles, wash the salmon fillets, pat dry and cut into rough pieces. Wash the dill, pat dry, put into the blender jug and chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the salmon and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 4. Add the egg, egg yolk, soured cream, breadcrumbs, lemon juice, ½ teaspoon of salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/35 seconds/speed setting 3. Decant, and from the mixture make 12 rissoles, cover and put aside.
Wash the potatoes and cut into halves depending on their size.
Rinse out the blender jug, fill with 500 ml water, put the cooking pot in place, put the potatoes in it and add ½ teaspoon of salt. With the measuring beaker in place, cook with the steamer button.
Heat the sunflower oil in a large frying pan and brown the rissoles on all sides over a medium heat.
Arrange the salmon rissoles on plates with the potatoes and remoulade, and serve.

ingredientsBases.name: FOR THE REMOULADE (MAKES 1 JAR OF 400 ML):

steps.text: Ensure that all the ingredients for the remoulade are at room temperature.
Have a 400 ml jar ready.
Peel and quarter 1 onion (80 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp capers.
Wash 1 bunch of parsley, shake it dry and add it to the blender jug.
Add 80 g gherkins.
Transfer to a bowl.
Put 1 egg (medium), 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp mustard, ½ tsp salt, 1 pinch of pepper and ½ tsp sugar into the blender jug.
Place a container on top of the blender jug, weigh 300 g sunflower oil into it, then set it to one side.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid, but do not screw it on tightly.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place, so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.
Add the gherkin and onion mixture to the blender jug.
Transfer to a bowl and chill until you are ready to serve it.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Wash 1 bunch of dill, pat it dry and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash 600 g salmon fillets, pat them dry, cut into rough pieces and put into the blender jug.
Put 45 g soured cream into the blender jug.
Add 60 g breadcrumbs.
Add 1 egg (medium), 1 egg yolk (medium), 1 dash of lemon juice, ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Decant into a bowl, and from the mixture make 12 rissoles, then cover and put them to one side.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Wash 750 g waxy potatoes, cut into halves depending on size, and put them in the cooking pot.
Heat 2 tbsp sunflower oil in a large frying pan and brown the rissoles on all sides over a medium heat.
Arrange the salmon rissoles on plates with the potatoes and remoulade, and serve.

name: Pizza Margherita
instructions: To make the yeast dough, put 150 ml water at room temperature and the sugar into the blender jug. Crumble the yeast into it and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix together for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Then add the flour, 2 tablespoons of olive oil and ½ teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough. The dough should fall easily off your hands. If necessary, knead in a little more flour or water until it reaches the right consistency. Take the dough out of the blender jug, shape into a ball and put in a bowl covered by a tea towel. Put in a warm place and allow to prove for at least 1 hour until it has doubled in volume. Clean the blender jug.

To make the tomato sauce, put the sieved tomatoes, the tomato purée, the oregano, ¼ teaspoon of salt, 3 pinches of pepper and 1 pinch of sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix well for 20 seconds/speed setting 4.
Cut the mozzarella into thin slices.
Pre-heat the oven to 240 °C. Brush the baking sheet with 1 tablespoon of olive oil.

Knead the dough through again thoroughly by hand, divide into 2 portions and roll out each one into a circle. Place the dough bases on the baking sheet, spread the tomato sauce on top and arrange the mozzarella on top of the sauce. Finally, drizzle the remaining olive oil on top and bake the pizzas for 15 minutes until golden.

VARIATIONS
Using Pizza Margherita as a base, you can make popular pizza classics by adding extra ingredients. Then put 100 g mozzarella on each pizza.
Pizza salami: Put 7 slices of salami on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza funghi: Put 100 g sliced button mushrooms on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza spinaci: Cook 130 g frozen spinach according to packet instructions, season with salt and pepper to taste and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza Hawaii: Cut 3 slices of pineapple into pieces and arrange with two slices of cooked ham (cut into pieces) on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza pepperoni: Put half of each of a red, yellow and green pepper cut into strips on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza cipolla: Peel one large onion, cut into rings and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza prosciutto: Cut 2 slices of cooked ham into pieces and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
And, of course, you can combine all the specified ingredients according to your taste and mood!

ingredients.name: plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Put 150 g water at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp sugar.
Crumble in 10 g fresh yeast.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 250 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil and ½ tsp salt.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
The dough should fall easily off your hands. If necessary, knead in a little more flour or water and then carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Take the dough out of the blender jug, shape into a ball and put in a bowl.
Cover with a tea towel and leave to prove for at least 1 hour in a warm place until it has doubled in volume.
Thoroughly clean the blender jug.
Put 6 tbsp tomato passata, 1 tbsp tomato purée, 1 tsp crushed oregano, ¼ tsp salt, 3 pinches of pepper and 1 pinch of sugar into the blender jug.
Slice 100 g mozzarella (45% fat) and set to one side.
Pre-heat the oven to 240 °C (top and bottom heat).
Brush a baking sheet with 1 tbsp olive oil.
Knead the dough through again thoroughly by hand, divide in two and roll out each piece into a circle.
Place the dough base on the baking sheet, spread over the tomato sauce and arrange the mozzarella on top.
Drizzle over 1 tbsp olive oil and bake the pizzas for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Mushroom risotto with Parmesan
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves. Dice the Parmesan roughly and put it and the parsley in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Take out and put to one side.

Clean the mushrooms, cutting in half depending on size, put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/1 second. Then remove the contents and reserve. Rinse out the blender jug and wipe dry.
Peel the shallot and garlic cloves, put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/3 seconds.
Add 2 tablespoons of butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat the shallot and garlic using the roast button/3 minutes/120 °C.
Add the risotto rice and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the other ingredients using the roast button/1 minute/120 °C.
Then deglaze with the hot stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook using the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Wash the thyme, shake dry and remove the leaves.
Put the mushrooms and thyme leaves in the blender jug, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook using the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Season with the chilli powder and lemon juice.

Add the Parmesan and parsley mixture and the remaining butter, stir with the spatula and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix using the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3, while helping to stir with the spatula.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, arrange on plates and serve immediately.

TIPS
If no children are eating with you, replace 200 ml stock with dry white wine.
Keep an eye on the risotto during the cooking process and, if necessary, help to stir using the spatula. A perfect risotto should be lightly al dente and have a creamy consistency. It should be neither too dry nor too wet.

ingredients.name: 400 g risotto rice (e.g. Arborio, cooking time: 15 minutes)
1.2 l hot chicken or vegetable stock

steps.text: Wash 4 sprigs of parsley, shake them dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Dice 90 g Parmesan roughly and add it to the blender jug.
Transfer the parsley and Parmesan mixture to a bowl and set it to one side.
Clean 250 g mixed mushrooms, cutting in half depending on size, and add to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 1 second.
Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl.
Peel 1 shallot (30 g) and 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Place a small bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 60 g butter into it.
Place a small bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 60 g butter into it.
Put 2 tbsp of the butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 400 g risotto rice (Arborio) into the blender jug.
Pour 1200 g hot chicken or vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Wash 5 sprigs of thyme, shake them dry, strip off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Add the mushrooms and stir with the spatula.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season with 1 pinch of chilli powder and the juice of ½ lemon.
Transfer the Parmesan and parsley mixture and the rest of the butter to the blender jug and stir with the spatula.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, stir with the spatula through the lid opening.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, arrange on plates and serve immediately.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, arrange on plates and serve immediately.

name: Quiche Lorraine with leek
instructions: Put the flour, butter in chunks, 2 tablespoons of water, one tablespoon of oil, the eggs and 1 teaspoon of salt into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough.
Remove the dough, shape into a ball, wrap in cling film and allow to rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.

Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Remove the rind from the cheese and cut the cheese into 2-cm dice. Put the parsley leaves and the cheese into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop coarsely for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Decant into a large bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Cut the ham into small cubes and add to the cheese.
Trim the leeks, cut in half lengthways (cut into quarters if very thick) and cut the halves into thin slices. Then wash and drain well.

Pour the oil into the blender jug, and the measuring beaker not inserted, stew the leeks with the diced bacon with the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Allow to cool in the open blender jug for 5 minutes, then put the remaining ingredients in the mixing bowl and mix well.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C. Rinse out the blender jug.
Roll the pastry out on a floured work surface, line the baking sheet with greaseproof paper, and line the sheet with the pastry. Alternatively, grease 2 springform tins and line them with pastry.
Cover the pastry with baking parchment and weight it down with the baking beans. Pre-bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven, remove the baking beans and baking parchment and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Turn the oven down to 180 °C.

To make the topping, insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug. Put the soured cream, eggs, 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper and 2 large pinches of nutmeg into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 4.
Put the leek mixture on the pastry and smooth out. Pour the egg and cream mixture over the top and bake the quiche Lorraine in the pre-heated oven for 45 minutes.

TIP
Quiche is delicious served hot, warm or cold.

ingredientsBases.name: MAKES 24 SLICES (1 BAKING TRAY OR 2 SPRINGFORM TINS 26 CM Ø)

ingredients.name: 2 leeks (400 g, only the white and light-green parts)
plain flour (type 405) for the work surface
butter for the tins or greaseproof paper for the baking sheet

steps.text: Line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper or grease two springform tins.
Put 400 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 200 g soft butter in pieces.
Add 2 tbsp water, 1 tbsp oil, 2 eggs (medium) and 1 tsp salt.
Remove the dough, shape the dough into a ball using your hands, wrap in cling film and leave to rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Wash 1 bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake it dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Add 400 g Emmental cheese in pieces.
Transfer the parsley and cheese mixture to a large bowl.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Weigh out 300 g cooked ham, cut into dice and add to the parsley and cheese mixture.
Weigh out 2 leeks (400 g, white and light green parts only).
Cut the leeks in half lengthways (cut very thick leeks into quarters) and then into very thin slices. Wash and drain them well.
Put 4 tbsp oil into the blender jug.
Add 200 g diced bacon.
Add the leek slices.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Allow the leek and bacon mixture to cool in the open blender jug for 5 minutes, then add to the parsley, ham and cheese mixture and mix well.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (upper and lower heat).
Rinse out the blender jug.
Roll the pastry out on a floured work surface and line the greaseproof paper-covered baking sheet or 2 greased springform tins with the pastry.
Cover the pastry with baking parchment and weight it down with the baking beans. Pre-bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven, remove the baking beans and baking parchment and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Turn the oven down to 180 °C.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Put 500 g soured cream into the blender jug.
Add 8 eggs (medium), 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper and 2 big pinches of nutmeg.
Put the leek mixture on the pastry and smooth out evenly. Pour the egg and cream mixture over the top and bake the quiche for 45 minutes.

name: Pasta with broccoli and mushrooms
instructions: Peel the shallots and cut in half, peel the garlic cloves, and put them all in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop using the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes. In the meantime, clean the mushrooms, and, depending on their size, cut them into quarters or eighths.

Pour 800 ml hot vegetable stock into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 5 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add the cream, processed cheese, nutmeg, salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 7. Then add the pasta and mushrooms, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything using the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Wash the broccoli and remove the florets from the stalk.

Put the remaining stock and the broccoli florets in the blender jug, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook using the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug. Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan if liked.

steps.text: Wash 1 head of broccoli (500 g), separate the florets from the stalk and set them to one side.
Clean 300 g button mushrooms and cut into quarters or eighths. Set to one side.
Peel and quarter 2 shallots (60 g), peel 1 garlic clove, and put both into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 40 g butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 800 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 300 g cream into the blender jug.
Add 150 g processed cheese.
Add 1 pinch of nutmeg, ½ tsp salt and 3 pinches of pepper.
Put 500 g penne (cooking time: 12 minutes) into the blender jug.
Add the mushrooms and stir in with the spatula.
Pour 200 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Add 350 g broccoli florets and stir them in using the spatula.
Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes by carrying out the next step; otherwise, skip it.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, scrape down with the spatula and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug.
Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan as desired.

name: Spinach balls with butter and Parmesan
instructions:
Dice the Parmesan roughly, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Decant and put to one side.
Put the bread in pieces in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 20 seconds/speed setting 10. Decant and briefly rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the shallot and garlic, put in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the garlic and shallot mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/2 minutes.

Clean and wash the spinach and spin it dry. Pour the milk into the blender jug, add the spinach and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 6 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
With the measuring beaker in place, chop the spinach for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Allow the spinach to cool for 10 minutes. To do this, remove the blender jug from the machine and put it to one side without a lid.

Add the eggs and the spices to the spinach, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 4.
Add the breadcrumbs and flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix using the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 3. Allow the mixture to rest for 20 minutes. Then decant and rinse out the blender jug thoroughly.

Then, with damp hands, make 12–16 little balls from the spinach mixture. Arrange them equally between the deep and shallow steamer basket.
Pour 1 litre of warm water into the blender jug. Hang the shallow steamer basket in the deep steamer basket, close, put it on the blender jug and cook the balls using the steamer button.

Remove the steamer attachment and put to one side. Empty the blender jug and then reattach. Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Arrange the spinach balls on plates, pour the butter over them and serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

steps.text: Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
Weigh out 250 g fresh spinach, clean, wash and spin it dry, then set it to one side.
Remove the rind from 50 g Parmesan cut into 2 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Transfer to a bowl and set to one side.
Put 175 g dry, day-old bread rolls in pieces into the blender jug.
Transfer to another bowl and briefly rinse out the blender jug.
Peel 1 shallot (30 g) and 1 small garlic clove and put both into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 75 g milk into the blender jug.
Add the spinach.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the blender jug from the appliance and set it to one side.
Leave the spinach to cool for 10 minutes.
Return the blender jug containing the spinach to the appliance.
Add 2 eggs (medium), ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and ¼ tsp nutmeg to the blender jug.
Add the breadcrumbs to the blender jug.
Add 20 g flour.
Transfer the mixture to another bowl and leave it to rest for 20 minutes. Rinse out the blender jug thoroughly.
With damp hands, make 12–16 little balls from the spinach mixture. Arrange them equally between the deep and shallow steamer basket.
Pour 1000 g warm water into the blender jug.
Hang the shallow steamer basket in the deep steamer basket, put it on the blender jug and close.
Remove the steamer baskets and set them to one side.
Empty out the blender jug and then put it back in place.
Put 100 g room-temperature butter in pieces into the blender jug.
Arrange the spinach balls on plates, pour the butter over them and serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

name: Macaroni cheese
instructions: Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling water with 1 teaspoon of salt according to packet instructions until al dente. Drain.

In the meantime, roughly dice the cheddar and Parmesan and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 7 seconds/speed setting 7.
Add the milk, processed cheese, butter, flour, nutmeg and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Put the drained pasta in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix using the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 1, while stirring with the spatula through the lid opening.
Season the pasta again to taste with salt and pepper, arrange on plates and serve.

VARIATION To make the macaroni cheese in the oven, after preparing according to the recipe instructions above, put the macaroni cheese in an ovenproof dish and add another 100 g cheddar to make a gratin. To create a nice crust, add 2–3 tablespoons of breadcrumbs to the dish before baking.

steps.text: Weigh out 500 g macaroni.
Cook the macaroni in plenty of boiling water with 1 tsp salt according to packet instructions until al dente. In the meantime, follow the next steps.
Roughly dice 150 g Cheddar and put it into the blender jug.
Roughly dice 50 g Parmesan and add to the blender jug.
Pour 500 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 50 g processed cheese.
Add 40 g butter in cubes.
Add 50 g flour.
Add 2 pinches of nutmeg and 1 pinch of pepper.
Put the drained macaroni into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, use the spatula to stir through the lid opening.
Season the macaroni again to taste with salt and pepper.

name: Good morning smoothie
instructions:
Peel the melon, remove the seeds, weigh out 150 g flesh and cut up roughly.
Peel the pineapple, remove the hard core and cut 150 g flesh into rough cubes. Reserve 4 pieces for decoration.
Halve the avocado, remove the stone and scrape the flesh out of the skin with a spoon.
Peel the orange and cut into quarters, peel the banana and cut in half.
Put the fruit in the blender jug, add the lemon juice, orange juice and ice cubes and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 12 seconds/speed setting 5.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour into 4 glasses, decorate each one with a piece of pineapple and serve immediately.

steps.text: Peel ¼ honeydew melon, remove the seeds and put 150 g flesh in pieces into the blender jug.
Peel ¼ pineapple, remove the hard core, dice 150 g flesh and add it to the blender jug. Reserve 4 pieces for deocration.
Halve 1 avocado (90 g), remove the stone and add the flesh to the blender jug.
Peel 1 orange (150 g), cut it into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 banana (110 g), cut into pieces and add to the blender jug.
Add 200 g orange juice.
Add the juice of ½ lemon.
Add 200 g ice cubes.
Pour the smoothie into 4 glasses, decorate each with a piece of pineapple and serve immediately.

name: Watermelon-ade
instructions: First, make a sugar syrup from the sugar and 100 ml lukewarm water. Put both in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat for 5 seconds/speed setting 1/100 °C. Then decant and allow to cool completely.

Quarter the melon, remove any seeds and discard the skin. Place the flesh in pieces in the blender jug with the lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 7.
Add the mineral water and sweeten to taste with the sugar syrup. Best served on crushed ice or with ice cubes.

TIPS
Delicious on hot summer days and particularly refreshing with a few mint leaves in the glass.
If you like, you can also add slices of lemon or lime to the carafe or use them to decorate the edge of the glass.
As a refreshing evening drink, serve flavoured with vodka, tequila, or gin.

ingredients.name: ice cubes or crushed ice, if desired

steps.text: Put 100 g sugar into the blender jug.
Add 100 g lukewarm water.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the syrup and leave to cool completely.
Quarter 1 small watermelon (2500 g), remove seeds and skin, and add flesh to the blender jug.
Add 130 g lemon juice.
Add 500 g sparkling mineral water and sweeten to taste with the sugar syrup.
Best served on crushed ice or with ice cubes.

name: Eggnog
instructions:
First, ensure that all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Then put them all in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 9 seconds/speed setting 3/70 °C.
Use a funnel to pour the still-hot eggnog into a sterilised bottle and seal. Store in a cool place.
TIPS Opened bottles should be used up within 4 weeks. This eggnog is a real classic and tastes delicious on its own or with desserts.

ingredients.name: 250 ml white rum or Korn (grain spirit)

steps.text: Keep all of the ingredients are at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Add 250 g icing sugar to the blender jug.
Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip this step.
Put 6 egg yolks (medium) and 1 sachet vanilla sugar into the blender jug.
Add 125 g cream.
Add 250 g white rum or Korn.
Use a funnel to pour the still-hot eggnog into the bottle and seal. Store in a cool place.

name: Strawberry liqueur with vodka
instructions: Put 400 ml lukewarm water with the sugar in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat for 8 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C until it boils. Then allow to cool.
In the meantime, put 2 bottles with their lids in the oven, pre-heated to 180 °C, to sterilise them.
Wash the strawberries, pat them dry and remove their stalks.
Add the strawberries, lemon juice and vodka to the slightly cooled sugar water and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 50 seconds/speed setting 8.
Pour the liqueur through a fine sieve or remove the foam using a ladle. Then fill the sterilised bottles using a funnel.
Seal the bottles immediately and, once cooled, store in the refrigerator.

TIPS
This strawberry liqueur is delicious on its own, in fruit salad and with desserts and ice cream.
The liqueur can be kept in the refrigerator for up to 8 weeks.

steps.text: Put 2 bottles with their lids in the oven, pre-heated to 180 °C (top and bottom heat), for 15 minutes to sterilise them, then put them to one side.
Put 125 g sugar into the blender jug.
Add 400 g lukewarm water.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Take the lid off the sugar water and allow to cool for 15 minutes outside the appliance.
Wash 400 g strawberries, pat dry,  remove the stalks and put in the blender jug.
Add 170 g freshly squeezed lemon juice.
Add 170 g vodka.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Strain the liqueur through a fine sieve or remove the foam using a slotted spoon.
Fill the sterilised bottles using a funnel. Seal the bottles immediately and, once cooled, store in the refrigerator for up to 8 weeks.

name: Milk ice cream
instructions:
Ensure that all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Put the milk, cream, sugar, 1 pinch of salt and the egg yolks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, emulsify for 8 seconds/speed setting 3/80 °C.
Pour the liquidised mixture into a shallow bowl lined with cling film. Allow to cool and then freeze for at least 5 hours (preferably overnight) in the freezer.
Cut the frozen mixture into rough chunks and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 3 seconds/speed setting 9.

Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 10 seconds/speed setting 7. The ice cream is now nice and creamy and unbelievably delicious. If you would like to make the mixture scoopable, we recommend that you freeze it for another hour.

VARIATIONS Before remixing, add 150 g frozen berries for fruit ice cream, 50 g chocolate chips for stracciatella or 1 tablespoon of instant espresso powder to make a creamy cappuccino-flavoured ice cream.

steps.text: Ensure that all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Pour 400 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 400 g cream.
Add 200 g sugar.
Add 1 pinch of salt and 4 egg yolks (medium).
Pour the mixture into a shallow bowl lined with cling film, leave to cool and freeze for at least 5 hours (preferably overnight) in the freezer.
Cut the frozen mixture into rough chunks and put into the blender jug.
The ice cream is now nicely creamy and incredibly delicious. If you would like to make it scoopable, we recommend freezing it for another hour.

name: Fruit sorbet
instructions: Wash and peel the fruit depending on its type, core if necessary, and cut into rough chunks.
With the measuring beaker in place, finely process the sugar in the blender jug for 20 seconds/speed setting 10.

Add the lime juice and fruit and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 5.
Add the ice cubes and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 50 seconds/speed setting 9.
Divide the fruit sorbet into dishes or glasses and serve immediately.
TIPS For a creamy sorbet, use mainly firm fruits. You can also use frozen fruit and process it several times until you have the consistency you desire. In this case, you do not need to use ice cubes.

steps.text: Put 150 g sugar into the blender jug.
Weigh out 300 g mixed fresh fruit.
Wash, peel and core the fruit depending on its type, cut into rough chunks and put it into the blender jug.
Add the juice of 2 limes.
Add 800 g ice cubes.
Divide the fruit sorbet between dishes or glasses and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate custard with vanilla sauce
instructions:
Break the chocolate into pieces and put them in the blender jug. Add the sugar vanilla sugar and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 25 seconds/speed setting 10.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Then insert the mixer attachment.
Put the milk, cornflour and egg yolk in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 12 seconds/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Pour the custard into several small dishes (or one large dish) that have been rinsed in cold water, and allow to cool in the refrigerator. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.

Insert the mixer attachment. Cut the vanilla pods lengthways and scrape out the seeds. Mix the cornflour with 3 tablespoons of cold milk.
Put the vanilla pulp, the remaining milk, sugar, egg and cornflour mixture in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 8 minutes/speed setting 4, then, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Pour the sauce into a dish and allow to rest for at least 10 minutes before serving to allow it to continue thickening.
Serve the vanilla sauce with the custard.

TIPS If you would prefer the vanilla sauce to be thicker, use 15 g cornflour. Real vanilla sauce fans can simply double the ingredients for the vanilla sauce. You do not have to adjust the settings to do this. Vanilla sauce tastes delicious either hot or cold. It will continue to thicken in the refrigerator, so remove it from the refrigerator half an hour before eating and stir it through again thoroughly by hand.

ingredients.name: 300 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Break 100 g dark chocolate into pieces and put it into the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp sugar and ½ sachet vanilla sugar.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Pour 500 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 40 g cornflour.
Add 1 egg yolk (medium).
Pour the custard into small dishes (or one large dish) that have been rinsed in cold water, and leave to cool in the refrigerator.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Cut 1 vanilla pod lengthways, scrape out the seeds and put them into the blender jug.
Place a container on top of the blender jug, weigh out 300 g milk into it and set to one side.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 10 g cornflour into it.
Mix the cornflour in the bowl together with 3 tbsp of the milk.
Pour the rest of the milk into the blender jug.
Add 1 egg (large) and the cornflour mixture.
Add 20 g sugar.
Pour the sauce into a dish and allow to rest for at least 10 minutes before serving to allow it to continue thickening.
Serve the vanilla sauce with the custard.

name: Vanilla custard
instructions: Halve the vanilla pod vertically, scrape out the seeds, then put pod and seeds and all the remaining ingredients in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, thicken for 8 seconds/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod. Serve lukewarm or cold.
TIP Use glasses to serve and create alternate layers of crushed chocolate biscuits or brownies and custard. It looks fabulous and tastes delicious.

steps.text: Halve 1 vanilla pod vertically, scrape out the seeds, then put pod and seeds and 2 egg yolks (large) and 1 pinch of salt into the blender jug.
Add 500 g milk.
Add 60 g sugar.
Add 40 g cornflour.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod. Serve lukewarm or cold.

name: Semolina pudding with apricot and cherry compote
instructions:
Wash, dry, halve and stone the apricots and cherries.
Put the apricot halves with the honey and 80 ml water in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 10 seconds/speed setting 2/100 °C until the apricots are soft.

With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 5, then pour out of the blender jug into a bowl and stir in the cherries, adding lemon juice to taste. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Dry-fry the pistachios in a frying pan, cool and chop.

Put the milk, cream, sugar and semolina in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 12 seconds/speed setting 2/80 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Divide the semolina pudding into small dessert bowls and serve with the compote on top. Sprinkle the pistachio nuts over the dessert.
TIP You may like to mix a little grated lemon peel into the semolina pudding. Simply add to the blender jug together with the milk, cream, sugar and semolina.

ingredients.name: 500 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
200 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Weigh out 150 g cherries, wash, dry, halve and stone them, then set aside.
Wash, dry, halve and stone 6 apricots (300 g), then put them into the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp honey.
Add 80 g water.
Put the cherries you prepared and 1 tsp lemon juice into the blender jug.
Decant and clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Toast 30 g pistachio nuts in a dry pan, leave them to cool and then chop them.
Pour 500 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 200 g cream at room temperature.
Add 50 g sugar.
Add 90 g soft wheat semolina.
Divide the semolina pudding between 4 small dessert bowls, spoon over the stewed fruit and sprinkle the pistachio nuts over the top.

name: Spelt bread
instructions: Put the flour, salt, yeast, honey, oil and 300 ml lukewarm water in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button. Towards the end, add 50 g seeds. The dough should still be a little sticky but should come away easily from the sides of the jug.

Lightly grease a loaf tin and sprinkle with bran or breadcrumbs. Put the dough in it and hit the tin on the table several times so that the dough moves into the corners. Cover with a clean tea towel and allow the dough to rise in an evenly warm place for 1 hour until it completely fills the tin.

Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C. Beat the egg yolk and milk and brush the upper surface of the dough with it. Sprinkle with the remaining seeds and bake the bread in the hot oven for 40 minutes. You will know that the bread is ready when it sounds hollow when you hit it with a spoon.
Remove the bread from the oven, allow to cool briefly in the tin, then turn it out of the tin and allow to cool completely.
TIPS This loaf can also be baked with rye flour (type 1150) or dark wheat flour (type 1050). Other seeds can be used, as desired.

ingredients.name: 70 g seeds if desired (e.g. linseeds, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds)
fat and bran or breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Put 400 g wholemeal spelt flour into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt, 1 sachet dried yeast, 1 tsp honey and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Add 300 g lukewarm water.
Put 50 g seeds into the blender jug.
Lightly grease a loaf tin and sprinkle with bran or breadcrumbs.
Put the dough into the tin and hit the tin on the table several times so that the dough moves into the corners.
Cover the tin with a clean tea towel and allow the dough to rise in an evenly warm place for 1 hour until it completely fills the tin.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (upper and lower heat).
Beat 1 egg yolk (medium) with 1 tbsp milk in a small bowl and brush the upper surface of the dough with it.
Sprinkle with 20 g seeds and bake the bread in the hot oven for 40 minutes.
You will know that the bread is ready when it sounds hollow when you hit it with a spoon.
Remove the bread from the oven, allow to cool briefly in the tin, then turn it out of the tin and allow to cool completely.

name: Plaited yeast loaf with raisins
instructions: Put the raisins in a bowl, pour boiling water over them, steep for 5 minutes and then drain.
Put the milk at room temperature, sugar and butter in the blender jug, crumble the yeast in, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat everything for 3 minutes/speed setting 2/37 °C.
Put the remaining ingredients for the dough except the raisins in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough

Place the dough on a floured work surface and knead in the raisins by hand. Then put the dough in a bowl greased with butter, cover with a damp tea towel and allow to rise in a warm place for 1 hour (the volume should approximately double in size).

Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C and place an ovenproof dish filled with water on the floor of the oven. (Alternatively, fill the dripping pan with water and place on the lowest shelf.) Line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper. Divide the dough into three portions, all as nearly the same size as possible, and shape each one into a roll of approximately 45 cm long.

Lay the three rolls next to one another, press the ends together lightly at the top, then alternately place the left, then the right roll over the centre one and continue to plait to the end of the rolls. Press the ends together lightly.

In a small bowl, whisk the egg yolk and milk together with a fork. Brush the plaited dough with the egg wash, sprinkle it with flaked almonds and bake for 30 minutes. If necessary, place some aluminium foil over the plait after 25 minutes so that it does not become too dark.

TIPS This loaf can also be made without raisins. Proceed as described above and, before proving, knead the dough by hand on a floured surface and do not add the raisins. If you like a sweeter version with a nice sheen, push 8 tablespoons of apricot jam through a sieve and put the sieved jam in a saucepan with 2 tablespoons of water until it is liquid. Then bring to the boil for 8 minutes until the jam begins to gel. Coat the still warm loaf evenly with the hot jam. This works particularly well if you use a pastry brush. This plaited yeast loaf is particularly suited to freezing. Simply defrost at room temperature.

ingredients.name: 250 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
1 egg yolk and 2 tbsp milk for brushing

steps.text: Weigh out 50 g raisins into a bowl on the blender jug.
Pour boiling water over the raisins, steep them for 5 minutes and then drain.
Pour 250 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 60 g sugar.
Add 50 g butter.
Crumble in 25 g fresh yeast.
Put 450 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 1 egg (medium), 1 pinch of salt and 1 tbsp grated zest of an unwaxed lemon.
Place the dough on a floured work surface and knead in the raisins by hand.
Grease a bowl with butter and dampen a tea towel.
Then put the dough in the bowl, cover with the damp tea towel and allow to rise in a warm place for 1 hour (it should approximately double in size).
Line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper and set it to one side.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
Place an oven dish filled with water on the floor of the oven. (Alternatively, fill the dripping pan with water and place on the lowest shelf.)
Divide the dough into three portions, all as nearly the same size as possible, and shape each one into a roll of approximately 45 cm long.
Lay the three rolls next to one another, press the ends together lightly at the top, then alternately place the left, then the right roll over the centre one.
Continue to plait to the end of the rolls. Press the ends together lightly.
Whisk 1 egg yolk and 2 tbsp milk together in a small bowl.
Brush the plaited dough with the egg wash, sprinkle it with flaked almonds and bake for 30 minutes.
If necessary, place some aluminium foil over the plait after 25 minutes so that it does not become too dark.

name: Eggnog cake
instructions: Grease a Bundt tin and dust with breadcrumbs. Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C.

Pour the batter into a bowl and fold in the cherries. Pour the batter into the cake tin and bake for about 70 minutes on the lowest shelf of the oven. After 50 minutes, cover the tin with aluminium foil, so that the cake does not become too brown. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the cake is cooked, and bake for a little longer if necessary. Allow the cake to cool almost completely in the tin and only then turn out onto a cake rack.
Pour the icing sugar into a bowl and stir in the cherry juice until smooth. Use a pastry brush to coat the cake with the glaze.

ingredients.name: fat and breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
Grease a Bundt tin and dust with breadcrumbs.
Preheat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Place 250 g soft butter in the blender jug.
Add 200 g sugar.
Add 1 sachet of vanilla sugar and 4 eggs (medium).
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 350 g flour.
Add 1 sachet of baking powder and 1 pinch of salt.
Add 250 g Advocaat.
Weigh out 400 g cherries, wash, dry and remove the stones.
Transfer the dough to a bowl and stir in the prepared cherries. Pour the dough into the Bundt tin.
Bake the cake for 70 minutes on the bottom rack. After 50 minutes, cover the tin with aluminium foil so that the cake does not become too brown.
Use a wooden cocktail stick to test the cake for doneness and if necessary, bake a few minutes more.
Allow the cake to cool almost completely in the tin and only then turn out on a cake rack.
Weigh out 120 g icing sugar in the clean blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip this step.
Put the icing sugar in a bowl with 4 tbsp cherry juice and stir until smooth, then coat the cake with this glaze.

name: Apple cake
instructions:
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C. Grease the springform tin and sprinkle with a few breadcrumbs.
Peel the apples and cut into eighths.
Put the eggs, sugar, baking powder, flour and cinnamon in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 6.

Pour the mixture into the prepared springform tin.
Arrange the pieces of apple evenly on the batter and bake in the hot oven for 40 minutes. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the cake is cooked, and bake for a little longer if necessary.

Remove the cake from the oven, let it cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, release the catch on the tin and lift the cake out and leave to continue to cool.
Cut into slices and serve.

ingredients.name: fat and breadcrumbs to grease the tin

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Grease a springform tin and sprinkle with a few breadcrumbs.
Place 140 g flour in the blender jug.
Add 1 level tsp baking powder, 4 eggs (medium) and ½ tsp cinnamon.
Add 220 g sugar.
Pour the dough into the prepared springform tin.

Weigh out 3 apples 
(450 g), peel and cut into quarters.
