Arrange the apple pieces evenly over the dough and bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes.
Use a wooden cocktail stick to test the cake for doneness and bake a little longer if necessary.
Remove the cake from the oven and allow to cool in the springform tin for a few minutes.
Using a small knife, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, open the springform, lift the cake out and continue to cool.
Cut the cake into slices and serve.

name: Tomato sauce
instructions: Peel the onions and garlic cloves. Quarter the onions and put them with the garlic cloves into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/2 minutes.
Wash the basil, shake dry, remove the leaves from the stalks and chop finely.

Put the basil, sieved tomatoes, sugar, dried herbs, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper into the blender jug. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/17 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season again to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 3.
TIPS This sauce is useful to have in store when making pizza and pasta dishes. In this case, pour while still hot into suitable, sterile containers. Once the sauce is cold, it freezes well.

steps.text: Peel 4 onions (300 g) and 4 cloves of garlic.
Cut the onion into quarters and place in the blender jug with the garlic.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 100 g olive oil at room temperature.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Wash ½ bunch of basil and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stems, chop finely and add to the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp sugar, 2½ tsp oregano, 1½ tsp marjoram, 1½ tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper.
Add 2500 g sieved tomatoes (passata).
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

name: Ketchup
instructions: Wash the tomatoes, remove the stalks, quarter and put in the blender jug. Peel the onion and halve, peel the garlic. Add both to the tomatoes in the blender jug. Also add the dried tomatoes to the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 7.

Put all the remaining ingredients in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. Then with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Then, without the measuring beaker inserted, simmer for 2 hours/speed setting 1/95 °C until the ketchup is reduced by a third. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

With the measuring beaker in place, blend the ketchup for 1 minute/speed setting 9. If the ketchup is still too thin, without the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook on speed setting 1/95 °C until the desired consistency is achieved.
Pour the hot ketchup into sterilised jars or bottles, seal immediately and stand them upside down for 5 minutes. Then turn them upright and allow to cool completely.
TIP This ketchup will keep for at least 10 months stored in a cool, dry place. Opened bottles should be always kept in the refrigerator.

ingredients.name: ¼ tsp mace powder, or 1 pinch of nutmeg

steps.text: Prepare 4 sterile jars, 200 ml each.
Wash 1.5 kg tomatoes, remove the stems, cut into quarters and place in the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (70 g), peel 1 garlic clove and add to the blender jug.
Add 15 g dried tomatoes.
Add 70 g jam sugar (1:3).
Add 4 cloves, 2 cardamom pods, ¼ tsp pepper, 1 tsp hot paprika, ¼ tsp allspice, 1 pinch of nutmeg, ¼ tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp salt.
Add 20 g apple cider vinegar.
Remove the measuring jug from the lid. Place the cooking pot on top of the blender jug as a splash guard.
Stir the mixture with the spatula.
Replace the measuring beaker in the lid.
If the ketchup is still too thin, follow the next step without the measuring beaker in place; otherwise, skip this step.
Pour the hot ketchup into the prepared steril jars and close immediately. Turn the jars upside down and let stand for 5 minutes. Then turn back over and allow to cool completely.

name: Avocado spread with salmon
instructions:
Halve the avocado, remove the stone and scrape the flesh out of the skin.
Wash the dill, shake dry and remove the stalks.

Put the avocado, dill and soured cream in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the coarsely chopped smoked salmon, lemon juice, 1 pinch each of salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 5.
Season again with salt and pepper and decant into a small bowl. Serve immediately.

steps.text: Wash 1 small bunch of dill and shake dry. Remove the tough stems and set aside.
Cut 1 avocado (180 g) in half and remove the stone. Scoop out the flesh and place in the blender jug.
Add the prepared dill to the blender jug.
Add 80 g sour cream.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Coarsely tear 100 g smoked salmon into pieces and add.
Add 1 tbsp freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1 pinch of salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Season again to taste with salt and pepper and transfer to a small bowl. Serve immediately.

name: Tuna cream
instructions:
Allow the tuna to drain for 10 minutes and gently squeeze out.
Wash and shake the parsley dry, remove the leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/3 seconds. Then use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the tuna, cream cheese, lemon juice, 3 pinches each of pepper and salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 5.
Chop the capers finely using a knife and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Refrigerate the tuna cream for at least 1 hour.

TIP Tuna cream goes particularly well with a fresh, green salad. Using two teaspoons, form the tuna cream into little balls, arrange on crispbreads, canape biscuits or baguette slices and serve with the salad.

steps.text: Drain 200 g tinned tuna in brine for 10 minutes, press out lightly and set aside.
Wash 3 sprigs of curly parsley, shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stems and place them in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Place the drained tuna, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 3 pinches of pepper and 3 pinches of salt.
Add 150 g cream cheese.
Using a knife, finely chop 1 tbsp capers and add to the blender jug.
Refrigerate the tuna cream for at least 1 hour.

name: Four berry jam
instructions:
Sort, wash and drain all the berries.
Remove the redcurrants from their stalks and put them in the blender jug with the blueberries. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the jam sugar, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 2. Cover and steep for 2 hours.

Clean and halve or quarter the strawberries.
Leave the raspberries whole and put them with the strawberry pieces in the blender jug with the other fruits.
Add the lemon juice, then stir everything well with the spatula and then, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 12 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.

Do a set test and, if necessary, boil the jam for a little longer.
Purée the jam if desired.
Then fill sterile jars with the jam while it is boiling hot. If the jam touches the rim of the jar, wipe it away. Seal the jars immediately and stand them upside down for 5 minutes. Then turn them the right way up again and let them cool completely.

SET TEST Put a teaspoon of the hot jam on a cold plate, then tip the plate slightly. If it runs easily, cook the jam for another minute. Then try again. If after a short time the mixture is wrinkling, it has passed the set test. TIP If you like your jam fruity, use 500g jam sugar 1:2.

steps.text: Prepare 8 sterile jars, 250 ml each.
Pick through 250 g redcurrants, wash and drain.
Remove the redcurrants from the stems and place in the blender jug.
Pick through 250 g blueberries, wash, drain and add to the blender jug.
Add 1 kg jam sugar (1:1).
Cover and allow to set for 2 hours.
Wash 250 g strawberries, cut into halves or quarters and place in the blender jug.
Add 250 g raspberries.
Add 2 tbsp lemon juice.
Carry out a set test. If necessary, cook the jam a little longer; otherwise, skip the next step.
Pour the hot jam into the prepared sterile jars. Wipe off any jam that splashes onto the rims.
Close the jars immediately, turn upside down and let stand for 5 minutes. Then turn the jars back over and allow to cool completely.

name: Orange marmalade
instructions: Rinse the oranges in hot water and dry.
Pour 1.75 litres of cold water into the blender jug. Attach the deep steamer basket, put the washed but unpeeled oranges in it, close the basket and cook the oranges with the steamer button/1 hour.
Then cook again with the steamer button/15 minutes.
Finally, drain off the liquid and allow the fruit to cool for 15 minutes.
Cut each orange into eight, remove the central core and put the flesh in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 5.
Add both types of sugar, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Add the orange juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything together with the reverse button/12 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.

Then carry out a set test and if necessary cook for a few more minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C. Pour the marmalade while still hot into previously prepared sterile jars and close firmly. To ensure the marmalade keeps for longer, stand the jars upside down for 5 minutes.

SET TEST  
Put a teaspoon of the hot marmalade on a cold plate, then tip the plate slightly. If it runs easily, cook the marmalade for another minute. Then try again. If after a short time the marmalade is wrinkling, it has passed the set test.

steps.text: Prepare 5 sterile jam jars, 350 ml each.
Pour 1.75 litres of water into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket.
Wash 4 large, untreated oranges (1 kg) and place them (unpeeled) in the steamer basket; close the steamer attachment.
Remove the steamer attachment, pour off the cooking water and allow the fruit to cool for 15 minutes.
Cut the unpeeled oranges into quarters; remove the seeds and place the fruit in the blender jug.
Add 500 g brown sugar.
Add 650 g sugar.
Add 100 g orange juice.
Carry out a set test. If necessary, cook the marmalade for a few more minutes; otherwise, skip the next step.
Pour the hot marmalade into the prepared sterile jars.
Close the jars immediately and stand upside down for 5 minutes. Then turn the jars back over and allow to cool completely.

name: Spaghetti with creamy salmon
instructions: Wash the salmon fillets under running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips.

Wash and clean the courgette and cut in half length-ways. Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 7 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside the blender jug and repeat this step, if necessary.

Add the cream, hot vegetable stock, flour and dill, and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.
In the meantime, cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Then drain and keep warm.
Rinse the lime in hot water, zest it until you have ½ a teaspoon and squeeze out the juice.

Put the salmon, zest and 2 tablespoons of lime juice into the blender jug and season with ⅓ teaspoon of salt and 3 big pinches of pepper and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/4 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Then switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

TIP
If you would like a creamier sauce, after boiling it down, stir 1-2 teaspoons of cornflour in 30 ml of cold water until smooth and pour into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, bring the sauce to the boil again with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C and then continue to follow the recipe.

ingredients.name: 250 g fresh salmon fillet without skin (alternatively, defrost frozen salmon)
1 tbsp finely chopped dill (fresh or frozen)

steps.text: Wash and clean 1 courgette (200 g), and cut in half length-ways.
Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 200 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Pour in 250 g hot vegetable stock.
Add 2 tsp flour and 1 tbsp finely chopped dill.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Cook 400 g spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Drain and keep warm.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 250 g fresh skinless salmon fillet.
Wash the salmon fillets under running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips. Put the salmon into the blender jug.

Rinse 1 unwaxed lime in hot water, grate 
½ tsp zest, squeeze out the juice, and add 
2 tbsp juice and the zest to the blender jug.
Add ⅓ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

name: Mussels in tomato sauce
instructions:
Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks.
Put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.
Wash the mussels under running cold water. Discard any open mussels.
Peel the garlic and put in the blender jug together with the chillies. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6 then scrape the mixture down inside the blender jug.

Add the fennel seeds and 3 tablespoons of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat them using the roast button/5 minutes/100 °C.
Add the tomatoes, the wine, 125 ml water and 1 teaspoon of salt and, the measuring beaker in place, mix for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Put the mussels in the deep steamer basket, close it and put it on the blender jug, and cook with the steamer button/15 minutes.

Heat up the remaining oil in a large saucepan, fry the slices of bread on both sides over a medium heat and sprinkle over a total of ¼ teaspoon of pepper.
Put the mussels in a large bowl, sort out the closed mussels and discard.
Pour the tomato sauce over the mussels, sprinkle with the parsley and serve with the fried bread.

TIP There was once the rule that you should only eat mussels when there is an ‘r’ in the month. Nowadays you can obtain mussels in the summer months as a frozen product and you can use these in this recipe, too. Simply extend the steaming time by 5 minutes. Take note, however: with frozen mussels, you must also remove the open ones before cooking, and remove those that have not opened after cooking.

steps.text: Wash 2 kg mussels under running cold water.
Discard any open mussels, and put the rest to one side.
Wash 1 bunch of parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves from their stalks and put into the blender jug.
Transfer the parsley to a small bowl.
Peel 4 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Add 2 dried red chillies.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp fennel seeds and 3 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.

Add 800 g chopped tinned tomatoes and 
1 tsp salt.
Add 250 g dry white wine.
Add 125 g water.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put the mussels in the deep steamer basket, attach this to the blender jug and close.

Heat 5 tbsp oil in a large saucepan, fry 4 slices of white bread on both sides over a medium heat and sprinkle with a total of 
¼ tsp pepper.
Put the mussels into a large bowl and look for and discard any that are closed.
Pour the tomato sauce over the mussels, sprinkle with the parsley and serve with the fried bread.

name: Paella
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake dry, remove the leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Then remove and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel the onion and garlic, halve the onion, put both in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Then remove and rinse out the blender jug.

Wash, quarter and clean the peppers and cut into narrow strips of ½ cm. Heat the oven to 60 °C and put an oven-proof bowl or large casserole in to warm up for 20 minutes. Dissolve the strands of saffron in a litre of warm water. Put the rice in the cooking pot, place in the blender jug, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of salt on top and pour the saffron-infused water on top.

Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug, arrange the frozen seafood in it, distributed evenly, close the steamer basket and cook everything using the steamer button. Arrange the strips of pepper and the peas evenly in the shallow steamer basket and 15 minutes before the end of the cooking time, carefully attach to the blender jug.

Rinse the chicken fillets, pat dry and season with ½ teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper. Rinse the pike-perch, pat dry and cut into bite-size pieces. Cut the pepperoni sausage into thin slices. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a wide pan and fry the chicken fillets and the fish pieces in turn. Then keep warm.

Remove the two steamer baskets and put aside closed. Then remove the cooking pot and empty the blender jug. Put 1 tablespoon of olive oil, the garlic and onion mixture and the slices of pepperoni in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/4 minutes. Add the hot chicken stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat everything through using the roast button/3 minutes.

Put the rice in a large bowl, add the strips of pepper and the peas, the cooking juices, the pepperoni slices and the parsley, and mix everything together well. Season to taste with salt, pepper and cayenne pepper. Put everything in a pre-warmed paella dish or casserole. Arrange the seafood, chicken and fish evenly on top. Wash and dry the lemon and cut into slices. Cut into half if desired and serve with the paella.

steps.text: Dissolve ½ tsp saffron threads in 1 l warm water and put aside.
Wash 1 bunch of parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Transfer the parsley to a small bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 2 garlic cloves, halve the onion, and put both into the blender jug.
Transfer to a small bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Heat the oven to 60 °C and put a large oven-proof bowl or large casserole in to warm up for 20 minutes.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 350 g rice into the cooking pot.
Add 1 tsp salt and pour the saffron-infused water on top.
Quarter, clean and wash 1 ½ red peppers (230 g) and cut them into 0.5 cm-wide strips.
Spread the pepper strips with 150 g peas evenly in the shallow steamer basket.
Spread the pepper strips with 150 g peas evenly in the shallow steamer basket.
Rinse 200 g chicken fillets, pat dry and season with ½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Rinse 200 g pike-perch, pat dry, cut into bite-size pieces and set aside.
Arrange 600 g frozen mixed seafood in the deep steamer basket.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and the onion and garlic mixture.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and the onion and garlic mixture.
Cut 200 g pepperoni sausage into thin slices and put into the blender jug.
Cut 200 g pepperoni sausage into thin slices and put into the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and the onion and garlic mixture.
Cut 200 g pepperoni sausage into thin slices and put into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 350 g hot chicken stock into the blender jug.
Put the rice in a large bowl.
Add the pepper strips and peas, the stock with the pepperoni slices and the parsley, and mix everything well.
Season to taste with salt, pepper and Cayenne pepper. Put everything in the pre-warmed dish or casserole.
Arrange the seafood, chicken and fish evenly on top.
Wash 1 unwaxed lemon (80 g), dry and cut into slices. Cut in half if desired, and serve with the paella.

name: Cream of courgette soup
instructions:
Peel the onion and the garlic clove, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/4 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash, trim, halve and roughly dice the courgettes and put into the blender jug with the hot vegetable stock, ½ teaspoon of salt and 2 pinches of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, cook for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C.

Add the butter and processed cheese and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually.
Season again with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

steps.text: Peel ½ small onion (20 g) and 1 garlic clove and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 4 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash, trim, halve and roughly dice 2 courgettes (500 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Pour 500 g hot, strong vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt and 2 pinches of pepper.
Add 1 tbsp butter and 2 tbsp processed cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

name: Pearl barley soup with mixed vegetables
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake it dry. Remove the leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. If necessary, use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process. Put the parsley in another container.

Peel the carrots, parsley root, celeriac and potatoes and cut into rough pieces.
Thoroughly wash the white part of the leek and also cut into rough pieces.
With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 9 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the chicken stock at room temperature, 700 ml warm water and the pearl barley and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook using the reverse button/50 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Divide the soup between deep bowls and serve sprinkled with parsley.

ingredients.name: 2 medium sized primarily waxy potatoes (150 g)
400 ml chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash ½ buch of parsley and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stalks and place in the blender jug.
If necessary, use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug and repeat the process; otherwise, skip the next step.
Transfer the parsley to another container.
Peel 2 carrots (150 g), cut into coarse chunks and place in the blender jug.
Peel 1 parsley root (80 g), cut into rough pieces and add to the blender jug.
Peel a piece of celeriac (150 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Peel 2 potatoes (150 g), cut into rough pieces and add.

Thoroughly wash the white part of ½ leek 
(80 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 400 g chicken stock (at room temperature) to the blender jug.
Add 700 g warm water.
Add 60 g pearl barley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into deep bowls and serve sprinkled with the parsley.

name: Bacon-wrapped chicken breast
instructions:
Pour 1 litre of warm tap water into the blender jug and add 1 teaspoon of salt.
Peel the potatoes, cut into quarters and put in the cooking pot.
Peel the carrots and cut into slices on the diagonal, 1 cm thick.
Spread the carrots around the deep steamer basket and sprinkle with ¼ teaspoon of salt and the sugar.

Wash the chicken fillets and pat them dry.
Season the fillets on both sides with a total of ¼ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper.
Wrap each fillet in 2 slices of bacon each.
Cut the greaseproof paper to size and place in the shallow steamer basket in such a way that the slits at the side are not covered and the steam can circulate. Place the fillets on the greaseproof paper.
Attach the shallow steamer basket to the deep steamer basket, thus closing the blender jug. Put the lid in place for the shallow steamer basket. Cook the potatoes, carrots and chicken using the steamer button.

Then remove the steamer attachment completely and put aside closed.
Empty the blender jug and transfer the potatoes from the cooking pot to the blender jug. Add the milk, 50 g butter, ½ teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and the nutmeg. With the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3 to make a chunky mashed potato, or, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 3 for a creamier mash.
Divide the potato between four plates and place the chicken on top. Mix the carrots with the remaining butter and add to the plates. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley and serve immediately.

TIPS If you do not like carrots, you can cook broccoli rosettes or sliced courgette in the deep steamer basket. In this case, do not use the sugar. For a crispier version, fry the chicken breast wrapped in bacon after steaming for a short time in a hot frying pan.

steps.text: Wash and peel 10 carrots (700 g) and cut into 1 cm thick diagonal slices.
Spread the carrots around the deep steamer basket and sprinkle with ¼ tsp salt and 1 tsp sugar.
Pour 1,000 g warm tap water into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Peel, wash and quarter 800 g potatoes and put them into the cooking pot.
Place a plate on the blender jug and weigh in 4 chicken breast fillets, 175 g each.
Wash the chicken breast fillets under cold running water and pat dry.
Season the chicken breast fillets on both sides with ¼ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper. Wrap each fillet in 2 slices of bacon.
Cut greaseproof paper to size and place in the shallow steamer basket in such a way that the slits at the side are not covered and steam can circulate.
Place the chicken fillets on the greaseproof paper.
Attach the shallow steamer basket to the deep steamer basket, attach to the blender jug and close.
Remove the steamer attachment completely and put aside closed.
Remove the cooking pot from the blender jug, empty the blender jug out and transfer the potatoes from the cooking pot to the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug, weigh in 25 g butter and then put aside.
Pour 150 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 50 g butter.
Add ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and 2 pinches of nutmeg.
Carry out the next step if you want a creamier mash; otherwise skip it.
Divide the potato mash between 4 plates and place the chicken on top.
Mix the carrots with the remaining butter and add to the plates. Garnish with 2 tbsp freshly chopped parsley and serve immediately.

name: Lentil soup
instructions: Wash and trim the carrots and celeriac and cut into 2-cm pieces. Put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Peel and halve the onions.

Wash and trim the leek, cut into rough pieces and put them into the blender jug with the onions. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour the sunflower oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the vegetables with the roast button/3 minutes/100 °C until transparent.

Put the lentils into the blender jug and pour in 1.5 litres of hot water. Stir well with the spatula. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/20 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Then add the stock powder and use the spatula to stir well.

Add the sausages to the blender jug (cut in half if necessary) and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook the soup again with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Season the soup with lovage, marjoram, 2 teaspoons of salt, ½ teaspoon of pepper and apple cider vinegar and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1. Serve the soup with the sausages.

TIP
If you prefer a heartier soup, put 100 g diced bacon into the blender jug with the sunflower oil.

steps.text: Peel, wash and trim 2 carrots (120 g), dice into 2 cm cubes and put  into the blender jug.
Peel, wash and trim ⅓ celeriac (200 g), dice into 2 cm cubes and put  into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (120 g) and add them to the blender jug.

Trim and wash 1 leek 
(90 g), cut it into rough pieces and add it to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp sunflower oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 500 g pardina lentils into the blender jug.
Add 1500 g lukewarm water.
Stir thoroughly with the spatula.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 2 tbsp meat stock powder and stir with the spatula.
Add 6 ground pork sausages (cut in half if necessary).
If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Season the soup with 1½ tsp lovage, 1 tsp marjoram, 2 tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper and 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar.
Serve the soup with the sausages.

name: Chicken satay with rice and vegetables
instructions:
Peel the garlic clove and the ginger, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely using the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, lime juice and curry powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 40 seconds/speed setting 4.
Line the deep steamer basket with greaseproof paper in such a way that sufficient steam can still circulate.

Wash the chicken breast fillets, pat dry and place on the greaseproof paper. Spread the peanut butter sauce evenly on top and clean the blender jug.
Wash and peel the vegetables and pat them dry. Cut them into bite-size pieces and place in the shallow steamer basket.

Put the rice in the cooking pot and hang it in the blender jug. Pour 1 litre of hot water over it and season with 1 teaspoon of salt.Place the deep steamer basket on the blender jug and hang the shallow steamer basket inside. Close and cook using the steamer button/15 minutes. Once the cooking time has elapsed, check that the rice and chicken are fully cooked. If necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes.

ingredients.name: 550 g assorted vegetables (e.g. courgettes, peppers, broccoli, carrots)
200 g rice (e.g. basmati, cooking time: 20 minutes)

steps.text:
Peel 1 garlic clove and 1 piece of ginger 
(2 cm) and add in pieces to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 100 g crunchy peanut butter to the blender jug.
Add 30 g soy sauce.
Add 30 g honey.
Add the juice of ½ lime (30 g) and 1 tsp curry powder.
Line the deep steamer basket with greaseproof paper in such a way that sufficient steam can still circulate.
Weigh out 2 chicken breast fillets (500 g).
Wash the chicken breast fillets under cold running water, pat dry and place on the greaseproof paper.
Spread the peanut butter sauce evenly over the meat.
Clean the blender jug.
Weigh out 550 g vegetables of your choice.
Wash and peel the vegetables, cut into into bite-size pieces and place in the shallow steamer basket.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 200 g rice into the cooking pot.
Pour 1000 g hot water over the rice and season with 1 tsp salt.
Place the deep steamer basket with the  chicken breast fillets on the blender jug, hang the shallow steamer basket with the  vegetables inside, and close.
Check that the rice and chicken are fully cooked. If necessary, carry out the next step; otherwise, serve the dish.

name: Cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Peel the potatoes, carrot and parsley root and cut into rough pieces.
Clean the mushrooms and dry as required with kitchen paper.
With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 7 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour on the vegetable stock at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything for 20 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.

Pour in the cream at room temperature, season the soup with ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually.
Finally, season again to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Wash the parsley, shake it dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and chop finely.
Divide the soup between deep bowls, garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

TIP
For a more substantial soup, replace the cooking cream with 200 ml cream (30% fat).

ingredients.name: 2 medium sized primarily waxy potatoes (150 g)
750 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Peel and wash 2 medium-sized potatoes (150 g), cut into rough pieces and put into the blender jug.
Peel and wash ½ carrot (50 g) and ½ parsley root (50 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Clean 300 g button mushrooms, dry as required with kitchen paper and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour 750 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 100 g cream.
Add ¼ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Wash 2 sprigs of parsley, shake dry, strip the leaves and chop finely. Divide the soup between deep bowls, garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

name: Pulled pork with coleslaw
instructions:
Peel the onions and garlic, halve the onion, and put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the garlic and onion mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the harissa paste, maple syrup, soy sauce and spices, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the tomatoes and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 5.
With the measuring beaker in place, bring the mixture to the boil for 8 minutes/speed setting 1/100 ��C. Remove and allow to cool. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Put the pork neck steaks in the freezer bag with the cooled sauce. Close the bag and marinate overnight.

Remove the cabbage’s outer leaves and stalk. Peel the carrots.
Cut the cabbage and carrots into rough pieces, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in two batches for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Then put in a bowl and reserve.

Peel and halve the onion, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
Put the remaining ingredients in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 3.
Add the cabbage and carrots and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix using the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3, while stirring with the spatula through the lid opening.
Remove the coleslaw and chill overnight, to develop its typical taste and the desired consistency. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
The next day, season the coleslaw again with pepper and salt to taste.

Remove the meat from the freezer bag, put the sauce in the blender jug and pour in 250 ml water.
Layer the meat flat in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down using the reverse button/1 hour 39 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

Remove the meat and shred using two forks. Pass the sauce through a sieve. Remove any bits of meat from the sieve and shred these, too. If the sauce is too thin, put it back in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down for 10 minutes/speed setting1/100 °C. The sauce should have the consistency of ketchup.
Put the meat in a dish, pour over the sauce and mix well. Serve with the coleslaw.

ingredients.name: 1.2 kg pork neck steaks without bones (2 cm thick)

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 1 garlic clove, halve the onion and put both into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the garlic and onion mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add 1 tbsp harissa, 3 tbsp maple syrup, 4 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp chilli powder, 
2 tbsp rose paprika, 1 ½ tbsp salt and 2 tsp pepper.
Add 400 g chopped tinned tomatoes.
Decant into a large bowl and leave to cool. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Put the 1.2 kg pork neck steaks in a 3 l ziplock freezer bag with the cooled sauce.
Close the bag and marinate overnight. Once the marinading time is up, proceed from this step.
Remove the outer leaves and stalk of a white cabbage (400 g) and cut the cabbage into pieces.
Put 200 g white cabbage into the blender jug.
Wash and peel 1 large carrot (80 g), cut into chunks and add.
Transfer the carrot and white cabbage to a bowl.
Put the rest of the white cabbage (200 g) into the blender jug.
Decant into the large bowl.
Peel and halve 1 white or red onion (70 g) and put into the blender jug.
Put 250 g salad cream into the blender jug.
Add 3 tbsp oil, 1 tbsp fruit vinegar, 2 dashes of lemon juice, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 pinches of pepper and ¼ tsp salt.
Add 50 g buttermilk.
Put the white cabbage and carrot mixture into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, use the spatula to stir the mixture through the lid opening.
Remove the coleslaw, cover and chill overnight, to develop its typical taste and the desired consistency.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Season the coleslaw again with pepper and salt to taste. Remove the meat from the freezer bag and put the sauce in the blender jug.
Pour in 250 ml water.
Layer the meat flat in the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Remove the meat and shred using two forks.
Pass the sauce through a sieve. Remove any bits of meat from the sieve and shred these, too.
The sauce should have the consistency of ketchup. If it is too thin, put it back into the blender jug and carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Put the meat in a dish, pour over the sauce and mix well.
Season the salad once more with pepper and salt to taste and serve with the pulled pork.

name: Red pepper and ricotta soup
instructions: Wash, trim and quarter the peppers. Dice one pepper quarter into small cubes and set aside. Peel and halve the onion and put in the blender jug with the other pepper quarters. Halve, trim and wash the chilli and also put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop everything for 6 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Pour the oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the chopped vegetables with the roast button.
Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug. Add the vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Add the cream, then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend the soup for 1 minute/speed settings 3–9 increasing the speed setting gradually.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil again for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Remove the blender jug lid and allow the soup to cool down a little.
Wash the rosemary, shake dry, remove the needles and chop finely. Add the ricotta, rosemary and honey to the soup and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 4. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper and serve garnished with the diced pepper.

ingredients.name: 500 ml warm or hot vegetable stock

steps.text: Wash, trim and quarter 4 red peppers (800 g). Finely dice 1 quarter and set to one side.
Put the rest of the peppers in the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (60 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Halve, core and wash 1 red chilli and add it to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 500 g warm or hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 250 g cream to the blender jug.
Remove the lid of the blender jug and leave the soup to cool off a little.
Wash 4 sprigs of rosemary, shake dry, strip the needles, chop them finely and add them to the blender jug.
Add 120 g ricotta.
Add 1 tsp honey.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper and serve garnished with the diced pepper.

name: Sous-vide sirloin steaks
instructions: 30 minutes before preparing, take the beef rump steaks out of the refrigerator and allow to rest at room temperature.

Rinse the steaks under cold running water and pat dry, and vacuum seal the rump steaks in individual bags. Alternatively, put them in freezer bags. Place the freezer bags in water with the opening facing upwards and completely press out the air, then close firmly with pegs.

Place the cooking pot in the blender jug and fill the blender jug with hot water up to just below the rim of the cooking pot. Put the lid on the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat the water for 20 minutes/setting 1/60 °C.

Place the vacuum-sealed rump steaks in the cooking pot and gently push them into the water until they are completely covered. The steaks in freezer bags should be placed in the cooking pot so that the pegged bag openings face upwards.
Add a little more hot water if necessary, but note the maximum fill level of the blender jug.

Now, with the measuring beaker in place, cook the steaks for 1 hour/speed setting 1/55 °C to achieve medium rare to medium or, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 1 hour/speed setting 1/60 °C to achieve medium to well done.

Pre-heat a frying pan on the hob on a high temperature, then pour in the sunflower oil. Remove the steaks from the bags, pat thoroughly dry with kitchen paper and fry each steak in the hot pan for 30 seconds on each side. Remove the steaks from the pan, season with salt and pepper on both sides and serve immediately.

TIP
You can make a tasty sauce from the meat juices in the bags.

ingredients.name: 4 beef rump steaks (180 g each, at least 2 cm thick)

steps.text: Take 4 beef sirloin steaks (each 180 g, at least 2 cm thick) out of the refrigerator and weigh.
Leave the beef rump steaks to rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Rinse the steaks and pat dry, then either vacuum seal in suitable bags or put in freezer bags.
Place the freezer bags in water with the opening facing upwards and completely press out the air, then close firmly with pegs.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Fill the blender jug with hot water up to just below the rim of the cooking pot, and put the lid on.
Place the vacuum-sealed rump steaks in the cooking pot and gently push them into the water until they are completely covered.
The steaks in freezer bags should be placed in the cooking pot so that the pegged bag openings face upwards.
Add a little more hot water if necessary, but note the maximum fill level of the blender jug.
For the next step, adjust the time to how you want the steaks done: 55 °C: medium rare to medium (bright pink), 60 °C: medium to well done (light pink).
Pre-heat a frying pan on the hob, then pour in 5 tbsp sunflower oil.
Remove the steaks from their bags, pat thoroughly dry with kitchen paper and fry each steak in the hot pan for 30 seconds on each side.
Remove the steaks from the pan, season with ½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper on both sides and serve immediately.

name: Stuffed peppers with djuvec rice
instructions:
Cut the peppers in half lengthways, then clean and wash.
Peel the onions and garlic, cut the onions in half, put 1 onion and 1 clove of garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the minced meat, egg, paprika powder, mustard, tomato purée, breadcrumbs, 3 pinches of pepper and ½ teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Generously fill the pepper halves with the mixture.
Then place the stuffed peppers next to each other in the deep steamer basket. Rinse out the blender jug thoroughly and dry.

Put the remaining onion and garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put the sieved tomatoes, oregano and sugar in the blender jug, hang the cooking pot in it, fill with rice and pour the hot vegetable stock over it. Put the deep steamer basket in place, with its lid, and cook using the steamer button/30 minutes. Then remove the deep steamer basket and the cooking pot and set aside.

Add the cream and ajvar to the tomato sauce and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down for 5 seconds/speed setting 2/100 °C. If the sauce is too thin, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down again for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Season the rice and the sauce to taste with pepper and salt. Serve the stuffed peppers with the rice and the sauce and garnish with parsley, if liked.

ingredients.name: 4 small red or orange peppers (520 g)

steps.text: Weigh out 4 small red or orange peppers (520 g).
Cut the peppers in half lengthways, clean and wash them, then set them to one side.
Weigh out, peel and halve 2 medium-sized onions (200 g).
Peel and halve 2 garlic cloves.
Put 1 onion and 1 garlic clove into the blender jug, putting the others to one side.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 500 g minced beef into the blender jug.
Add 1 egg (medium or large), 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp mustard, 2 tsp tomato purée, 2 tsp breadcrumbs, 3 pinches of pepper and ½ tsp salt.
Generously fill the pepper halves with the mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers next to each other in the deep steamer basket.
Rinse out the blender jug thoroughly and dry.
Put the rest of the onion and garlic into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 400 g tomato passata, 2 tsp dried oregano and 1 tbsp sugar into the blender jug.
Hang the cooking pot in the blender jug.
Put 250 g long-grain rice into the cooking pot.
Add 700 g hot vegetable stock.
Put the deep steamer basket in place, with its lid.
Remove the deep steamer basket and the cooking pot. Take out the cooked food, set to one side and keep warm.
Put 100 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp ajvar.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
If the sauce is too thin, carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Season the rice and the sauce with pepper and salt. Serve the stuffed peppers with the rice and sauce and garnish with 1 tbsp freshly chopped parsley.

name: Bifteki with tomato pasta
instructions: Peel and halve the shallots, wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves. Put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 7.

Add the minced meat, egg, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper and Italian herbs and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix using the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1, using the spatula to help.
Put the bifteki mixture in a bowl and clean the blender jug.

Cut the feta into 16 cubes.
Form 16 balls from the meat mixture and put a cube of feta into the middle of each one. Roll up so that the cheese is completely covered by the meat mixture.

Put the kritharaki pasta in the blender jug, together with the chopped tomatoes, paprika powder, salt, pepper and 600 ml of water, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook using the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions/speed setting 1/100 °C.
While it is cooking, heat the oil in a frying pan, sear the bifteki on all sides and continue to fry on a medium heat for 9 minutes.

Remove the pasta from the blender jug and serve with the bifteki.
Wash the basil and shake it dry. Remove the leaves, chop finely and sprinkle on top.
TIP If no children are eating with you, add 1 teaspoon of sambal oelek to the pasta for extra piquancy.

ingredients.name: 500 g mixed beef and pork mince
1 tsp dried Italian herbs or oregano

steps.text: Peel and halve 2 shallots (80 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Wash 5 sprigs of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, tear off the leaves and add to the blender jug.
Put 500 g mixed minced meat into the blender jug.
Add 30 g breadcrumbs.
Add 1 egg (medium), ½ tsp salt, a big pinch of pepper and 1 tsp dried Italian herbs or oregano.
During the next step, stir the mixture occasionally through the lid opening with the spatula.
Decant into a bowl and clean the blender jug.
Cut 100 g feta into 16 cubes and set them to one side.
Form 16 balls from the meat mixture.
Put a cube of feta into the middle of each one and roll up so that the cheese is completely covered by the meat mixture.
Put 250 g Greek kritharaki pasta (orzo) into the blender jug.
Add 600 g water.
Add 400 g chopped tinned tomatoes, 1 tsp mild paprika, 1 tsp salt and 2 big pinches of pepper.
During the next step but one, heat 2 tbsp oil in a frying pan, sear the bifteki on all sides and continue to fry on a medium heat for 9 minutes.
In the next step, adjust the time setting according to the orzo packet instructions.
Remove the pasta from the blender jug and serve with the bifteki.
Wash 2 sprigs of fresh basil, shake them dry, remove the leaves, chop finely and sprinkle on top.

name: Potato salad with Ricotta
instructions: Put the Parmesan in pieces in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 7. Then decant and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces and place in the deep steamer basket.
Pour 1 litre of water into the blender jug, attach the deep steamer basket with the potatoes in it and cook with the steamer button. Check once the cooking time has elapsed whether the potatoes are cooked. If necessary, continue to cook for a few minutes longer.
Put the cooked potatoes to one side and allow to cool completely. Rinse the blender jug in cold water, dry and allow to cool completely.

Wash the basil, shake dry and remove the leaves. With the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 3 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the Ricotta, Parmesan and milk and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Cut the dried tomatoes into fine strips and mix them with the potatoes and dressing in a large bowl. If necessary, season again.
In a non-stick frying pan, dry fry the pine nuts until golden and sprinkle over the salad before serving.
TIP This potato salad tastes even better if the flavours are allowed to infuse for a few hours.

ingredients.name: 80 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Cut 100 g Parmesan into chunks and place in the blender jug.
Transfer the Parmesan to a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Pour 1000 g water into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug.
Wash and peel 1000 g potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces and place in the deep steamer basket.
Close the steamer basket.
Check whether the potatoes are cooked through. If necessary, follow the next step; if not, skip over this step.
Set the potatoes aside and allow to cool completely.
Rinse the blender jug in cold water, dry and allow to cool completely.
Wash 1 bunch of basil and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stems and place them in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 200 g ricotta to the blender jug.
Add the prepared Parmesan.
Add 80 g milk.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cut 15 drained, sun-dried tomatoes into strips and mix together with the potatoes and dressing in a large bowl. Season to taste if necessary.
Roast 20 g pine nuts in a non-stick frying pan without oil until golden brown; sprinkle them on the salad before serving.

name: Coleslaw
instructions:
Remove the cabbage’s outer leaves and stalk.
Peel the carrots.
Cut the cabbage and carrots into rough pieces, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in two batches for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Then put in a bowl.

Peel and halve the onion, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6.
Put all the remaining ingredients into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 3.
Add the cabbage and carrots and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix with the reserve button/30 seconds/speed setting 3, whilst stirring with the spatula through the lid opening.
Decant the coleslaw, cover, and chill overnight. This is how it develops its typical taste and the desired consistency.
The next day, season the coleslaw again to taste with pepper and salt.

steps.text: Remove the outer leaves and stem from a white cabbage.
Peel and wash 1 large carrot (80 g) and cut into coarse chunks.
Cut 200 g white cabbage into coarse chunks and add it to the blender jug along with ½ carrot (40 g).
Transfer the mixture to a bowl.
Cut 200 g white cabbage into coarse chunks and add it to the blender jug along with ½ carrot (40 g).
Transfer the mixture to the bowl.
Peel and halve 1 white or red onion (70 g) and place in the blender jug.
Add 250 g salad cream.
Add 3 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp fruit vinegar.
Add 50 g buttermilk.
Add 2 dashes of lemon juice, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 pinches of pepper and 1 tsp salt.
Add the cabbage and carrots.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, use the spatula to stir the mixture through the lid opening.
Transfer the coleslaw to another container and refrigerate overnight so that it develops its distinctive taste and the desired consistency. The next day, season to taste with pepper and salt.

name: Cheese sauce with tortilla chips
instructions:
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C. Line two baking sheets with greaseproof paper. Cut the tortilla flatbreads into eighths. Mix together all the ingredients for the spiced oil. Place the tortilla pieces on the baking sheets and brush both sides with the spiced oil.
Put the baking sheets in turn in the pre-heated oven for 10 minutes and bake until the tortilla chips are golden and crispy.

To make the cheese sauce, put the milk, cream, processed cheese slices, sambal oelek and mustard in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix for 6 minutes/speed setting 2/70 °C.
Add the salt, vinegar and paprika powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 10 seconds/setting 4.
Serve the still-warm tortilla chips with the cheese sauce. If desired, sprinkle with pickled, sliced jalapeños.
TIPS Also tastes delicious with nachos and taco chips. The sauce will thicken if it is chilled.

ingredients.name: 2 pinches of chilli powder to taste
½ tsp sambal oelek, or similar hot seasoning sauce

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Line 2 baking sheets with greaseproof paper.
Cut 8 small tortillas into eighths.
In a bowl, mix 5 tbsp olive oil, 2 pinches of paprika, ¼ tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper and 2 pinches of chilli powder (to taste).
Lay the tortilla pieces on the prepared baking sheets and brush on both sides with the seasoned oil.
Bake the tortilla pieces in the oven, 4 at a time, for 10 minutes, until they are golden brown and crispy.
Pour 100 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 50 g cream.
Add 250 g processed cheese slices.
Add ½ tsp sambal oelek or similar hot seasoning sauce and 1 tsp medium hot mustard.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add ½ tsp salt, 1 tsp light vinegar and 1 pinch of rose paprika to the blender jug.
Replace the measuring beaker in the lid.
Serve the warm cheese sauce with the still-warm tortilla chips.

name: Falafel with yoghurt dip
instructions: The day before, soak the chickpeas in 2 litres of cold water for 12 hours.

Wash ½ a bunch of parsley, shake dry, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Add the yoghurt, honey, 1 teaspoon of salt, pepper and lemon juice, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 2. Decant into a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Drain the chickpeas in a sieve, rinse through with cold water and pour into the blender jug.

Wash the remaining parsley and coriander, shake dry and remove the leaves. Put into the blender jug. Peel the shallots and halve, and peel the garlic. Put both into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the drained chickpeas, harissa and the remaining salt for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and repeat this step a few times until you have a smooth, creamy mixture.
Decant the mixture and, using two spoons, cut out round shapes. Heat the oil in a deep pan or wok and fry the falafel until golden. Allow to drain on kitchen paper and serve with the yoghurt dip.

ingredients.name: 400 ml neutrally flavoured oil for frying

steps.text: Soak 250 g chickpeas in 2 litres of cold water for 12 hours.
Wash ½ bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry and place in the blender jug.
Add 500 g Greek yoghurt to the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp honey, 1 tsp salt, a pinch of pepper and 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Drain the soaked chickpeas in a sieve, rinse with cold water and place in the blender jug.
Wash ½ bunch flat-leaf parsley and ½ bunch coriander and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stalks and add them to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 shallots (100 g); peel 1 clove of garlic and add both to the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp mild harissa and 1 tsp salt.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Repeat the next step until the mixture is smooth and velvety; otherwise, skip this step.
Repeat the next step until the mixture is smooth and velvety; otherwise, skip this step.
Repeat the next step until the mixture is smooth and velvety; otherwise, skip this step.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and use 2 spoons to cut out round shapes.
Place a container on top of the blender jug; weigh our 400 g neutral-flavoured oil and set aside.
Heat the oil in a deep pan or wok and fry the falafel in the oil until golden brown.
Allow the falafel to drain on kitchen paper and serve with the yoghurt dip.

name: Feta and rocket omelette with dried tomatoes
instructions:
Mix the eggs, cream, salt and pepper in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, for 30 seconds/setting 4. Then decant and rinse out the blender jug thoroughly.
Cut some greaseproof paper to fit snugly in the shallow steamer basket so that the raw egg does not seep out.

Pour 1 litre of water into the blender jug. Attach the shallow and deep steamer baskets and the lid to the blender jug and cook using the steamer button.
Cut the finished omelette into four and serve with a fresh salad and baguette, as desired.

Clean the rocket and remove the hard stalks. Then wash the leaves, shake them dry and spread them on the greaseproof paper in the shallow steamer basket. Pour the egg mixture carefully over the spinach and crumble the feta on top. Then drain the dried tomatoes, cut into strips and arrange on top of the mixture.

ingredients.name: 10 g dried tomatoes, packed in oil

steps.text: Place 50 g cream in the blender jug.
Add 6 eggs (medium), ½ tsp salt and a pinch of pepper.
Transfer the egg mixture to another container and rinse the blender jug thoroughly.
Line the shallow steamer basket with greaseproof paper in such a way that it fits well and the egg mixture cannot run out.
Wash 30 g of rocket and shake dry. Remove the hard stalks and spread over the greaseproof paper in the shallow steamer basket.
Lay a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 100 g feta cheese; set aside.
Pour 1 litre water into the blender jug.
Place the deep steamer basket together with the shallow steamer basket over the blender jug.
Carefully pour the egg mixture into the shallow steamer basket; crumble the feta cheese over the egg mixture.
Drain 10 dried tomatoes packed in oil; cut them into strips and distribute over the egg mixture.

name: Ratatouille
instructions:
Clean and wash the courgette and aubergine and dice into cubes of 1.5 cm.
Clean, wash and dice the pepper.
Wash the tomatoes, remove their stalks and cut the flesh into quarters.
Peel the onions and garlic.
Wash the herbs and shake them dry. Remove the leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug using the turbo button/5 seconds. Decant the herbs into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

With the measuring beaker in place, put the onion and garlic in the blender jug and chop using the turbo button/5 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add ½ tablespoon of oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/2 minutes. Decant the onions and garlic.
Put the courgette, pepper and 1 tablespoon of oil in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button. Then decant and reserve.
Put another tablespoon of oil, the aubergine and tomatoes in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook using the roast button.

Then add to the aubergine and tomatoes, the courgette, pepper, onions, garlic, herbs, the remaining oil, 1 teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Once more, season to taste with salt and pepper.
TIP This dish goes well with fried fish or rice.

steps.text: Wash 3 stalks of parsley, 3 stalks of basil and 2 sprigs of thyme, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 5 seconds.
Transfer the herbs to a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel 1 small onion (40 g) and 1 garlic clove and put both into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 5 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Put ½ tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the onion and garlic clove into a bowl.
Clean and wash 1 courgette (250 g), dice into cubes of 1.5 cm and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 red pepper (200 g).
Quarter, deseed and wash the pepper inside and out and remove the stalk. Dice into 1.5 cm pieces and add.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Decant into a bowl.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Clean and wash 1 small aubergine (250 g), cut into 1.5 cm dice and add it to the blender jug.

Wash 2 tomatoes 
(200 g), remove the stem ends, cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Put the courgette, pepper, onions, garlic, herbs, the remaining oil, 1 tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season once more with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Mango lassi
instructions:
eel the mango and remove the flesh from the stone. Then roughly chop the flesh.
With the measuring beaker in place, mix the chopped mango with the lemon juice and yoghurt in the blender jug for 50 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the cold water or cold milk and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 8. Sweeten to taste with honey or sugar.
TIP Almond milk and soya yoghurt make a nice, creamy vegan mango lassi.

ingredients.name: 250 ml cold water or milk, as desired
2 tbsp sugar or honey, as desired

steps.text: Peel a ripe mango (250 g), remove the flesh from the stone and chop coarsely.
Place the chopped mango in the blender jug.
Add 350 g yoghurt.
Add the juice of ½ lemon (40 g).
Add 250 g cold water or cold milk to the blender jug.
Sweeten as desired with honey or sugar.

name: Berry Nicecream
instructions: Cut the banana into 1-cm thick slices and freeze overnight. We recommend that you cover your chopping boards with greaseproof paper and place the banana slices on top without overlapping so that they do not stick together during freezing.

Put the banana slices, blueberries and cold milk in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 8. Enjoy this berry ‘nice cream’ on its own or decorate with fresh berries.

TIPS You can also make this ‘nice cream’ with cherries, raspberries, blackberries or strawberries in place of the blueberries. Simply try out whichever berries you prefer. If you would like it to be sweeter, add a little icing sugar to the nice cream or drizzle with maple syrup to serve. Suitable toppings include chocolate sauce, grated coconut, biscuit crumbs, muesli or puffed rice.

steps.text: Cut 3 very ripe bananas (330 g) into 1 cm slices.
Freeze the banana slices overnight. Place the slices on chopping boards lined with greaseproof paper so they do not stick together during freezing.
Add 200 g of blueberries to the blender jug.
Add 50 g cold milk.
Add the banana slices you froze earlier.
You can enjoy the berry-nicecream as it is or add 150 g fresh mixed berries as a garnish.

name: Candied almonds with cinnamon
instructions:
Put the almonds, sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon, butter and 4 tablespoons of water in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat using the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C. The liquid should almost boil off completely leaving the almonds entirely covered in the sugar mixture.
In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (fan).

Immediately put the almonds on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper, and, using 2 forks, separate them so that they do not overlap one another.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, allow to cool for 5 minutes and then, using 2 forks, separate the almonds again.
TIP To clean the blender jug easily, pour 1 litre of water into the jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 10 seconds/setting 3/120 °C. Then empty the blender jug, rinse and wipe dry.

steps.text: Add 200 g whole almonds to the blender jug.
Add 85 g brown sugar.
Add 1 sachet of vanilla sugar, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, 1 tsp butter and 4 tbsp water.

In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 
180 °C (fan).
The liquid should almost boil off completely leaving the almonds entirely covered in the sugar mixture.
If necessary use the spatula to stir the mixture once again.
Immediately put the almonds on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper, and, using 2 forks, separate them so that they do not overlap.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, allow to cool for 5 minutes and then, using 2 forks, separate the almonds again.

name: Cocoa-coated coffee liqueur truffles
instructions: Break both types of chocolate couverture into pieces and put into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/ speed setting 8. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/50 °C. Add the butter, coffee liqueur and vanilla pulp and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 45 seconds/speed setting 4 until you have a smooth mixture.
Decant the truffle mixture into a bowl and chill for 3 hours in the refrigerator, until the mixture is firm enough to be moulded. Put the cocoa powder into a deep dish.
Once the truffle mixture has cooled, cut out small portions with a teaspoon and roll into balls using the flat of your hand. Then roll the balls in the cocoa. Chill until ready to serve.
TIP The truffles taste even more sophisticated if you add 1 teaspoon of ground cardamom to the cocoa powder and roll the truffles in this mixture.

steps.text: Put 100 g milk chocolate couverture in pieces into the blender jug.
Add 100 g of dark chocolate couverture in pieces.
Add 80 g butter to the blender jug.
Add 40 g of coffee liquor.
Add the pulp of 1 vanilla pod (or alternatively 1 tsp vanilla sugar).
Decant the truffle mixture into a bowl and chill for 3 hours in the refrigerator, until the mixture is firm enough to be moulded.
Place a plate under the blender jug and weigh out 80 g cocoa in it.
Put the cocoa powder into a deep dish.
Once the truffle mixture has cooled, scoop out small portions with a teaspoon and roll into balls using your palms.
Roll the balls in the cocoa. Chill until ready to serve.

name: White chocolate cream with raspberry purée
instructions:
With the measuring beaker in place, finely process the sugar in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 10. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash the raspberries, pat dry and put in the blender jug with the lemon juice. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 7, then pour into a bowl and set aside. Wash and dry the blender jug.

Put the chocolate in chunks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 5 seconds/speed setting 2/50 °C. If the chocolate is not entirely melted, repeat the step, with the measuring beaker in place, for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/50 °C.

Add the mascarpone, yoghurt and vanilla seeds and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 45 seconds/speed setting 4.
Serve in small glasses and pour equal portions of raspberry purée on top. Garnish with raspberries and mint leaves.

steps.text: Add 25 g sugar to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash and dry 125 g fresh raspberries and add them to the blender jug.
Add the juice of ½ lemon (40 g).
Transfer to a bowl.
Clean and dry the blender jug.
Break 100 g white chocolate and put in the blender jug.
If the chocolate is not entirely melted, follow the next step, otherwise skip it.
Add 250 g mascarpone to the blender jug.
Add 150 g yoghurt.
Add the pulp from 1 vanilla pod.
Serve in small glasses and pour equal portions of raspberry purée on top. Garnish with raspberries and mint leaves.
Serve in small glasses and pour equal portions of raspberry purée on top. Garnish with raspberries and mint leaves.

name: Cheesecake brownies in jars
instructions: Break the chocolate into pieces, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 10.
Add the butter in chunks and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 5 minutes/speed setting 1/50 °C.

With the measuring beaker in place, stir in the eggs, sugar and 1 pinch of salt for 50 seconds/speed setting 4. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, fold in the flour for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant the brownie mixture and clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Put all the ingredients for the cheesecake mixture in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 40 seconds/speed setting 4.

Grease four ovenproof jars with butter, then pour in some of the brownie mixture followed by the cheesecake mixture on top. Cover each jar with a piece of cling film and fix in place with a rubber band. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Pour 1.25 litres of hot water into the blender jug, arrange the little jars in the deep steamer basket, close, attach to the blender jug and cook using the steamer button/55 minutes.
Remove the cling film and allow the little cakes to cool down well. Sprinkle with grated chocolate before serving.

TIP
If you fancy, you can put the mixture into sterilised preserving or canning jars. As soon as they have been steamed, screw on their lids to keep them tightly sealed. That way, the cheesecake brownies will keep for a week.

steps.text: Grease 4 ovenproof jars with butter and set aside.
Break 100 g chocolate into pieces and put in  the blender jug.
Add 70 g butter in chunks.
Add 2 eggs (large) and 1 pinch of salt to the blender jug.
Add 75 g sugar.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 25 g flour.
Transfer the brownie mixture to a bowl.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Put 100 g cream cheese in the blender jug.
Add 40 g sugar.
Add 1 egg (large) and 2 big pinches of ground vanilla.
Add equal portions of the brownie mixture, followed by the cheescake mixture to the glass jars.
Cover each dish with a piece of cling film and seal with a rubber band around it.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Pour 1250 g hot water into the blender jug.
Arrange the jars in the deep steamer basket and close. Attach the steamer attachment to the blender jug and close.
Remove the cling film and allow the mini cakes to cool well. Sprinkle with 4 tsp grated chocolate before serving.

name: Cheesecake with strawberry sauce
instructions:
Defrost the frozen strawberries. Brush the cake tin with butter.
Rinse the lemon in hot water, dry and peel off two strips of peel (4 x 1 cm) with a peeler. Put the lemon peel in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the sugar and vanilla pulp and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 10.
Add the low-fat and creamy quark, cream, eggs and cornflour and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 4.
Pour the cheesecake mixture into the springform tin and wrap with cling film to make it airtight.

Pour 1.5 litres of room-temperature water into the blender jug, attach the deep steamer basket and place two wooden skewers or forks in the basket so that the tin does not sit directly on the bottom of the basket and the steam slits are kept free of obstructions.
Put the cake in the steamer attachment. Then close with the lid and cook with the steamer button/1 hour. Then cook again with the steamer button/10 minutes.

Allow the cake to cool in the tin. Then store in the refrigerator until required.
Wash the measuring beaker. With the measuring beaker in place, mix the strawberries and icing sugar for 10 seconds/speed setting 9. Add lemon juice season to taste and pour the strawberry sauce over the cheesecake.
TIP The cake will still be slightly liquid after steaming, but will become firm as it cools down.

steps.text: Defrost 200 g frozen strawberries.
Put 200 g sugar into the blender jug.
If necessary follow the next step; otherwise skip it.
Decant the sugar.
Weigh out 1 untreated lemon (80 g), rinse in hot water and rub dry.
Peel off two strips of peel (4 x 1 cm) with a peeler, then put in the blender jug.
Add 150 g pulverised sugar to the blender jug.
Cut 1 vanilla pod open lengthways and scrape out the pulp with the back of a knife. Add to the blender jug.
Add 500 g low-fat quark to the blender jug.
Add 100 g high-fat quark.
Add 200 g cold cream.
Add 30 g cornflour.
Add 2 eggs (medium).
Grease 1 springform baking tin (20 cm) with butter.
Pour the cheesecake mixture into the springform tin and wrap with cling film to make it airtight.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Pour 1500 g water at room temperature into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer attachment to the blender jug.
Place 2 wooden skewers or forks in the steamer so the tin does not sit directly on the bottom of it and the steam slits are free of obstruction.
Put the cake in the steamer attachment and close.
Allow the cake to cool in the tin. Then store in the refrigerator until required.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Add the drained strawberries you set aside earlier to the blender jug.
Add 50 g pulverised sugar.
Season to taste with 1 tsp lemon juice and pour over the cheese cake.
Pour the strawberry sauce over the cheesecake.

name: Moist chocolate cake
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C. Grease the springform tin.

Separate the eggs. Insert the mixing attachment and put the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt in the blender jug. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, beat for 4 minutes/speed setting 4 until stiff. Remove the mixer attachment, decant the beaten egg whites and place in the refrigerator.

Put the butter in chunks and the sugar and egg yolks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 5 minutes/speed setting 3/70 °C. Add the chocolate broken into rough pieces to the blender jug and let everything rest for 5 minutes. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 35 seconds/speed setting 4. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and then continue to mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 15 seconds/speed setting 4.
Attach the mixer attachment, add the beaten egg whites and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 18 seconds/speed setting 2.

Pour the mixture into a springform tin and bake for 20 minutes. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the sponge is cooked, and bake for a little longer if necessary. Then remove from the oven, let it cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, release the catch on the tin and lift the cake out. Serve the chocolate cake either warm or cold.

TIPS
The cake is best if it is cooked through and is still slightly moist inside. So, do not bake it for too long.
Serve this chocolate cake with whipped cream and fresh berries.

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
Grease a springform tin.
Insert the mixer attachment to the blender jug.
Separate 5 eggs (medium) and add the egg whites to the blender jug. Set aside the yolks.
Add 1 pinch of salt to the blender jug.
Remove the mixer attachment.
Transfer the beaten egg whites to a bowl and put in the refrigerator.
Add 150 g butter in chunks to the blender jug.
Add 200 g sugar.
Add the egg yolks.
Break 250 g dark chocolate into rough pieces and add to the blender jug. Allow the mixture to rest for 5 minutes.
Add 60 g flour to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment and add the beaten egg whites to the blender jug.

Pour the batter into the greased sprinform tin and bake for 20 minutes. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the sponge is cooked. Extend the baking time if necessary.
Remove from the oven. Let it cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, release the catch on the tin and lift the cake out.
Serve the chocolate cake either warm or cold.

name: Bagels
