instructions: Put the sugar in the blender jug with 300 ml lukewarm water. Crumble the yeast in, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat everything for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Allow the mixture to rest for 10 minutes.

Add the flour, olive oil and 2 teaspoons of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes.
Remove the dough, shape into a ball, put in a covered bowl, and allow to prove in a warm place for 1 hour. Then knead the dough through again and make 8 balls.
Taking a wooden spoon, press the bowl into the middle of the dough and turn it in a circle to create the central holes typical of bagels.
Place the bagels on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper, leaving ample space between then as the bagels will rise again. Allow to prove for 10 minutes while covered.

In the meantime, in a large saucepan, bring plenty of water to the boil. Add honey and the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt, and simmer for a short time.
Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C.
Carefully slide the bagels in several batches into the now-boiling water, allow to simmer for 45 seconds, turn carefully and leave in the water for a further 45 seconds. Then remove them with a slotted spoon, drain and place on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle the bagels with sesame or poppy seeds and bake for 20 minutes.

ingredients.name: 1 tbsp sesame seeds and/or poppy seeds

steps.text: Put 300 g lukewarm water and 2 tbsp brown sugar into the blender jug.
Crumble ½ cube fresh yeast (20 g) and add.
Leave the mixture to rest for 10 minutes.
Add 500 g flour to the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp salt and 2 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the dough, shape into a ball, put in a covered bowl, and allow to prove in a warm place for 1 hour.
Then knead the dough through again and make 8 balls.
Using a wooden spoon, press the middle of each ball and turn it in a circle to create the central holes typical of bagels.
Place the bagels on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper, leaving ample space between them as the bagels will rise again.
Allow to prove for 10 minutes while covered. In the meantime bring a large pot of water to boil. Add 2 tbsp honey and 1 tsp salt and simmer briefly.
Pre-heat the oven to 220°C (top and bottom heat).
Carefully slide the bagels  into the water in batches, allow to simmer for 45 seconds, turn carefully and leave in the water for a further 45 seconds.
Remove them with a slotted spoon, drain and place on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle the bagels with sesame or poppy seeds and bake for 20 minutes on the middle shelf.

name: Pull-apart bread with herb butter
instructions:
To make the herb butter, peel the shallot and garlic. Wash the fresh herbs, shake dry and remove the stalks.
Put the shallot, garlic and leaves of the herbs in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 6. Then use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the oregano, butter, mustard, olive oil, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and ¼ teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3. Decant and clean the blender jug thoroughly.

Knead all the bread ingredients with 300 ml of lukewarm water and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes.
Roll out the dough on a floured work surface to fit your baking sheet, brush with the herb butter and cut into strips the width of the loaf tin.

Line the loaf tin with greaseproof paper. Fold the strips of dough concertina fashion and place behind one another in the tin. Allow to prove in a warm place for about 20 minutes.
In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 200 °C.
Brush a little milk or cream onto the bread and bake for 25 minutes.
VARIATIONS Instead of herb butter, prepare the bread with green or red pesto, or add little cubes of bacon to the strips of dough.

ingredientsBases.name: MAKES 1 LOAF TIN (12 X 30 CM / 28 SLICES)

ingredients.name: 2 tbsp milk or cream for brushing

steps.text: Peel 1 shallot (30 g) and 2 garlic cloves and add to the blender jug.
Wash and pat dry 3 sprigs of basil, 3 sprigs of parsley and 5 sprigs of thyme. Remove the leaves and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp oregano, 1 tsp mustard, ¼ tsp pepper and ¼ tsp of salt.
Add 30 g olive oil.
Add 90 g butter in cubes.
Put the herb butter in a bowl and clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Put 300 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Add 600 g flour.
Add 1 cube fresh yeast (40 g), ½ tsp sugar and 1½ tsp salt.
Add 50 g olive oil.
Turn the dough onto to a floured surface and roll out to fit a baking sheet. Brush with the herb butter and cut into strips the width of the loaf tin.
Line a loaf tin with greaseproof paper.
Fold the strips of dough concertina fashion and place behind one another in the tin.
Allow to prove in a warm place for about 20 minutes. In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (above and below).
Brush the bread with a little milk or cream and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Baguette
instructions:
Brush out a large bowl with oil.
Put 330 ml lukewarm water and the crumbled yeast in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/37 °C.
Add the flour and ½ teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes.
Put the dough into the prepared bowl, cover with a clean cloth and allow to rest in a warm, evenly heated place, until it has doubled in volume (about 90 minutes).

Dust the work surface with flour. Divide the dough into 3 equal-sized pieces and shape each into a flat square. Fold all the corners in towards the centre. Do not knead, but just press, so that the air bubbles in the dough remain in the dough. Cover the pieces of dough with a damp cloth or foil and allow to prove for another 20 minutes. Repeat this step.

Shape the pieces of dough into baguettes and place each on a sheet of greaseproof paper, pulling the paper up between the rolls so that they do not stick together when proving. Cover again and allow to prove for another 45 minutes.
In the meantime, put a dripping pan on the lowest shelf in the oven, place a second baking sheet on top and pre-heat the oven to 250 °C.

With a sharp knife, dampened with hot water, cut three diagonal slits in the upper surface of each baguette.
Pour 100 ml hot water into the dripping pan and place the loaves on their greaseproof paper on top of the baking sheet. Close the oven door immediately and bake the baguettes for 20 minutes until golden.
If the loaves are already a good colour before the prescribed baking time has elapsed, reduce the temperature to 230 °C.
Remove the baguettes and cool for 20 minutes before cutting.
TIP Slices of baguette freeze very well in freezer bags. Simply defrost at room temperature and toast in a toaster.

ingredients.name: 10 g fresh yeast or ½ sachet of dried yeast (4 g)
plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Brush a large bowl with oil and set aside.
Put 330 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Crumble 10 g fresh yeast into the blender jug or add ½ sachet dried yeast.
Add 500 g flour to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt.
Put the dough into the prepared bowl, cover with a clean cloth and allow to rest in a warm, evenly heated place, until it has doubled in volume (90 minutes).
Dust a work surface with flour. Divide the dough into 3 equal-sized pieces and shape each into a flat square.
Fold each corner towards the centre. Do not knead, but just press the dough, so that the air bubbles in the dough remain.
Cover the pieces of dough with a damp cloth or foil and allow to prove for another 20 minutes. Repeat this step.
Shape the pieces of dough into baguettes, placing each on a sheet of greaseproof paper, pulling the paper up between them so that they do not stick together when proving.
Cover again and allow to prove for another 45 minutes. Use this time to follow the next steps.
Place a dripping pan on the lowest shelf in the oven, place a second baking sheet on top and pre-heat the oven to 250 °C (top and bottom heat).
With a sharp knife, dampened with hot water, cut three diagonal slits in the upper surface of each baguette.
Pour 100 ml hot water into the dripping pan and place the loaves on their greaseproof paper on the baking sheet above. Close the oven door immediately.
Bake the baguettes for 20 minutes until golden.
If the loaves are already a good colour before the prescribed baking time has elapsed, reduce the temperature to 230 °C.
Remove the baguettes and cool for 20 minutes before cutting.

name: Yoghurt bread rolls
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C, and line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper. With the measuring beaker in place, knead the flour, yogurt, baking powder, oil, salt and baking malt with the knead button/2 minutes.

Put the dough on a floured work surface and, if necessary, knead in a little more flour. Divide into 10 pieces, shape them into balls and put them on the prepared baking sheet with distance between each one. Brush with milk and sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake the rolls for 15 minutes until golden. If the rolls look a little too pale, extend the baking time if necessary.
TIP You can find baking malt in well-stocked supermarkets and health food shops. It improves the crumb and helps the dough rise better.

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat) and line a baking sheet with greaseproof paper.
Place 350 g flour in the blender jug.
Add 1 packet baking powder.
Add 230 g yoghurt.
Add 70 g vegetable oil.
Add 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp baking malt.
Place the dough on a floured work surface and knead in a little more flour if necessary.
Divide the dough into 10 pieces; shape them into balls and place some distance apart from each other on the baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper.
Brush the rolls with 3 tbsp milk and sprinkle with 5 tbsp poppy seeds. Bake for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Sweet yeast dough
instructions: Pour the milk, yeast and sugar into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 3 seconds/speed setting 1/37 °C. Add the butter in chunks, egg, flour and salt, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead using the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough.
Put the yeast dough in a bowl, cover and allow to prove in a warm place for 30 minutes, until the volume has doubled.

NOTE Sweet yeast dough is suitable as a base for fruit cake, brioches, plaited yeast loaves, cinnamon buns, and much more. TIP The lower the yeast content and the longer the proving time, the better the taste and consistency of the baked goods will be. If there is enough time, you can use half the quantity of yeast with at least twice the proving time.

ingredients.name: 1 cube fresh yeast (42 g) or 2 sachets of dried yeast (7 g per sachet)

steps.text: Pour 220 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 70 g sugar.
Add 1 cube fresh yeast (40 g) or 2 sachets of dry yeast.
Cut 80 g butter into pieces and add to the blender jug.
Add 500 g flour.
Add 1 egg (medium or large) and ¼ tsp salt.
Transfer the dough to a bowl, cover and allow to rise in a warm place for at least 30 minutes, or until doubled in volume.

name: Basic rice pudding recipe
instructions: Put the cold milk, sugar, 2 pinches of salt and the pudding rice in the blender jug, and the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer with the reverse button/40 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Once the cooking time has elapsed, check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and extend the cooking time if necessary.
Allow the pudding rice to soak in the blender jug (detached from the base) for 15 minutes. Then decant into dishes and enjoy whilst still warm, or chill in the refrigerator until served.

TIPS
To make rice pudding creamier, stir in some whipped cream. 
Serve with a sugar and cinnamon mixture, grated chocolate, jam, caramelised nuts and cracknel.
Rice pudding is a real feast for the eyes when layered in small jars with hot cherries.

ingredients.name: 1.2 l cold milk (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)

steps.text: Pour 1200 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 75 g sugar and 2 pinches of salt.
Put 250 g pudding rice into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and carry out the next step, if necessary; otherwise skip this step.
Transfer the rice pudding to a bowl and leave to swell up for 15 minutes.
Eat while hot, or keep refrigerated until it is served.

name: Chicken thighs with tomato and pepper sauce
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic cloves, halve the onion and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely in the blender jug with the turbo button/3 seconds. Add the olive oil and bacon lardons and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/3 minutes.

Cut the peppers into quarters, remove the cores and stalks, wash them inside and out, then cut them into 1-cm pieces. Put half of the pieces in the blender jug along with the tomatoes, and season with the salt chilli powder and the Italian herbs.

Meanwhile, wash the chicken thighs thoroughly, pat them dry with kitchen paper and place them in the deep steamer basket. Season each one with ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper, and brush with 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil. Attach the steamer basket to the blender jug and put the lid on. Cook the tomato sauce and the chicken thighs with the reverse button/40 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.

Open the steamer attachment and take out the chicken thighs. Heat the remaining vegetable oil in a pan and fry the chicken thighs, skin side down, for 3 minutes over a high heat, then turn and fry again for 3 minutes. Serve the chicken thighs with the tomato and pepper sauce.

TIP
Goes well with fresh French bread or rice.

steps.text: Weigh out 2 chicken thighs (200 g each).
Wash the chicken thighs thoroughly, pat dry with kitchen paper, season each one with ¼ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper, and set aside.
Wash the chicken thighs thoroughly, pat dry with kitchen paper, season each one with ¼ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper, and set aside.
Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 2 garlic cloves, halve the onion and put both into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Add 50 g bacon lardons.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 green pepper (150 g).
Weigh out 1 yellow pepper (150 g) in the same way.
Cut the peppers into quarters, wash them, remove the stalks and cut into 1-cm pieces.
Put half of the pepper pieces into the blender jug. Put the other half aside.
Pour 800 g tinned chopped tomatoes into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of chilli powder.
Add ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of chilli powder.
Serve the chicken thighs with the tomato and pepper sauce. They go well with French bread or rice.

name: Chickpea stew with vegetables and chorizo
instructions: Tip the chickpeas into a sieve, wash and leave to drain thoroughly. Clean and wash the leek and cut the white part into rings. Peel the carrots and cut them into thick slices. Put the leek and carrot pieces into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 5. Slice the chorizo and add to the vegetables together with the oil. With the measuring beaker in place, sauté with the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.

Peel the potatoes, cut them into 1-cm cubes, add to the blender jug with the stock at room temperature and the bay leaf, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/20 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add the chickpeas and, the measuring beaker not inserted, finish cooking the stew with the reverse button/12 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Remove the bay leaf before serving. Season the stew with salt and pepper and, the measuring beaker not inserted, process with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

ingredients.name: 750 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Tip 800 g tinned chickpeas into a sieve, wash and leave to drain thoroughly.
Weigh out 1 leek (150 g).
Clean and wash the leek, cut the white part into rings and put into the blender jug.
Peel 150 g carrots, cut into thick slices and add to the blender jug.
Slice 150 g chorizo and add it to the blender jug.
Slice 150 g chorizo and add it to the blender jug.
Add 50 g olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Weigh out 200 g waxy potatoes, peel, cut into small cubes and put into the blender jug.
Weigh out 200 g waxy potatoes, peel, cut into small cubes and put into the blender jug.
Add 750 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Add 1 bay leaf.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Transfer the drained chickpeas to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Remove the bay leaf before serving and season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Almond tart
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 150 °C. Lightly grease the baking tin. Put all of the ingredients for the dough, plus 1 tablespoon of cold water, into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, knead the mixture with the knead button/1 minute 30 seconds. Dust your worktop with flour, roll out the dough to the size of the baking tin and line the base of the springform tin with the pastry. Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.

Rinse the lemon under hot running water, dry it and grate the skin finely. Put the lemon peel and almonds in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, finely chop with the turbo button/8 seconds. Transfer the mixture to another container.

Place the eggs in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Add the sugar and cinnamon and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 10 seconds/speed setting 4. Add the almond and lemon mixture and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug, then, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 20 seconds/speed setting 4. Spoon the mixture out onto the pastry base and bake in the oven for 1 hour. If the tart looks too pale, extend the baking time.

Once it is done, take the almond tart out the oven and leave it to cool. Cut a Cross of St James shape out of cardboard and place it in the middle of the tart, to serve as a template. Dust the top with icing sugar, remove the template and serve the tart.

ingredients.name: plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 150 °C (top and bottom heat).
Lightly grease 1 springform tin (24 cm Ø).
Add 175 g flour to the blender jug.
Add 125 g sugar.
Add 30 g butter.
Add 1 egg (medium), 1 tsp ground cinnamon and 1 tbsp cold water.
Dust your worktop with flour, roll out the dough to the size of the baking tin and line the base of the springform tin with the pastry.
Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.
Add the grated zest of one untreated lemon to the blender jug.
Add 250 g whole, unblanched almonds to the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 8 seconds.
Decant the mixture to another container and rinse out the blender jug.
Add 4 eggs (medium) to the blender jug.
Add 250 g sugar to the blender jug.
Add 1½ tsp ground cinnamon.
Put the lemon-almond mixture into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Spoon the mixture out onto the pastry base and bake in the oven for 1 hour. If the tart looks too pale, extend the baking time.
Take the almond tart out the oven and leave it to cool.
Cut a Cross of St James shape out of cardboard and place it in the middle of the tart, to serve as a template.
Dust the top with icing sugar, remove the template and serve the tart.

name: Duck à l’orange
instructions: Peel 1 orange, completely removing the skin and pith. Slice the orange and lay the slices in the shallow steamer basket. Score across the skin side of the duck breasts with a knife, season with 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper, and place the duck on top of the orange slices in the shallow steamer basket.

Peel the onion and carrot. Cut the carrot into large chunks, cut the onion into quarters, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug with the turbo button/3 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter piece by piece, then sauté the vegetable mixture, the measuring beaker not inserted, with the roast button/2 minutes/100 °C.

Squeeze the remaining oranges and add the juice to the blender jug together with the orange liqueur, 250 ml warm water, the vinegar and the sugar. Place the deep steamer basket in the blender jug, insert the shallow steamer basket, close the lid and cook the meat with the steamer button.

Remove the duck breasts from the shallow steamer basket and fry in hot clarified butter in a pan, skin side down, until crispy. Strain the sauce through a fine-meshed sieve, retaining the liquid and seasoning it with salt and pepper.
Slice the duck and serve with the sauce.

steps.text: Weigh out 6 oranges (1000 g) and put 5 oranges to one side.
Peel 1 orange, completely removing the skin and pith. Slice the orange and lay the slices in the shallow steamer basket.
Weigh out 4 duck breast fillets (approx. 300 g each).
Score across the skin side of the duck breasts with a knife, season with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper, and place on top of the orange slices in the shallow steamer basket.
Score across the skin side of the duck breasts with a knife, season with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper, and place on top of the orange slices in the shallow steamer basket.
Peel 1 onion (80 g), quarter and put into the blender jug.
Peel 1 carrot (60 g), cut into large chunks and add.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 70 g butter in pieces to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Squeeze the remaining oranges and add the juice to the blender jug.
Add 250 g warm water.
Add 30 g sugar, 4 tbsp orange liqueur and 1 tbsp white wine vinegar.
Place the deep steamer basket in the blender jug, insert the shallow steamer basket and close the lid.
Remove the duck breasts from the shallow steamer basket and fry in 1 tbsp hot clarified butter in a pan, skin side down, until crispy.
Strain the sauce through a fine-meshed sieve and season it with salt and pepper.
Slice the duck and serve with the sauce. Roast potatoes make a good accompaniment.

name: Cream cheese and radish spread
instructions: Clean and wash the radishes. Snip off the cress, rinse it briefly with running water, pat it dry and set aside ½ tablespoon for garnish. Put the rest of the cress in the blender jug with the radishes and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/3 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and then repeat the process if required.
Add the cream cheese, season with ¼ teaspoon each of salt and pepper, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 20 seconds/speed setting 4.
Serve the spread garnished with the rest of the cress.

steps.text: Clean and wash 70 g radishes, and add to the blender jug.

Snip off the cress, rinse it briefly with running water, pat it dry and set aside 
½ tbsp for garnish. Put the rest of the cress in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 200 g cream cheese to the blender jug.
Add ¼ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Serve the spread garnished with 1 tbsp cress.

name: Meat and potato pie
instructions: To make the meat filling, cut the leftover meat into pieces. Wash the parsley, shake it dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Peel and halve the onion, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, melt for 1 minute/speed setting 2/60 °C. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the onion with the roast button/2 minutes/100 °C. Add the pieces of meat, parsley, ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, chop everything finely for 15 seconds/speed setting 8. Transfer the mixture to another container. Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.

Insert the mixer attachment for the mash. Peel and wash the potatoes, cut them into 3-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug with the room-temperature milk, ½ teaspoon of salt and 1 pinch of pepper. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 40 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C. Grease a casserole dish.

Remove the mixer attachment (be careful: it will be hot!), add the cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything for 40 seconds/speed setting 4. Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top. Sprinkle the casserole with breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm.

TIPS
A green salad makes a good accompaniment.
If no children are eating with you, you can also add 1 tablespoon of Madeira to the pieces of meat before they are chopped.

ingredients.name: 300 g cooked meat (e.g. leftovers from a stew)

steps.text: Grease a casserole dish.
Peel and halve 1 onion (60 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a dish on top of the blender jug and weigh the cooked meat leftovers into it.
Cut the cooked meat into pieces and put into the blender jug.
Wash ½ bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves and put into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Decant the mixture into another dish.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Insert the mixer attachment.
Weigh out 1000 g floury potatoes.

Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into 
3 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Add 400 g milk.
Add ½ tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.  Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
During the next step, shortly before the end of the cooking time, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (top and bottom heat).
Remove the mixer attachment. (Be careful: it will be hot!)
Put 50 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top.
Sprinkle the casserole with 2 tbsp breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm. A green salad makes a good accompaniment.

name: Chicken and vegetables in cream sauce
instructions:
Wash the parsley, shake it dry and tear off the leaves. Place in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Peel the carrots and celeriac and slice them into 1.5-cm dice.
Put the vegetables and chicken stock at room temperature in the blender jug.

Lay the meat evenly spaced in the deep steamer basket, season with ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper, place the deep steamer basket on the blender jug, close the lid and cook the meat with the steamer button/10 minutes.

While it is cooking, clean and slice the button mushrooms and lay them in the shallow steamer basket.
When the cooking time is up, carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips.
Insert the shallow steamer basket with the button mushrooms, put the lid on once again and finish cooking with the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C. Take out the steamer basket and set it to one side.

Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, retaining the cooking liquid.
Put 300 ml of the cooking liquid, the strained vegetables and the flour, crème fraîche, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Add the mushrooms and cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Season the sauce to taste.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce.
TIP Serve with Spätzle or rice.

ingredients.name: 1 l chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Clean 150 g button mushrooms, cut into 0.5 cm slices and place in the shallow steamer basket.
Wash 1 bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 2 carrots 
(150 g).
Peel the carrots, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 piece of celeriac (50 g).
Peel the celeriac, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Add 1000 g chicken stock at room temperature.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh 600 g chicken breasts into it.
Wash the chicken breasts, pat dry and cut into 5 x 2 cm strips.
Arrange the chicken evenly in the deep steamer basket and season with ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close.
Carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips. Insert the shallow steamer basket and close the lid again.
Remove the steamer attachment and put aside.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, reserving the liquid.
Put 300 g of the reserved stock into the blender jug, together with the vegetables.
Put 40 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 100 g crème fraîche, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce and 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Transfer the mushrooms from the shallow steamer basket to the blender jug.
Add 60 g cold butter in dabs.
Season the sauce to taste.
Season the sauce to taste.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce poured over the top.

name: Beef roulades
instructions: Spread each of the roulades with 1 teaspoon of mustard, then sprinkle with ½ teaspoon of paprika and season with ½ teaspoon of salt and 2 big pinches of pepper. Drape 2 slices of bacon over each roulade, folding the long sides around the middle and wrapping the meat up tightly. Wrap kitchen twine around each one and tie it up. Heat 2 tablespoons of clarified butter in a frying pan and sear the roulades on all sides until they are golden brown, then remove them from the pan and place them in the deep steamer basket. Deglaze the cooking juices with the beef stock and boil it down over a high heat.

While it is boiling, peel the onion, garlic and carrot. Halve the onion, cut the carrot into large chunks, clean the mushrooms, put them all into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/8 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add the rest of the clarified butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, melt for 1 minute/speed setting 2/60 °C, then, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat everything with the roast button/4 minutes.

Add the tomato purée, bouquet garni, 600 ml warm water and warm beef stock to the vegetables in the blender jug, place the deep steamer basket on top, close the lid and cook the roulades with the steamer button/1 hour.

Lift off the deep steamer basket and keep the roulades warm. Remove the bouquet garni. Sprinkle the flour into the sauce and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend everything for 1 minute/speed settings 4–8, increasing the speed gradually. Finally, with the measuring beaker in place, warm through the sauce once more for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/95 °C.
TIP If no children are eating the roulades, you can replace 100 ml of the beef stock with red wine. Red cabbage and dumplings make good accompaniments to this dish.

ingredients.name: 500 ml beef stock at room temperature
1 bouquet garni (e.g. parsley, thyme, 1 bay leaf)

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 1 carrot (80 g), cut into large chunks and add to the blender jug.
Clean 3 medium-sized button mushrooms and add them to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 8 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp clarified butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 4 beef roulades (225 g each).
Spread each of the roulades with 1 tsp mustard, sprinkle with ½ tsp paprika and season with ½ tsp salt and 2 big pinches of pepper.
Drape 2 slices of bacon over each roulade, fold the long sides around the middle and wrap the meat up tightly.
Wrap kitchen twine around each one and tie it up.
Heat 2 tbsp clarified butter in a frying pan and sear the roulades on all sides until they are golden brown.
Remove the roulades from the pan and place them in the deep steamer basket.
Deglaze the cooking juices with 500 ml beef stock and boil it down over a high heat.
Put 600 g warm water into the blender jug.
Add the warm beef stock.
Add 1 tsp tomato purée and 1 bouquet garni.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close it.
Remove the deep steamer basket and keep the roulades warm.
Remove the bouquet garni.
Put 3 tsp flour into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.

name: Quick party bread
instructions:
Grease a springform tin and sprinkle it lightly with breadcrumbs.
Put 220 ml warm water and the crumbled yeast in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Add the flour and salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead everything with the knead button/2 minutes.
Using the spatula, transfer the dough to the prepared springform tin, cover it with a clean tea towel and leave it to prove in a evenly warm place for 30 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C. Sprinkle the bread with water, scatter with sesame seeds and bake for 25 minutes. If the bread looks a little too pale, extend the baking time.
Take the bread out of the oven, leave it in the tin to cool for a few minutes, then open up the sides of the tin, lift out the loaf and leave it to cool down completely on a wire rack.

ingredients.name: butter and breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Grease a springform tin and sprinkle it lightly with breadcrumbs.
Add 220 g warm water to the blender jug.
Crumble in 25 g fresh yeast.
Add 420 g flour.
Add 1 tsp salt.
Using the spatula, transfer the dough to the prepared springform tin, cover it with a clean tea towel and leave it to prove in a evenly warm place for 30 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (top and bottom heat).
Sprinkle the bread with water, scatter with sesame seeds and bake for 25 minutes. If the bread looks a little too pale, extend the baking time.
Take the bread out of the oven, leave to cool  in the tin for a few minutes, then open the sides, lift out the loaf and leave to cool on a wire rack.

name: Chocolate and pecan cookies
instructions: Break the chocolate into pieces, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 20 seconds/speed setting 6, then transfer to a bowl. Put the pecans into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop into medium-sized pieces for 20 seconds/speed setting 6, then transfer them to another bowl.

re-heat the oven to 180 °C. Cover 3 baking trays with baking parchment.
Put the cubed butter and all of the different sorts of sugar into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix until creamy for 2 minutes/speed setting 3. Add the eggs and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 2 minutes/speed setting 3.

Mix the flour, baking powder and cocoa powder together, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 3 minutes/speed setting 3. Add 125 g of the chopped chocolate and pecans and mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.

Use two teaspoons to scoop up portions of the mixture and arrange them on the baking tray, making sure that they are not too close together, then sprinkle with the rest of the chocolate pieces. Bake the cookies in 3 batches for 12 minutes each. To check whether the cookies are done, lift one up to see whether it is brown on the bottom. If not, bake them for a little longer. Leave them to cool on a wire rack.
TIP You could also jazz up your cookies with hazelnuts, walnuts or macadamia nuts, or candied or dried fruits.

steps.text: Break 250 g dark chocolate into pieces, and put into the blender jug.
Transfer to a bowl.
Put 80 g pecans into the blender jug.
Transfer into a second bowl.
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat). Cover 3 baking trays with baking parchment.
Put 200 g soft butter into the blender jug.
Add 80 g brown sugar.
Add 50 g white sugar and 1½ sachets vanilla sugar.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down.
Put 2 eggs (small) into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down.
Place a container on top of the blender jug and weigh in 230 g flour.
Mix the flour, baking powder and cocoa powder together and put them into the blender jug.
Add 125 g of the chopped chocolate to the blender jug.
Add the pecans.
Use two teaspoons to scoop up portions of the mixture and arrange them on the baking tray, not too close together, then sprinkle with the rest of the chocolate pieces.
Bake the cookies in 3 batches for 12 minutes each.
To check whether the cookies are done, lift one up to see whether it is brown on the bottom. If not, bake them for a little longer.
Leave them to cool on a wire rack.

name: Wheat and rye bread
instructions: To make the starter dough, put 1 tablespoon of wheat flour, the crumbled yeast, the sugar and 120 ml lukewarm water into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3. Cover the dough and leave it to rest for 15 minutes.

Add the rest of the flour, the oil, another 250 ml lukewarm water and the salt to the starter dough in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, knead everything with the knead button/2 minutes. If the dough is too dry, add a little more water.

Transfer the bread dough to a large, lightly greased bowl, cover it with a clean tea towel and leave to prove in an evenly warm place until it has doubled in size (this can take between 30 minutes and 1 hour, depending on the room temperature).
Lightly grease the loaf tin with oil. Briefly knead the dough once more, transfer it to the loaf tin, cover and leave to prove for another 15 minutes. Meanwhile, pre-heat the oven to 200 °C.

Bake the bread in the hot oven for 40 minutes until golden brown. If the bread looks a little too pale, extend the baking time. Take out the bread, leave it to cool off a little in the pan, then turn it out and leave to cool completely.

ingredientsBases.name: MAKES 12 SLICES (LOAF TIN APPROX. 30 X 11 CM)

steps.text: Put 120 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.

Add 1 tbsp plain flour 
(10 g).
Crumble in 30 g fresh yeast and add 1 tsp sugar.
Put 290 g plain flour into the blender jug.
Add 300 g rye flour.
Add 2 tbsp vegetable oil and 1 tsp salt.
Add 250 g lukewarm water.
If the dough is too dry, add a little more water.
Lightly grease a bowl and set aside.
Transfer the bread dough to the greased bowl, cover it with a clean tea towel and leave to prove in an evenly warm place until it has doubled in size.
Transfer the bread dough to the greased bowl, cover it with a clean tea towel and leave to prove in an evenly warm place until it has doubled in size.
Lightly grease the loaf tin with oil.
Briefly knead the dough once more, transfer it to the loaf tin, cover and leave to prove for another 15 minutes. Bake the bread in the hot oven for 40 minutes until golden brown.
Cover the dough and leave it to rest for 15 minutes.
If the bread looks a little too pale, extend the baking time. Take out the bread, leave it to cool off a little in the pan, then turn it out and leave to cool completely.

name: Rice- and pork-stuffed cabbage
instructions: Remove the outer leaves and stalk of the cabbage. Remove 16 good leaves and cut away the thick leaf veins. Bring water and 1 teaspoon of salt to the boil in a large pot, add the cabbage and boil it for 5 minutes. Take out the cabbage, then leave to cool a little.

Put the rice in the cooking pot, insert into the blender jug, sprinkle over 1 teaspoon of salt and pour 1 litre of water over the rice into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, cook the rice for the time according to the packet instructions + 5 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C, until it is firm to the bite. Halfway through the cooking time, stir the rice once thoroughly with the spatula. When the rice is cooked, remove the cooking pot with the rice, leaving the water in the blender jug, adding a little water if necessary to make it up to 1 litre, then add the bay leaves and the allspice.

Mix the minced pork with the rice, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper in a large bowl. Form the mixture into 8 long rolls of about 4 cm in diameter and place them on the cabbage leaves – 1 or 2, depending on the size. Wrap the rice and pork rolls up firmly and tie them with kitchen twine if necessary.

Arrange 4 rolls in the deep steamer basket and 4 in the shallow steamer basket, and put the whole steamer attachment on the blender jug. and close the lid. Cook the stuffed cabbage with the steamer button/40 minutes. Set the steamer attachment to one side, with the lid still closed, and keep the stuffed cabbage warm. Empty out and rinse the blender jug.

To make the sauce, put 500 ml water, the flour, tomato purée and cream in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 30 seconds/speed setting 5 until smooth, then, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 8 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve with the stuffed cabbage.

steps.text: Remove the outer leaves and stalk of a fresh white or Savoy cabbage.
Bring water and 1 tsp salt to the boil in a large pot, add the cabbage and boil it for 10 minutes.
Take out the cabbage, leave to cool a little, then carefully remove individual leaves, drain and set aside. If the leaf veins are still too hard, simmer the cabbage for another few minutes.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 300 g rice into the cooking pot.
Add 1 tsp salt.
Pour 1000 g water over the rice in the blender jug.
Halfway through the next step, stir the rice thoroughly once with the spatula.
Remove the cooking pot with the rice, leaving the water in the blender jug.
If necessary, add water to make it up to the 1-litre mark.
Put 3 bay leaves and 6 allspice berries into the blender jug.
Place a dish on top of the blender jug and weigh 800 g minced pork into it.

Mix the minced pork, rice, 1 tsp salt and 
½ tsp pepper together in a large bowl.
Form the mixture into 8 long rolls of about 4 cm in diameter and place them on the cabbage leaves – 1 or 2, depending on the size.
Wrap the rice and pork rolls up firmly and tie them with kitchen twine if necessary.
Arrange 4 rolls in the deep steamer basket and 4 in the shallow steamer basket.
Insert the shallow steamer basket into the deep steamer basket, attach to the blender jug and close.
Set the steamer attachment to one side, with the lid still closed, and keep the stuffed cabbage warm.
Empty out and rinse the blender jug.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Add 4 tbsp flour and 8 tbsp tomato purée.
Add 100 g cream at room temperature.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve with the stuffed cabbage.

name: Banana and vanilla milkshake
instructions: Peel the bananas, slice into large pieces and put in the blender jug with a dash of cold milk. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the remaining cold milk and vanilla ice cream and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 8 until smooth and foamy.
Pour into two highball glasses and serve with chocolate sprinkles on top.
VARIATION You can use strawberries, mango, honeydew melon and bilberries instead of bananas.

ingredients.name: 250 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Chop 2 very ripe bananas (220 g) in large chunks and put in the blender jug.
Add 50 g cold milk.
Add 200 g cold milk and 4 tbsp vanilla ice cream to the blender jug.
Pour into two highball glasses and serve with 2 tsp of chocolate sprinkles on top.

name: Beef stroganoff with tagliatelle
instructions: Wash the beef fillet, pat dry and cut into strips 1.5 cm thick. Score the tomatoes crossways, scald with boiling water, remove the skins, stalks and seeds, and chop the flesh coarsely. Clean the mushrooms, wipe with a damp cloth and slice.

Slice the shallots, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the oil and brown, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook the shallots, using the roast button/3 minutes. Add the meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown using the roast button/10 minutes. Then remove the meat and the shallots.
Put the tomatoes, mushrooms, mustard, crème fraîche, pickling brine, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer using the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Cook the tagliatelle according to packet instructions in a saucepan on the hob.
Pour 400 ml hot beef stock into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything using the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.
Mix the cornflour with 1 tablespoon of water until smooth and put in the blender jug together with the shallots and meat. With the measuring beaker in place, finish cooking everything using the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Arrange the tagliatelle and beef stroganoff together on plates. Finally, finely dice the gherkin, arrange over the stroganoff and serve.

TIPS Chicken breast fillet works well instead of beef fillet. If you like your meat moister, you can cook it in a pan while the sauce is cooking. To do this, brown the meat on both sides in a hot frying pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and then let it infuse in the sauce for 2 minutes at the end.

ingredients.name: 3 tbsp pickling brine from dill gherkins

steps.text: Rinse 400 g fillet of beef under cold running water and pat dry.
Cut into 1.5 cm strips of about thumb thickness and set aside.
Weigh out 2 tomatoes (150 g).
Score a cross on each tomato, and pour hot water over them. Remove the stalks, peel and cores. Finely chop the flesh and set aside.
Wipe 100 g button mushrooms with a damp towel, slice and set aside.
Peel 3 shallots (60 g) and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 4 tbsp oil to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add the meat you prepared to the blender jug.
Decant the meat and shallots.
Put the prepared tomatoes and mushrooms into the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp mustard.
Add 250 g crème fraîche.
Add 3 tbsp pickling brine from a jar of dill gherkins, 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.

Cook the tagliatelle 
(400 g) according to packet instructions in a saucepan on the hob.
Add 400 g of hot beef stock to the blender jug.
Mix 5 g cornflour with 1 tbsp of water to a smooth paste and add to the blender jug.
Add the meat you set aside to the shallots and add.
Serve the tagliatelle on plates with the beef strogonoff.
Finely slice the pickled gherkins and use to garnish the beef strogonoff before serving.

name: Caribbean iced coffee
instructions: Using a coffee filter, prepare strong coffee with 1 litre of water and 8 teaspoons of ground coffee and allow to cool down.
Mix the cold coffee with the vanilla ice cream and the rum thoroughly, with the measuring beaker in place, for 30 seconds/speed setting 8.
Serve with 3 ice cubes in each of the 4 glasses.

steps.text: Prepare a strong coffee with 6 tsp coffee and allow to cool.
Pour the coffee into the blender jug.
Add 4 scoops of vanilla ice cream.
Add 80 g white rum.
Serve with 3 ice cubes in each of the 4 glasses.

name: Yeast cake with crumble topping
instructions: Heat the milk, yeast and 1 tablespoon of sugar in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Leave the mixture to stand for 10 minutes. Add the rest of the sugar, the vanilla sugar, the eggs, butter, flour and salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes. Transfer the dough to a bowl, cover with a clean tea towel and leave to prove for 30 minutes, by which time it should have doubled in size. Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.

Put the ingredients for the crumble topping in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process with the knead button. Knead the risen dough again and roll it so that it covers a whole baking tray lined with baking parchment. Use both hands to sprinkle the crumble over the dough, cover the cake and leave to prove for another 20 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 160 °C. Bake the cake in the pre-heated oven for 45 minutes. Take out of the oven and leave to cool.
Cut the yeast cake into pieces and serve dusted with icing sugar.

ingredients.name: 200 ml lukewarm milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
2 sachets of vanilla sugar (16 g in all)
120 g cold butter, cut into cubes

steps.text: Put 200 g lukewarm milk into the blender jug.
Add 1 cube fresh yeast (40 g).
Add 10 g sugar.
Leave the mixture to stand for 10 minutes.
Put 90 g sugar and 2 sachets vanilla sugar into the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (medium).
Add 100 g soft butter.
Add 500 g plain flour and 1 pinch of salt.
Transfer the dough to a bowl, cover with a clean tea towel and leave to prove for 30 minutes, by which time it should have doubled in size.
Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.
Put 200 g plain flour into the blender jug.
Add 100 g sugar.
Add 120 g cold cubed butter.
Knead the risen dough again and roll it so that it covers a whole baking tray lined with baking parchment.
Use both hands to sprinkle the crumble over the dough, cover the cake and leave to prove for another 20 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 160 °C (top and bottom heat).
Bake the cake in the oven for 45 minutes. Take out of the oven and leave to cool.
Cut the yeast cake into pieces and serve dusted with 2 tbsp icing sugar.

name: Pasta pot with sausage meat dumplings
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake dry, remove the leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.  Then decant and reserve.
Peel the onions, cut in half, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Wash and peel the carrots, celeriac and parsley root, cut them into roughly sized pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug, add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/5 minutes.
Pour on the warm vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Remove the sausages from their skins and shape the meat into little balls. Trim and wash the broccoli and the cauliflower and divide into small florets. Add 150 g of each type of florets and the sausage meat balls, peas, pasta, salt and pepper to the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, simmer everything with the reserve button/12 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.  Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper and serve garnished with parsley.

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of parsley and shake dry, remove the leaves and add to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (130 g) and add to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (130 g) and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 4 carrots 
(300 g).
Wash, peel and coarsely chop the carrots and place in the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 piece of celeriac (70 g).
Wash, peel and coarsely chop the celeriac and add to the blender jug.
Place a plate on the blender jug and weigh out ½ parsley root (70 g).
Wash, peel and coarsely chop the parsley root and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp oil to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 1500 g warm vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Place a plate on the blender jug and weigh out 300 g raw pork bratwurst (sausage).
Remove the sausages from their skins and shape the meat into little balls. Add to the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out ½ head of broccoli (300 g).
Clean and wash the broccoli and break into little florets.
Place a plate on the blender jug and weigh out ¼ head of cauliflower (300 g).
Clean and wash the cauliflower and break into little florets.
Add 150 g of the broccoli florets to the blender jug.
Add 150 g of the caulifower florets to the blender jug.
Add 200 g peas.
Add 200 g soup noodles, along with 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Spicy mince with tomatoes, red pepper and onions
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic, quarter the onion and put both ingredients in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. Clean and quarter the pepper, wash inside and out and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug, add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/3 minutes.

Add the minced meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button.
Add the warm vegetable stock, sieved tomatoes, rice, salt, pepper, paprika powder and oregano to the meat and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer using the reverse button/18 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Check once the cooking time has elapsed that the rice is cooked. Extend the cooking time if necessary. Season with paprika powder, salt and pepper to taste.
TIP If you would like the mince spicier, add ¼ teaspoon of chilli powder or a dash of sambal oelek.

ingredients.name: 400 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Peel 1 large onion (100 g) and 1 garlic, quarter the onion and put both in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 red pepper (150 g).
Clean and quarter the pepper, wash inside and out and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 400 g mixed beef and pork mince to the blender jug.
Add 300 g warm vegetable stock to the blender jug.
Add 300 g sieved tomatoes.
Add 250 g parboiled rice.
Add 1 tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper, ½ tsp medium hot paprika and 1 tbsp oregano.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Check if the rice is cooked. If not, follow the next step; otherwise, skip this step.
Season to taste with paprika, salt and pepper.

name: Potato fritters with apple sauce
instructions:
Peel and quarter the apples and remove the cores. Put the apple pieces in the blender jug with the sugar, vanilla pulp and lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer for 20 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Once the cooking time has elapsed, with the measuring beaker in place, purée for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant and allow to cool. Clean the blender jug thoroughly.

Peel the potatoes, then wash and quarter them. Peel and quarter the onions. Put onions and potatoes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. If necessary, use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and then continue to chop, with the measuring beaker in place, for 5 seconds/speed setting 5.

Put the onion and potato mixture on a muslin cloth or clean tea towel, wrap, twist and press together to squeeze the liquid out of the potatoes. Put the potato mixture back in the blender jug, and add the eggs, potato flour, oats and spices. With the measuring beaker in place, mix using the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 3.

Heat the clarified butter in a frying pan, add the mixture portion by portion and fry the potato fritters on both sides until crispy. Serve the hot potato fritters with the warm or cooled apple sauce.

steps.text: Peel and quarter and core 12 apples (2000 g), and add to the blender jug.
Slit 1 vanilla pod, scrape out the pulp with the back of a knife and add.
Add 4 tbsp sugar and the  juice of 1 lemon.
Transfer the apple purée and leave to cool.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Peel and quarter 4 onions (300 g) and add to the blender jug.
Peel, wash and quarter 2000 g mostly waxy potatoes and add to the blender jug.
If necessary, use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and follow the next step; otherwise, skip this step.
Put the onion and potato mixture on a muslin cloth or clean tea towel, wrap, twist and press together to squeeze the liquid out of the potatoes.
Put the potatoes back in the blender jug.
Add 4 eggs (medium).
Add 40 g potato starch.
Add 40 g fine oats.
Add 2 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Heat the clarified butter in a frying pan, and fry the potato fritters on both sides until crispy.
Serve the hot potato fritters with the warm or cooled apple sauce.

name: Haddock on a bed of carrot
instructions:
Zest the orange peel using a zester. Divide the orange into segments and reserve the juice.
Rinse the fish, pat dry and put on a plate. Drizzle with the orange juice and sprinkle the orange zest and 1 big pinch of pepper on top. Allow to steep for 10 minutes.

In the meantime, clean and peel the carrots and cut into pieces 5 cm long. Cut very thick carrots in half lengthways. Put the butter with the sugar into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/110 °C. Add the carrot pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 6. Then arrange the carrots in the deep steamer basket and sprinkle with ¼ teaspoon of salt and the sugar.

Pour the hot vegetable stock into the blender jug. Attach the deep steamer basket and hang the shallow steamer basket in it. Sprinkle the fish with ½ teaspoon of salt and put in the shallow steamer basket. Drizzle the marinade on top. Close the shallow steamer basket with the lid and cook everything with the steamer button/10 minutes.
Carefully remove the lid, add the fillets to the carrots, close and warm up using the steamer button/3 minutes. Interrupt the heating phase so that the steaming process begins immediately.
Serve with chopped chives as a garnish. Serve with boiled potatoes.

steps.text: Weigh out 1 untreated orange (150 g), rinse in hot water and rub dry.
Zest the orange peel using a zester. Divide the orange into segments and reserve the juice.
Rinse 400 g fillet of haddock under running water.
Pat dry the fillet of haddock and put on a plate.
Drizzle with the orange juice and sprinkle the orange zest and 1 big pinch of pepper on top. Allow to steep for 10 minutes.

Weigh out 10 carrots 
(600 g).
Clean, peel and wash the carrots and cut into pieces 5 cm long. Cut very thick carrots in half lengthways.
Put 1 tsp butter and 1 tsp sugar into the blender jug.
Add the carrot pieces.
Arrange the carrots in the deep steamer basket and sprinkle with ¼ tsp salt.
Put 1000 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket and hang the shallow steamer basket in it. Put the haddock in the shallow steamer basket.
Sprinkle  with ½ teaspoon of salt and drizzle the marinade on top.  Close the lid.
Carefully remove the lid, add the orange fillets to the carrots in the deep steamer basket and close.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve with boiled potatoes.

name: Minced beef with tomatoes and penne
instructions: Drain the dried tomatoes. Peel and halve the onion and put it with the drained tomatoes in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. Pour the oil in the blender jug, add the meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown using the roast button.

In the meantime, clean and quarter the mushrooms. Put the warm stock, tinned tomatoes, 1 teaspoon of salt, ½ teaspoon of pepper, the paprika powder, sugar and 1 tablespoon of dried Italian herbs in the blender jug. Then, the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 8 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C, then add the penne and mushrooms. Carefully fold in with the spatula and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything using the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions on the penne + 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the blender jug to act as a splash guard. Check at the end of the cooking time that the penne are done and the liquid has boiled off sufficiently. If necessary, cook for a little longer. Remove the penne and meat sauce from the blender jug, stir through carefully before serving and season again with salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.name: 400 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Drain 100 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil and put into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (70 g), and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Add 400 g mixed beef and pork mince.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh in 250 g small brown button mushrooms.
Clean and quarter the mushrooms, then set aside.
Put 600 g warm beef stock into the blender jug.
Add 700 g tinned chopped tomatoes.

Add 1 tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper, 2 tsp sweet paprika powder, 2 pinches of sugar and 
1 tbsp dried Italian herbs.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 400 g penne into the blender jug.
Add the cleaned mushrooms and carefully fold in with the spatula.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
In the next step, adjust the time setting to the time according to the packet instructions on the penne + 2 minutes. Then put the cooking pot on the blender jug as a splash guard.
Check at the end of the cooking time that the penne are done and the liquid has boiled off sufficiently. If necessary, follow the next step; otherwise, skip this step.
Remove the penne and meat sauce from the blender jug, stir through carefully before serving and season again with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Tiramisu
instructions: Prepare a mug of coffee with the instant coffee granules and 120 ml boiling water. Sweeten it with 2 tablespoons of sugar, then leave the coffee too cool down.

Separate the refrigerated eggs. Put the yolks to one side. Put the egg whites in the cold blender jug, insert the mixer attachment and, the measuring beaker not inserted, beat the egg whites for 4 minutes/speed setting 4 until stiff. After 2 minutes, trickle 60 g sugar through the filler opening into the egg whites in the blender jug. Decant the stiff egg whites into a bowl, refrigerate and rinse out the blender jug.

Put the egg yolks and the remaining sugar in the blender jug, attach the mixer attachment and, with the measuring beaker in place, beat for 1 minute/speed setting 4, until you have a light, frothy mixture. Drain off any whey from the refrigerated mascarpone, put the mascarpone in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Add the foamy mascarpone mixture to the egg whites and fold in carefully. Spread a layer of the cream on the base of a flat dish.
Pour the cold coffee into a shallow dish, briefly dip the sponge fingers into the coffee (ensuring that the fingers do not become too soggy) and place on the cream layer.

Spread a layer of the cream over the sponge fingers, smooth out and create another layer with sponge fingers briefly dipped in sponge fingers – if the lower layer of fingers is vertical, then arrange the second layer horizontally (i.e. facing in the other direction). Spread the cream on top again, smooth out and dust with the unsweetened cocoa powder. Place in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.

If you want the sponge fingers a bit softer, leave the tiramisu to stand in the refrigerator for longer.
The tiramisu will keep in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
This dessert can be frozen, preferably in portions, and must be eaten within a month. To defrost, place the tiramisu in the refrigerator the evening before.
Those with a real passion for chocolate can also dust the first cream layer of their tiramisu with the unsweetened cocoa powder if they like!
For a boozier twist, you could replace 2 tablespoons of the coffee with 2 tablespoons of coffee or almond liqueur.

ingredients.name: 120 g sugar + 2 tbsp sugar for the coffee

steps.text: Place a mug on the blender jug and weigh 120 g boiling water into it.
Put 2 tsp instant coffee granules into the mug, sweeten it with 2 tbsp sugar, the leave the coffee to cool.
Separate 2 refrigerated eggs (medium). Set the egg yolks to one side. Put the egg whites into the cold blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 60 g sugar.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, after 2 minutes, trickle the sugar through the filler opening.
Remove the mixer attachment. Transfer the stiff egg whites to a bowl, put it in the fridge and clean out the blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Add the egg yolks to the blender jug.
Add 60 g sugar.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Drain off any whey from the refrigerated mascarpone.
Put the mascarpone (500 g) into the blender jug.
Add the foamy mascarpone mixture to the egg whites and fold in carefully.
Spread a layer of the cream on the base of a flat dish.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 200 g sponge fingers into it.
Pour the cold coffee into a flat dish.
Dip the sponge fingers briefly in the coffee (make sure that they don’t get too soft) and lay them on top of the cream layer.
Spoon another layer of the creamy mixture over the sponge fingers and spread it smooth.
Add another layer of sponge fingers dipped briefly in coffee. If you laid the bottom layer of sponge fingers vertically, lay the second layer horizontally (or vice versa).
Spread with another layer of the cream, smooth it out and dust with 4 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder.
Keep in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving.

name: White bread
instructions: Put the crumbled yeast and 320 ml water at room temperature in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3. Add the flour and 2 teaspoons of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix into a smooth dough with the knead button.
Put the dough in a floured bowl, cover with a clean tea towel and allow to prove in a warm place for 1 hour, until the volume has doubled.

Then, with floured hands, knead the dough through well, put in a loaf tin lined with greaseproof paper, cover and allow the dough to prove for another hour. Pre-heat the oven to 250 °C. Turn down the temperature to 200 °C and bake the bread for 45 minutes. Cool the baked bread on a cake rack.
TIP: If you prefer a round loaf, prove the bread in a round, not overlarge bowl. Then carefully put it in the pre-heated oven and bake immediately.

ingredients.name: flour for the work surface, bowl and your hands

steps.text: Add 320 g water at room temperature.
Crumble in ½ cube fresh yeast (20 g) into the blender jug.
Add 500 g plain flour and 2 tsp salt to the blender jug.
Put the dough in a floured bowl, cover with a clean tea towel and allow to prove in a warm place for 1 hour, until the volume has doubled.
Then, with floured hands, knead the dough through well, put in a loaf tin lined with greaseproof paper, cover and allow the dough to prove for another hour.
Pre-heat the oven to 250 °C (top and bottom heat). Turn down the temperature to 200 °C and bake the bread for 45 minutes.
Cool the baked bread on a cake rack.

name: Green bean stew
instructions: Peel and halve the onion and put it into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Peel the celeriac and carrot, cut them into roughly sized pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 6 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug. Add the oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/5 minutes. Deglaze with the warm vegetable stock. Dice the meat into 1.5 cm cubes and add to the stock. Add the bay leaves, salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil using the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Peel, wash and dice the potatoes and wash, prepare and cut the beans in half. Put both vegetables into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer with the reverse button/20 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Then remove the bay leaf, add the savoury and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down with the reverse button/35 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Before serving, season to taste with salt and pepper.

TIPS Add 1 tablespoon of crème fraîche (30% fat) at the end and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in using the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. This makes the soup creamier. Instead of using boneless beef, you can also use coarse smoked sausage or bacon. Cut the sausage into slices, dice the bacon and add to the soup 10 minutes before the end of the cooking phase. If you like it more substantial, render 150 g diced bacon in a frying pan in addition to the boneless meat and stir it into the soup.

steps.text: Peel and halve 1 onion (80 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1 piece of celeriac (100 g), wash, chop roughly and put into the blender jug.
Peel 1 large carrot (100 g), peel, wash, chop roughly and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp cooking oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 1000 g warm vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 350 g boneless beef.
Dice the meat into 1.5 cm cubes and add to the blender jug.
Add 2 bay leaves, ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 300 g floury potatoes.
Peel, wash and dice the potatoes and put them into the blender jug.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 400 g green beans into it.
Trim, wash and halve the beans and put them into the blender jug.
Remove the bay leaves.
Put 1 tbsp freshly chopped savory into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.

name: Steamed asparagus with potatoes and hollandaise sauce
instructions: To make the hollandaise sauce, make sure that all the ingredients are at room temperature.

Peel the potatoes and asparagus, and cut the woody ends off the asparagus. Wash the potatoes, cut into quarters, place in the cooking pot and sprinkle the salt on top. Arrange the asparagus in the deep steamer basket. Pour 1 litre of water in the blender jug, add 1 pinch of sugar and 1 teaspoon of butter, hang the cooking pot inside the blender jug and attach the deep steamer basket, closed, on top.  Cook using the steamer button, then put the deep steamer basket to one side. Remove the cooking pot and keep the potatoes warm. Empty the blender jug and rinse out with cold water.

To make the sauce, put the butter in chunks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 6 minutes/speed setting 2/70 °C. Decant and let the blender jug cool down for 10 minutes.

Insert the mixer attachment in the blender jug. Put the egg yolk and stock in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, emulsify for 8 minutes/speed setting 3/70 °C. After it has been mixing for 3 minutes, pour the melted butter slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips past the measuring beaker onto the moving blade. Add the butter over a period of 2 minutes. Season the sauce to taste with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Serve the asparagus with the potatoes and the hollandaise sauce.

ingredients.name: 2 tbsp chicken stock at room temperature or white wine
salt, pepper and lemon juice to taste

steps.text: Peel and wash 500 g waxy potatoes, cut into quarters and place in the cooking pot.
Sprinkle 1 tsp salt over the potatoes.
Peel 1000 g asparagus, cut off the woody ends and arrange in the deep steamer basket.
Pour 1000 g water at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 1 pinch of sugar and 1 tsp butter.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close.
Remove the deep steamer basket and put to one side, still closed.
Take out the cooking pot and keep the potatoes warm.
Empty the blender jug and rinse out with cold water.
Put 180 g cubes of butter at room temperature into the blender jug.
Decant the butter and leave the blender jug to cool down for 10 minutes.
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Put 3 very fresh egg yolks at room temperature (medium) into the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp chicken stock at room temperature or white wine.
In the next step, after 3 minutes pour the cooled butter slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (with the measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in.
Season the sauce to taste with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Serve the asparagus with the potatoes and hollandaise sauce.

name: Lemon Curd
instructions: Put the sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, pulverise for 25 seconds/speed setting 10. Use the spatula to scrape the resulting icing sugar down the inside of the blender jug.

Wash the untreated lemon in hot water, dry and zest. Put the zest in the blender jug and then squeeze all the lemons. Put 150 ml lemon juice with the eggs and butter chopped into chunks in the blender jug, and without the measuring beaker inserted, simmer for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Pour the lemon curd while still hot into sterile jars that hold 150 ml and close firmly.

TIPS: The lemon curd will keep for around 3 weeks in the refrigerator. Curd is also delicious made with orange or lime juice. It can be served spread on toast or used to enhance desserts, cakes and flans.

ingredients.name: 3 large lemons (600 g), one of which untreated

steps.text: Put 250 g sugar into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Weigh out 4 large lemons (700 g); 1 should be untreated.
Wash the untreated lemon in hot water, dry it and grate the zest. Add the zest to the blender.
Squeeze the juice of all lemons.
Add 150 g lemon juice to the blender jug.
Add 3 eggs (large).
Add 125 g butter, in pieces.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the still-hot lemon curd into sterile jars, 150 ml each, and close tightly.

name: Courgettes stuffed with bulgur
instructions: Put 150 ml water and ½ teaspoon of salt in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 3 minutes 30 seconds/speed setting1/100 °C. Add the bulgur and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 2. Decant into a bowl and allow to swell for 15 minutes. Rinse out the blender jug with very cold water.

Peel and halve the shallot and put in the blender jug. Clean, wash and cut the pepper into quarters, then chop into large pieces. Break 200 g of feta into pieces, put in the blender jug with the pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the bulgur to the mixture, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix everything using the reverse button/45 seconds/speed setting 3. Help the process by stirring using the spatula through the lid opening. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Clean, wash and halve the courgettes, and scrape out the flesh using a spoon. Place the courgette halves so that they fit in one layer in a dish and fill them with the bulgur mixture. Rinse out the blender jug.

To make the sauce, score the tomatoes crossways, scald with boiling water, remove the skins, cut into quarters, and remove the seeds and stalks. Wash the basil, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks.

Peel the onions and garlic, cut the onions in half, and put them with the garlic and basil in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop using the turbo button/5 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the tomatoes and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 4. Add the olive oil, tomato purée and vegetable stock powder, season with thyme, ½ teaspoon of salt and 2 pinches of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 20 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C.

Pour the finished sauce into the dish, ensuring that approximately half the courgettes are covered with sauce and the rest of the sauce is in between them. Crumble the remaining feta over the courgettes and bake in a hot oven for 30 minutes.

steps.text: Put 150 g water and ½ tsp salt in the blender jug.
Add 150 g bulgur to the blender jug.
Decant into a bowl and allow to swell for 15 minutes. Rinse out the blender jug with cold water.
Peel and halve 1 shallot (30 g) and put in the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 pepper (170 g).
Quarter and deseed the pepper, wash inside and out, chop into large pieces and add to the blender jug.
Add 200 g of feta in pieces to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the bulgur to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, stir using the spatula through the lid opening.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Clean, wash and halve 4 courgettes (150 g each), and scrape out the flesh using a spoon.
Place the courgette halves so that they fit in one layer in a dish and fill them with the bulgur mixture.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Weigh out 1200 g tomatoes.
