Score the tomatoes crossways, scald with boiling water, remove the skins, cut into quarters, remove the seeds and stalks, and put to one side.
Peel 2 onions (160 g) and 2 garlic cloves, cut the onions in half, and put both in the blender jug.
Wash 2 stalks of basil, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Hold the turbo button down for 5 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the prepared tomatoes to the blender jug.
Add 5 tbsp olive oil, 4 tbsp tomato purée and 1 tsp vegetable stock powder into the blender jug.

Add 1 tsp crushed thyme, ½ tsp salt and 
2 pinches of pepper.
Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Pour the finished sauce into the dish, ensuring that approx. half the courgettes are covered with sauce.
Crumble the remaining feta over the courgettes and bake in a hot oven for 30 minutes.

name: Cheese straws
instructions: Cut the cheese into rough pieces and put them in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8.
Put the flour, baking powder, egg, butter in pieces, and the salt in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead into a smooth dough using the knead button.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C.

Roll the dough out on a floured surface until 0.5 cm thick and, using the pastry wheel, cut into strips 1 cm wide. Then place the sticks on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper. Whisk the egg in a cup. Twist the pastry strips, brush with a little egg wash and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake the cheese straws for 15 minutes until golden. If the straws look a little pale, extend the baking time if necessary.
TIP: The cheese straws can be enhanced as desired, for example with 1 teaspoon of dried herbs added to the dough, or sprinkled with a little paprika powder instead of sesame seeds.

steps.text: Cut 120 g Cheddar into rough pieces and put them in the blender jug.
Add 250 g flour to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp baking powder and 1 egg (medium).
Add 125 g soft butter in pieces and 1 tsp salt.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
Roll the dough out on a floured surface until 0.5 cm thick and cut into strips 1 cm wide.
Place the sticks on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper.
Lightly whisk 1 egg (medium) in a cup.
Twist the pastry strips, brush with a little egg wash and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake the cheese straws for 15 minutes until golden. If the straws look a little pale, extend the baking time if necessary.

name: Basic gravy
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C. Put the marrowbone in a pan and roast in the oven for 1 hour. Half way through, turn the bones over once. Take the pan out of the oven and allow the bones to cool for 30 minutes.
Wash, clean and peel the vegetables and chop roughly. Then put them into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 6 seconds/speed setting 5.
Add olive oil and sweat them, the measuring beaker not inserted, with the roast button.
Add the tomato purée and dust the vegetables with the flour. Cook again, the measuring beaker not inserted, with the roast button.
Add the red wine and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down for 10 minutes/speed setting 1/130 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

Put the cooled bones in the cooking pot and hang this in the blender jug. Pour on the hot beef stock, and with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 20 minutes/speed setting 1/110 °C. Using the spatula, remove the cooking pot from the blender jug and dispose of the bones.
Purée the gravy in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 30 seconds/speed setting 7 and then pass the liquid through a fine sieve into a suitable container.

Pour the gravy back into the blender jug, add the sugar beet molasses, and the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down again for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard again.

Season the gravy to taste with salt and pepper. Mix the cornflour with 2 tablespoons lukewarm water until smooth, add to the gravy in the blender jug, and the measuring beaker not inserted, cook for a further 2 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
TIPS If the gravy is not dark enough, add 1 tablespoon caramel during the last step. The gravy will keep for about a week if kept covered in a cool place.

ingredients.name: 1 tbsp caramel for a darker sauce

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (upper and lower heat).
Put 1 kg marrowbone in a pan and roast in the oven for 1 hour. Halfway through, turn the bones over once.
Take the pan out of the oven and allow the bones to cool for 30 minutes.
Wash, peel and roughly chop 2 carrots (140 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Wash, peel and roughly chop 1 piece of celeriac (250 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Peel and roughly chop 3 onions (200 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Pour 30 g olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 1 tbsp tomato purée into the blender jug.
Dust the vegetables in the blender jug with 1 tbsp flour.
Pour 400 g dry red wine into the blender jug.
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Put the cooled bones into the cooking pot and insert this into the blender jug.
Pour 1000 g hot beef stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Using the spatula, remove the cooking pot from the blender jug and dispose of the bones.
Strain the gravy through a fine-mesh sieve into a suitable container.
Pour the gravy back into the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp sugar beet molasses.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season the gravy with salt and pepper.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh out 10 g cornflour.
Mix the cornflour with 2 tbsp lukewarm water until smooth, and add to the blender jug.
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

name: Potato soup with bacon
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves. Put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6, then decant.
Prepare the soup vegetables, peel the carrots and celery, wash the leek thoroughly. Cut the vegetables into roughly sized pieces.
Peel and quarter the onions.

Put the vegetables and onion into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the bacon, sugar and olive oil, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté everything using the roast button.
In the meantime, peel the potatoes and, depending on their size, cut them into quarters or eighths.
Wash the savoury, pat dry and remove the leaves.
Put the vegetable stock, the potatoes and savoury into the blender jug with ½ teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Pour on the cream, add the nutmeg and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 6.
Finally, with the measuring beaker in place, bring the soup to the boil again for 3 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper and serve garnished with parsley.

TIP
If you prefer the soup richer, roll 500 g ground pork into little walnut-sized balls and space them out in the shallow steamer basket. Hang the shallow steamer basket in the deep steamer basket, close and cook the soup as described above. Then put the little meatballs into the soup and allow to infuse in the closed blender jug for 7 minutes.

ingredients.name: 1 bunch of vegetables (150 g carrots, 150 g celery, 50 g leeks)
1 l vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash 4 stalks of savory, pat dry, remove the leaves and put to one side.
Wash ½ bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves from the stalks and put into the blender jug.
Decant the parsley into a bowl.
Clean and peel 150 g carrots, cut into roughly sized pieces and put into the blender jug.
Clean and peel 150 g celeriac, cut into roughly sized pieces and add.
Clean and wash 50 g leeks, cut into roughly sized pieces and add.
Peel 1 onion (80 g), quarter and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 75 g diced smoked bacon.
Add 1 pinch of brown sugar and 4 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 1000 g primarily waxy potatoes.
During the next step, peel and wash the potatoes and, depending on their size, cut them into quarters or eighths. Set aside.
Put 1000 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add the potatoes, savory and ½ tsp salt.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 200 g cream at room temperature and 2 big pinches of nutmeg.
Season the soup with salt and pepper.
Serve the potato soup garnished with parsley.
